(1) 1 - Ibn Chehab reported that Omar Ibn Abdel-Aziz once delayed the prayer (of asr). Ourwa Ibn Al-Zoubair went to his house and told him that Al-Moughira Ibn Chou'ba had delayed for one day the prayer, then that he was in Kufa; Abu Mass'oud Al-Ansari entered his home and said, “What does that mean, O Moughira? Didn't you know that Gabriel came down from the sky, made the (midday) prayer and the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) also made it, then Gabriel made the prayer (of the asr) and the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him be grace and peace of Allah) did it, then Gabriel made the prayer (of the sunset) and the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) also made her then Gabriel made the (evening) prayer and the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) also did it, then Gabriel made the (dawn) prayer and the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) did it? Subsequently Gabriel said, "This is what you are commanded". And Omar Ibn Abdel-Aziz replied: “Make sure better about what you report, O Ourwa! Is it Gabriel who indicated the times of prayer to the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace)? Ourwa replied: "I am only doing a repetition of what Bachir Ibn Abi Mass'oud Al-Ansari reported from his father. 
(2) 2 - Aisha, the wife of Prophet r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be grace and peace of Allah) reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) was doing, in his apartment, the two noon and asr prayers before the sun was too raised. (It must be understood by this that the shadow had not yet invaded the apartment of Aisha, the wife of the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be grace and peace of Allah)). 
(3) 3 - Ata Ibn Yassar reported that a man came to find the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) and asked him the time of the prayer of the dawn, but he did not answer her. And when it was next day, the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) made the Righteous Dawn Prayer at dawn, and two days later, he did it by the light of the day, then asked, "where is the man who came to ask me about time of the (dawn) prayer?” The man replied, "Here I am oh Messenger of Allah. The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) replied: "It is to be located between these two times. 
(4) 4 - Aisha, the wife of the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) reported that: "while the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) was praying the dawn prayer, the women left the mosque, caulked with their coats, like so much so that you couldn't recognize them in the dark". 
(5) 5 - Abu Hurairah reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) ra said: "He who manages to make a raka't of the prayer of the dawn before the appearance of the sun, it is as if he made the prayer at his fixed time; and the one who reaches to make a raka't of the prayer of the asr before sunset, it is as if he made the prayer at its fixed time”. 
(6) 6 - Nafe', slave of Abdallah Ibn Omar, reported that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab had written to his prefects: "prayer is the thing I hold dear importance is he who makes it to perfection, and retains it forever, kept his religion. Whoever misses it, will be able to neglect what is much less important. And he adds: “say the prayer of the noon, when the shadow of a thing is one cubit, until the shadow of one of you is as long as his height. The prayer of the asr is, so long as the sun is high in the sky, white and pure, and a rider can ride two or three parasangs before it sets; bedtime prayer is at disappearance of the sun; that of the evening, when the twilight disappears until the flow of the first third of the night. Whoever sleeps without doing it, may Allah not make him sleep, whoever sleeps without doing it, may Allah not make him sleep, whoever sleeps without doing it, may Allah not make him sleep. As for the dawn prayer, you do it so much that the stars seem twinkling and intertwined. (7)7-Omar wrote to Abou Moussa: "Do the midday prayer when the sun begins to leave the meridian; the asr prayer when it is white and clear before it turns yellow; the sunset prayer when this one disappears; evening prayer may be delayed until the end from the first third of the night; and that of the dawn is to be done when the stars are bright and intertwined. Recite in this prayer two long suras of the "Moufassal". 
(8) 8 - Omar Ibn Al-Khattab wrote to Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari: “say the asr prayer as long as the sun is still white and pure, and a rider can travel a distance of three parasangs (before it sets); the evening one is to be done while stretching until the end of the first third of the night; and if you want to delay it, until midnight, so be it, but take care not to be among the careless (not to neglect)". 
(9) 9 - Abdallah Ibn Rafe', the freedman of Oum Salama the wife of the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) asked Abu Huraira of the subject of times of prayer; he replied: "I'll give them to you show: do the midday prayer when your shadow is at the height of the your size, that of the asr when your shadow is double, that of the sunset when it disappears, and that of the evening in the time that separates you from the third of the night. The dawn prayer is at do as long as it is still dark". 
(10) 10 - Aiias Ibn Malek said, “We were doing the asr prayer and one of we could go to the neighborhood of Bani Awf, and find them doing the same prayer”. 
(11) 11 - Anas Ibn Malek said: "We were praying the asr, and whoever could go to Qoubaa and the sun was still high". 
(12) 12 - Al-Kassem Ibn Muhammad said: “I met the companions of the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) not (always) making the midday prayer only when it is cool”. Chapter II Friday prayer time 
(13) 13 - Souhail Ibn Malek reported from his father that he said, "I saw, on Friday, a carpet belonging to Akil Ibn Abi Taleb, well spread out on the wall of the side of the mosque. The carpet being overshadowed, Omar Ibn Al-Khattab, entered the mosque and said the Friday prayer”. Malek (the father of Souhail) added: “having finished the prayer, we abandoned ourselves to the siesta of the heat wave”. 
(14) 14 - Ibn Abi Salit reported that Osman Ibn Affan performed the Friday prayer in Medina and that of the asr in Malal. And Malek explains about it: "it was to pray at the first hour of noon and to speed up the march. Chapter III The one who manages to make a single raka't in common. 
(15) 15 - Abu Huraira reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “He who manages to to make a single raka't in common, it is as if he has made the whole prayer”. 
(16) 16 - AbduBah Ibn Omar Ibn Al Khattab used to say: "if you have failed in the inclination in common, it's as if you missed a raka't”. (lit a prostration). 
(17) 17 - Abdullah Ibn Omar and Zaid Ibn Thabet used to say: “He who manages to do the common inclination is that he has accomplished a raka't”. 
(18) 18 - Abou Houraira used to say: "He who manages to make the inclination by common, will have made a raka't in common; and the one who missed the recitation of the "fatiha", (the mother of the Book) "is that he has lost so many goods". Chapter IV The setting sun and the darkness of the night. 
(19) 19 - Abdullah Ibn Omar used to say: "the decline of the sun signifies the moment where it leaves the meridian”. 
(20) 20 - Abdallah Ibn Abbas said: "the setting of the sun is the moment of the appearance of shadow, and the darkness of night is at dusk this one, becoming very dark”. Chapter V The appointed time of prayer 
(21) 21 - Abdallah Ibn Omar reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "Whoever misses the prayer of the asr, has lost his family and his possessions”. 
(22) 22 - Yahya Ibn Sa'id reported that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab, finishing the asr prayer, passed a man who had missed her; Omar said to him: "what's wrong with you prevented from doing the asr in common?” The man apologized and Omar replied, "You deprived yourself of your reward." 
(23) 23 - Yahya Ibn Sa'id said: "He who prays, should make his prayer at his time fixed; but if he delays it, he will have lost his best reward or which would be better for him than his family and his goods”. Malek said: “The man who finds himself traveling and who delays his prayer, either out of carelessness either by forgetting, until he meets his family, if he is at home himself and that he is on time, that he says his entire prayer as if he is in town, but if he is present and the time has elapsed, that he shorten it, like that of a traveler, because he will only do what he had to do (as the case may be). And Malek added: “It is what I have seen men do at home (in Medina), as well as those who are versed in religion”. Malek also said: "the twilight is the red glow seen after sunset; when this glow disappears, it will be time for the evening prayer and will have exceeded that of the sunset prayer. 
(24) 24 - Nafe'a reported that Abdallah Ibn Omar fainted and lost consciousness; (recovering to his senses, he did not make the missed prayer)». Malek said, “I think, and Allah r knows better than anyone, that the time had passed. As to to him who regains consciousness at the moment of prayer, he must do it. Chapter VI Lying down before performing the prayer. 
(25) 25 - Sa'id Ibn Al-Mussaiab reported: "returning from the battle of Khaibar, the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) walked at night" and when he was almost midnight he camped and said to Bilal: “wake us up at the time of the dawn prayer”. The Envoy of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) slept and all his companions; As for Bilal, he stayed awake as long as Allah willed, then he leaned his back against his mount just before dawn and his eyes closed despite himself. Nobody woke up, neither one of companions, nor the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) ni Bilal, just at the time desired; they woke up only under the effect of solar heat. As the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) was surprised, Bilal said to him: "O Messenger of Allah, the one who has took away your soul took away the mine". The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said to men: "let's go, road". The men spurred on their mounts and set off, and after walking some distance, he ordered Bilal to do the call to prayer. The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) made the dawn prayer, and when the prayer is finished, he says: “Whoever omits a prayer, let him do it when he remembers", for Allah Y the Blessed and the Most High has says: “Say prayer in remembrance of Me” (Koran XX, 14). 
(26) 26 - Zaid Ibn Aslam reported: “one night, going to Makkah, the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) halted and charged Bilal to wake men at the time of prayer (dawn). Bilal slept like all men. When the sun was already up, above the horizon, the men woke up all frightened; so, the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) ordered them to go up and leave to come out of the valley (where they were) saying, "A demon is found in this valley. They went up and left the valley, then the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) ordered them to come down and do their ablutions and asked Bilal to call for prayer. The Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Be upon him be grace and peace of Allah) made the dawn prayer in common; once prayer finished, and noticing their fright, he said to them: "Men! Allah has taken away our souls, and if he wills, he will have given them back to us in other circumstances. When one of you falls asleep without having said his prayer, or has forgotten to say it, let him accomplish it when he remembers it, just as if he had done it at his fixed time". The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) turned towards Abu Bakr in saying: "the devil came to surprise Bilal when he wanted to do the prayer, and put him to sleep; he never ceases to rock him like a mother who nods her little one. Then the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him grace and peace of Allah) having summoned Bilal, the latter told him what the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him grace and peace of Allah) said to Abu Bakr who exclaimed: "I testify that you are the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam)” Chapter VII Prohibition of midday prayer during the heat wave. 
(27) 27 - Ata Ibn Yassar reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “the stifling heat comes from the emanation of Gehenna, When the heat becomes so ardent, wait for the coolness to say the (midday) prayer”. And he added, "Hell complained to the Lord, saying, Lord, my parts devoured each other; Allah allowed him to have each year two breaths: one in winter, and another in summer”. 
(28) 28 - Abu Hurairah narrated that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) said: "when the heat becomes suffocating, wait, for prayer, the moment of coolness, for the heat originates in Gehenna". Abu Huraira added that: "hell complained to his lord, who allowed him to have every year two breaths: one in winter, and one in summer”. 
(29) 29 - Abu Huraira reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "when the heat becomes so intense, wait for the coolness to make the prayer, because the heat comes from the ardor of the fire of Gehenna". Chapter VIII The ban on entering the mosque after eating garlic and cover your mouth 
(30) 30 - Sa'id Ibn Al-Musaiab reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) said, "Whoever eats of this plantation, must move away from our mosques, so as not to bother us by the smell of garlic. 
(31) 31 - Abdel Rahman Ibn Al-Mujabbar reported that whenever Salem Ibn Abdallah saw a man, cover his mouth, while praying, by his garment, he pulled him with force by the garment until he pulled it away from his mouth”. MOUATTAA Book 2 Ritual Purity Chapter One Ablutions 
(32) 1 - Amr Ibn Yahia Al-Mazini reported from his father that he told Abdallah Ibn Zaid Ibn Assem the grandfather of Amr Ibn Yahia Al-Mazini and one of companions of the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah): “Can you show me how the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) performed his ablutions”? Abdallah replied: “Certainly, yes”. He had water brought, poured on his two hands, washed them twice, rinsed his mouth, brought in some water in his nose by sniffing it three times, then he washed his face three times, and his arms up to his elbows twice, then he rubbed his head with both hands, rubbing them from before to back then from back to front and starting from the top of the head, going towards the occiput, finally he washed his feet". 
(33) 2 - Abu Huraira narrated that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) said: "when one of you does his ablutions, whether he pours water into his nose-or his nostrils, then he rejects it, and when he wants to wipe himself, he uses stones of an odd number". 
(34) 3 - Abu Hurairah reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) said: “He who does his ablutions that he makes water enter his nostrils then that he rejects it, the one who wants to wipe himself that he uses an odd number of stones. 
(35) 4 - Yahia has reported that he heard Malek say, "There is no harm, when the man, doing his ablutions, draws water once to rinse his mouth and pours it into his nostrils and then reject it". 
(36) 5 Abdel-Rahman Ibn Abu Bakr reported: “the day when died Sa'd Ibn Abi waqas, he entered Aicha, the wife of the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) and asked that they bring him water for his ablutions. Aisha said to him: "O Abdel-Rahman, do the righteous ablutions, for I heard the Apostle of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) say: “woe to the heels of being touched by fire”. 
(37) 6 Osman Ibn Abdel-Rahman reported that his father said he heard (or saw) Omar Ibn Al-Khattab doing his ablutions (washing his feet) until his izar (i.e. half-legs). 
(38) 7 Yahia said, “we asked Malek about a man who while doing his ablutions, forgets when starting to wash your face before rinsing your mouth or wash your arms before your face? He answered: "He who washes his face before rinsing his mouth, that he rinses his mouth without washing his face again; as for the one who wash your arms before his face, that he washes his face and then washes his arms again as long as he is continuing his ablution”. 
(39) 8 - Yahia said: “Malek was asked about a man who prays (but he remembers while performing ablutions), he forgot to rinse his mouth or sniff the water. He replied, "He must not repeat his prayer, but if he is still in a state of purity (and wants to make the next prayer) let him rinse his mouth and sniff the water. Chapter II The ablutions of the man who wakes up and wants to pray. 
(40) 9 - Abu Hurairah reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) said: "If any of you wakes up, washes his hands before he begins his ablution, for he cannot know where he put his hands while he slept. 
(41) 10 - Omar Ibn Al-Khattab said: "When one of you goes to bed lying down, let him perform ablution (whenever he wants pray)". (...) 11 - Malek a narrated from Zaid Ibn Aslam, about the interpretation of this verse (meaning): “O you believers! When you get up to pray, wash your faces, then, and your hands up to the elbows, and pass your wet hands over your heads, and wash your feet until ankles” (Koran V, 6) that means when you wake up”. (42) 12,- Malek said, "One should not perform ablution after bleeding from the nose, or because of a wound from which flows blood, or pus; surprised also should not make them until after something is released from the two outlets, or after a sleep”. Malek has reported from Nafe that Ibn Omar did not his ablutions when he dozed off and even prayed. Chapter III The subject of pure water for ablution. 
(43) 13 - Abu Huraira reported that a man came to the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) and said to him: “O Messenger of Allah, we sailed on the high seas, and carried but little water with us; so if we used it for ablution, we would no longer have what to drink; so should we use this water for ablution”? He answered him: "the water of the sea is purifying, and its fishing is lawful". 
(44) 14 - Kabcha bint ka'b Ibn Malek, the wife of Ibn Abi Katada the Medinan reported that Abu Katada entered her home; she brought him water for her ablutions, but a cat had approached to drink from this water; he tilted the vase to her until she was satisfied. Noticing that I was watching him, he said to me: “oh, the daughter of my brother, are you surprised? I answered him: "Yes". He replied: “The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "These animals do not do not contaminate the water because they frequent you often (i.e. they live among you). Malek said: “there is nothing wrong with that, unless the man notice a certain impurity on the mouth of this cat”. 
(45) 15 - Abdel Rahman Ibn Hateb reported that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab came out at the head of a cavalry of which Amr Ibn Al-As was a part, until their arrived near a basin, Amr Ibn Al'-As said to its owner: "O a Phone! Do wild beasts often come to drink from your pond? Omar Ibn Al-Khattab addressing the owner said: "Don't answer because we often frequent these beasts, and they also frequent us”. 
(46) 16 - Abdallah Ibn Omar often said: "in the time of the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) women and men performed ablution together”. Chapter IV Of what does not require repeating ablution 
(47) 17 - The mother of a son of Ibrahim Ibn Abdel-Rahman Ibn Awf asked Oum Salama for the wife of the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah): “I am a woman who walk in filthy places and leave the end of my garment dragging" (should I perform ablution when I want to pray). Her him replied, "The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “(The sand) clears the garments of all impurity”. 
(48) 18 - Malek reported that he saw Rabi'a Ibn Abdel-Rahman often vomit into the mosque, without leaving this place, and did not redo his ablutions even before the prayer”. Malek was asked at about a man who vomited while throwing back what he had eaten; should he redo his ablutions? He replied, "He could not do it again, but let him rinse his mouth and wash it". 
(49) 19 - Nafe’a reported that Abdallah Ibn Omar had embalmed a son of Sa'id, who is dead; he took it to the mosque and makes his prayer without ablutions”. Malek was asked: “should we do ablution again after vomiting”? He replied, "No, but that one rinses the mouth, and that one washes it”. Chapter V Failure to repeat ablution after eating roast. 
(50) 20 - Abdallah Ibn Abbas reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) ate from the shoulder of a roast sheep, then he made his pray without redoing his ablutions”. 
(51) 21 - Suwaid Ibn An-Nu'man reported that in the year of Khaibar he set out with the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) and arrived at Al-Sahaba, a locality very close to Khaibar, the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) descended, made the prayer of the asr, then he ordered that the provisions be brought. As only sawiq was brought, he ordered that it be moistened with water, then he ate some and we ate. Then he contented himself with rinsing his mouth, and we We did the same, and made the sunset prayer without redoing his ablutions". 
(52) 22 - Rabi'a Ibn Abdallah Ibn Al-Houdair reported that he had dinner with Omar Ibn Al-Khattab, then he prayed without redoing his ablutions”. 
(53) 23 - Aban Ibn Osman reported that Osman Ibn Affan ate bread and meat, he rinsed his mouth, washed his hands, then he rubbed them over his face, then he prayed without redoing the ablutions. 
(54) 24 - It was reported to Malek that Ali Ibn Abi Taleb and Abdallah Ibn Abbas did not redo their ablutions after eating meat roasted. 
(55) 25 - Yahia Ibn Sa'id asked Abdallah Ibn Amer Ibn Rabi'a about the man who does his ablutions for the prayer, then he eats what the fire has touched, should he redo his ablutions? He replied, "I saw my father eat roast meat without redoing his ablutions". 
(56) 26 - Jaber Ibn Abdallah Al-Ansari reported that he saw Abu Bakr Al-Siddiq eat roast meat then pray without redoing ablutions. 
(57) 27 - Muhammad Ibn Al-Mounkader reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) was invited to a meal; we him served bread and (roasted) meat, he ate it and then he made his ablutions and prayed. As he was later presented with, from the rest of this put it, he ate it and then prayed without redoing his ablutions. (58) 28- Abdel Rahman Ibn Yazid Al-Ansari reported that when Anas Ibn Malek returned from Iraq, Abu Talha and Ubai Ibn Ka'b came to find him; he presented them with a dish that the fire had touched. They ate, and like Anas performed his ablutions after eating, they said to him, "What does this mean Oh Anas? Do we do this in Iraq”? And Anas answered: "as I wished don't do that”! Abou Talha and Oubai Ibn Ka'b stood up, made the prayer without redoing their ablutions. Chapter VI Integral ablution 
(59) 29 - Hisham Ibn Ourwa reported from his father that he asked the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him be grace and the peace of Allah) about cleansing after satisfying a natural need, he replied, “Will any of you be unable to find three stones (to wipe oneself)”?. 
(60) 30 - Abu Huraira reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) went out to go to the cemetery. Arriving there, he said, “Peace be upon you O abode of people believers, as for us, we will join you if it pleases Allah. As I wished I had seen our brothers”. They said to him, "O Messenger of Allah, are we not your brothers?" He replied, "No, rather you are my companions, for our brothers are those who have not yet come. I I will get ahead of you at the pool". He was asked: “O Messenger of Allah how will you recognize those who have not yet come from your community? He replied, "Do you think that if a man has horses that have white spots on the forehead and feet, wouldn't he recognize them if they were among other black horses”? He was answered: “Certainly yes, O Messenger of Allah. He resumed: “(So shall my brothers be) who will come in the day of resurrection, having bright marks foreheads and feet, because of their ablutions, and I advance to the basin. Men in my community will be taken away from my pelvis like a stray camel, and I'll call them, "Come on, come there, come there! They will answer me: "you don't know what they did after you". I will then exclaim: “let them perish, let them perish, let them perish”!. 
(61) 31 - Humran the freedman of Osman Ibn Affan reported that Osman sat on the mosque seat; the muezzin came to tell him that it is time for the pray. Osman asked for water to be brought to him, and performed his ablutions then said, “By Allah! I am going to tell you a hadith, which if not was in the Book of Allah, I would not have brought it to you". Then he says: “I heard the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) say: "There is not a Muslim who does not perform ablutions perfectly, then prays, without May he be forgiven for the faults committed between this very moment until performance of the following prayer". Malek said, "I think he was referring to this verse: 'Acquite prayer at both ends of the day and several times during the night. Yes good deeds dissipate bad ones; this is a reminder for those who remember” (Koran XI, 114). 
(62) 32 - Abdallah Al-Sanabihi reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "when the servant believer, rinses his mouth, performing ablution, his faults come out of his mouth. When he inhales water from his nostrils and rejects it, his faults come out of his nose. When he washes his face, his faults come out of his face and even from the edges of his eyelids. When he washes his hands, his faults come out of his very hands under his fingernails. When he rubs his head, his faults come out from his head and even from his ears. When he washes his feet, his faults come out of his feet and from under his fingernails. Finally his march to the mosque, and the prayer will be for him a supererogatory work". 
(63) 33 - Abu Hurairah narrated that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be the grace and peace of Allah) said: "when the worshiper Muslim (or believer) does his ablutions and washes his face, each fault committed by his eyes, will come out with water (or with last water drop). When he washes his hands, any fault he has made with his hands will come out with the water (or with the last drop of water). When he washes his feet, every fault committed by his feet will come out with the water (or with the last drop of water), that in the end he will be cleansed of all fault”. 
(64) 34 - Anas Ibn Malek a reported: “I saw the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) and it was time for the Asr prayer. As the men did not find water for their ablutions, they brought to the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) a vessel containing water, where he put his hand in it. Then he asked the men to do their ablutions. Anas continued, "I saw the water gushing out from under his fingertips. so that all the men have all performed their ablutions”. 
(65) 35 - Abu Houraira said, "He who performs ablution perfectly and then goes out to the mosque for prayer, he will be considered in prayer as long as he does not will seek only to pray. For each step taken, a good action and a bad one will be erased. When one of you (going to the mosque) hears the second call to prayer, that he do not hasten the step, because, he will have the greatest reward, the one who lives furthest from the mosque. We asked to Abou Houraira: "by virtue of what, Abou Houraira"? He replied, "because of the length of the journey which he will cross". 
(66) 36 - Sa'id Ibn Al-Musaiab was asked about cleansing with water after satisfying a natural need he replied, "It is required of women". 
(67) 37 - Abu Hurairah reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "if the dog lap up the vessel of one of you, let him wash the vessel seven times”. 
(68) 38 - It was reported to Malek, that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the favor and peace of Allah) said: “stay skillful, you cannot number (the pious works); work, and know that the Your best works are prayers, and no one performs ablution than a believer”. Chapter VII Head and ear rubbing 
(69) 39 - Nafe' reported that Abdallah Ibn Omar dipped his fingers in water and rubbed his ears. 
(70) 40 - Jaber Ibn Abdallah Al-Ansari, asked about rubbing on the turban, replied: "No, because, one must pass wet hands on the head. 
(71) 41 - Hisham Ibn Ourwa reported that his father Ourwa Ibn Az-Zoubair, "took off his turban, and rubbed his head with his wet hands. 
(72) 42 - Nafe' reported that he saw Safia Bint Abi Oubaid, Abdallah's wife Ibn Omar, uncovering himself and passing his wet hands over his head”. Nafe', at that time, was very young. Malek was asked about rubbing the turban and veil, he replied: “a man should not rub his turban, nor a woman her veil; they must both pass their wet hands over their heads”. We also asked Malek about a man who did his ablutions but forgot to rub his head until the water ran out dried"?. He replied, "I think he must be rubbing his head, and if he has already said his prayer, let him do it again”. Chapter VIII From rubbing boots (Khouffs) 
(73) 43 - Al Moughira Ibn Chou'ba reported that "the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) during the battle of Tabuk, went out to satisfy a natural need. Al Moughira continued: “I I accompanied him carrying water, and when he returned, I poured him water, he washed his face then wanting to bring out both his hands sleeves of his tunic, and failing to do so, he took them out then from under his tunic, washed them then passed his damp hands over his head and rubbed on his boots. As the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) then returned to the Muslims, he found Abdel-Rahman Ibn Auf presiding over the prayer in performing a single raka't the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) made the remaining raka't (in presiding over the prayer). Prayer finished, and as the men were amazed, he said to them, "You have done well". 
(74) 44 - Nafe' and Abdallah Ibn Dinar reported that Abdallah Ibn Omar arrived at Kufa and presented himself to Sa'd Ibn Abi Waqas, who was governor of town, and found him rubbing on his boots. As he disavowed his gesture, Sa'd said to him: "once back to your father ask him about it”. Back home, Abdallah forgot to ask his father, until Sa'd came and said to him: “did you ask your father”? He replied: "No". Abdullah questioning his father, Omar replied: "When you bring in your feet in the boots and let them be pure (i.e. after the ablution), rub on them (If you perform ablution again). Again Abdallah asked: "If one of us comes from a hidden place (after having satisfies a natural need”)? Omar replied: “even if one of you comes from a hidden place”. 
(75) 45 - Nafe' reported that Abdallah Ibn Omar had urinated in the market, then his ablutions while washing his face, hands and passed his wet hands over his head. He was summoned to do the funeral prayer on a dead man; he entered the mosque, rubbed on his boots, and made the pray. 
(76) 46 - Sa'id Ibn Abdel-Rahman Ibn Rouqaich reported that he saw Anas Ibn Malek urinating while in Qouba. He had water brought and performed his ablutions, washing his face and hands up to the elbows, then he passed his wet hands over his head and rubbed on the boots, he entered the mosque and prayed". Malek was asked "at the about a man who performed his ablutions as if to pray, then he put on his boots, urinated, took off his shoes, and put on his new should he perform ablution again? He answered: "let him take off his shoes and washes the feet; but will have to rub on the boots, the one who had puts his feet into the boots after ablution. As for he, who has made his feet enter the boots without their being pure following the ablutions, he will not have to rub on the boots”. We Malek also asked about a man who performed his ablutions while putting on his boots and who forgot to rub on his boots, until the water has dried, then his prayer”. He answered: “that he rubs on the boots, and that he redo the prayer, without redoing the ablutions. Malek about a man who washed his feet, put on his boots, then performed ablution”? He answered: "let him take off his shoes, let him perform his ablutions and then wash his feet”. Chapter IX How to rub on ankle boots

(83) 53 - Abdel Rahman Ibn Al-Mujabbar reported that he saw Salem Ibn Abdallah blood him flowing from the nose, so that he wet his fingers. He wiped it off then continued the prayer without redoing the ablutions”. Chapter XII What to do when blood is flowing profusely 
(84) 54 - Al Miswar Ibn Makhrama reported "that the night Omar was stabbed Ibn Al-Khattab, he entered his house to wake him up to do the dawn prayer. Omar replied: “Certainly, yes, because is no longer considered as a Muslim, one who neglects prayer". Omar then did the prayer and the blood continued to flow from his wound”. 
(85) 55 - Sa'id Ibn Al Moussaiab asked the faithful: “what do you think, of what a man must do, if the blood flows incessantly from his nose. Sa'id Ibn Al Moussaiab continued: "I think he must nod his head without make her move”. Malek said, "That was preferably, the best answer I've heard." Chapter XIII Ablutions after oozing. 
(86) 56 - Al-Miqdad Ibn Al-Aswad reported that Ali Ibn Abi Taleb instructed him to ask for the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) concerning a man, who approaching his wife, oozed (mazi), on what he should do”? Ali continued, "As I have a wife, the daughter of the envoy of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) I am ashamed to ask him such a question”. Al-Miqdad asked for the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) on the matter in question, and he replied: "When one of you suffers such a following, that he sprinkles his rod with water, and perform ablution as for prayer". 
(87) 57 - Umar Ibn Al-Khattab said, “I sometimes feel (the mazi) running down my thigh like a pearl. Whoever undergoes such a phenomenon, that he washes his rod and make ablutions as for prayer". 
(88) 58 - Joundob, the slave of Abdallah Ibn Ayyach reported that he asked Abdallah Ibn Omar about the mazi; he replied: "when you sense, wash your rod and perform your ablutions as for prayer". Chapter XIV Authorization not to repeat ablutions, to the one who has an ooze (says mazi) 
(89) 59 - A man asked Sa'id Ibn Al-Musaiab: “sometimes i feel wet by the mazi, and that by praying; should I suspend my prayer”? Sa'id him answered: "Even if my thigh is all wet, I will not leave the prayer before finishing it". 
(90) 60 - Al-Salt Ibn Zuyaid reported that he asked Suleiman Ibn Yassar: “I find myself all wet from the mazi, (in which case, what should I make)?. He replied, "Sprinkle whatever is below your clothes, and don't think about it anymore". Chapter XV Performing ablution again, if one touches the rod 
(91) 61 - Ourwa Ibn Az-Zoubair reported: "I entered the house of Marwan Ibn Al-Hakam, and we had a talk about what requires ablution. marwan said: "among other things, that we touch the rod". Ourwa replied: “Busra Bint Safwan let me know that she heard the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) say: "when one of you touch his rod, let him perform ablution". 
(92) 62 - Mus'ab Ibn Sa'id Ibn Abi Waqas reported: “As I held the Quran for Sa'id Ibn Abi Waqas, I scratched myself (the inner parts). Sa'd says to me, “maybe you touched your rod”? I answered him: “Yes”. He replied, “go do your ablutions”. I got up to do them and I came back». 
(93) 63 - Abdallah Ibn Omar often said: "If one of you touches his penis, he must do his ablutions". 
(94) 64 - Hisham Ibn Ourwa reported that his father said: “Whoever touches his rod must perform ablution”.

(96) 66 - Salem Ibn Abdallah reported: "being on a trip with Abdallah Ibn Omar, I I saw him, after sunrise, doing his ablutions and praying". I say to him, "That's a prayer I haven't seen you pray before"? He answered me: "after I made the dawn prayer, I touched my penis. And as I forgot to do my ablutions I did them, and I came back to say my prayers”. Chapter XVI A man who kisses his wife must perform ablution. 
(97) 67 - Abdallah Ibn Omar often said: "A kiss that a man gives to his woman or the act of caressing her constitutes touching. Whoever kisses his wife or caresses her with his hand, must do his ablutions”.

(99) 69 - Ibn Chehab said: "When a man kisses his wife, he must do his ablutions". Malek said, "That's the best I've heard about it." Chapter XVII The lotion following a ritual impurity 
(100) 70 - Aisha, the mother of believers reported: "When the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) wanted to make a lotion to the following a ritual impurity due to carnal relations, he began by washing his hands, then bathed himself as if to do the prayer, then he dipped his fingers in the water and passed them in her hair, then poured water over her head, for three times then, drawing the water with his palms, finally he poured the water on his whole body." 
(101) 71 - Aisha, the mother of believers reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) made the lotion as a result of carnal commerce using a vase called Faraq.

He sprinkled water on his eyes, washed his right hand then his left, washed his head, then he washed everything the body by spreading water. 
(103) 73 - We let it be known to Malek that Aisha was asked about the woman's lotion at the continued carnal intercourse; she replied: “let her pay three handfuls of water on her head, then she washes her hair". Chapter XVIII Having to make a lotion, when the two circumcised parts (male and female) touch each other. 
(104) 74 - Sa'id Ibn Al Moussaiab reported that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab, Osman Ibn Affan and Aicha said: "when the two circumcised parts (the male genitals and female), touch each other, one must obligatorily make a lotion (ghusl)". 
(105) 75 - Abu Salama Ibn Abd Al-Rahman Ibn Awf reported that he asked Aisha, the wife of the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) regarding the obligation of the lotion; she replied, “Abou Salama, do you know what it looks like? Hey yes, to a rooster that hears others sing, to sing with. When the two circumcised parts (the male and female genitals), touch and that there is penetration, it is the duty to make the lotion". 
(106) 76 - Sa'id Ibn Al Musaiab reported that Abu Musa Al-Ach'ari came to see Aisha the wife of the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa hello) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) and said to him: "he It is painful for me to see the companions of the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) in a debate about a question whose importance leads me to ask you". She replied: “What is this question? What you used to ask your mother, ask her me"? He replied, "This is a man who trade with his wife then he stops without ejaculating"? She says, "when there is penetration of a genital organ in the other, the lotion is obligatory”. Abu Musa replied: "That's a question I'll never ask anyone but you." 
(107) 77 - Mahmoud Ibn Zoubaid Al-Ansari asked Zaid Ibn Thabet "about the man who had a carnal relationship with his wife then he stops without ejaculating (that should he do in this case)”? Zaid replied: "Let him make a lotion". Mahmoud replied "but Ubai Ibn Ka'b does not find that the lotion is obligatory”. Zaid retorted: "Oubai Ibn Ka'b had changed his mind before he died". 
(108) 78 - Abdullah Ibn Umar used to say, "Once the male genitalia enters the female organ, the lotion is obligatory duty”. Chapter XIX The ablutions of man in a state of ritual impurity when he wants go to bed or eat before doing the lotion; 
(109) 79 - Abdallah Ibn Omar reported that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab said to the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) that he happens to be in a state of impurity during the night. The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) answered him: “Do your ablutions, wash your rod, and sleep”. (110).80. Chapter XX Prayer of him who is in a state of ritual impurity, his lotion when he remembers and washing his garment. 
(112) 82 - Ata Ibn Yassar reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) at the beginning of one of his prayers, after having made the takbir, signaled to the faithful to keep their place. He left and came back and we could see the traces of water on his skin. 
(113) 83 - Zubaid Ibn As-Sait reported: “I left with Omar Ibn Al-Khattab to Aljourf (a locality three miles from Medina). Remembering that he has had an erotic dream, he said the prayer without making the lotion, then he said, "I've been living a dream sex without noticing, and I said the prayer without making the lotion". Then he made a lotion, washed his garment, getting rid of the traces he did not see, then he made the first and second calls to prayer, and prayed just as the sun was high in the horizon. 
(114) 84 - Soulaiman Ibn Yassar reported that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab departed morning at his land in Aljourof. Seeing on his garment the traces of semen, he exclaimed: "Since I have taken care of the affairs of the people, I am a victim of erotic dreams”. He made a lotion, took off with water the traces of sperm, then he prayed while the sun was already high. 
(115) 85 - Soulaiman Ibn Yassar reported that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab prayed together with the men then departed to his estate at Aljourof. As he lives cum on his clothes he says 'since we eat meat greasy, the veins have softened”. So he made a lotion, removed the traces of sperm from his clothing and then he said the prayer". 
(116) 86 - Yahia Ibn Abdel-Rahman Ibn Abi Hateb reported that he made the pious visit with Omar Ibn Al-Khattab in the company of a troop of horsemen among whom was Amr Ibn Al'-As. Omar Ibn Al-Khattab halted at night and camped on a road near a water source. Omar had a dream erotic, and, as dawn was breaking and finding no water with the horsemen he mounted and searched until he was near from the water source; he washed away the traces of semen with water as the dawn shone. Amr Ibn Al'-As said to him: "You are already small day, and we have so many garments, Give your garment to someone to wash it. Omar replied: "how strange you are Amr Ibn Al'-As! If you have so many clothes, do you think that all do men have them? By Allah! If I had done it (i.e. borrow a garment), that would have become one of the traditions. I prefer to remove with water, what I see (traces) and sprinkle the other parties”. Malek said: "when a man sees traces of sperm on his clothes, without knowing since when they are there, and does not remember that he had a dream erotic, let him make a lotion after his last awakening. If he had make a prayer on this day, let him say the prayers again completed from the moment he woke up, because it may be that the man. have an erotic dream without seeing traces and without noticing that he did. If he finds the traces of semen on his clothes, he must make a lotion, because Omar, according to the hadith mentioned above has redid all the prayers he had performed since his last awakening, without, however, repeating the prayers already said before his last sleep. Chapter XXI The lotion of the woman who, like the man, has an erotic dream. 
(117) 87 - Ourwa Ibn Az-Zubair reported that Oum Soulaim said to the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah): "The woman who sees similarly to the man (an erotic dream) will she have to make a lotion”? He replied, "Certainly yes, let her make a lotion." Aisha then said to Oum Soulaim: “Fi! Does a woman have the same dream? The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said to Aisha: "Let your hand right be impoverished! Where does it come from that a child looks like (to his mother)"? 
(118) 88 - Oum Salama, the wife of the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) reported that Umm Sulaim the wife of Abu Talha Al-Ansari came to find the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) and said to him: “O Messenger of Allah! Allah is not ashamed of the truth! A woman having an erotic dream should she make a lotion”? He replied: “Yes, when she sees water”. Chapter XXII Lotion after sex 
(119) 89 - Nafe’a reported that Abdallah Ibn Omar said: "There is no harm in using of leftover water from a woman's lotion if she had missed her period or was in the state of a ritual impurity”. 
(120) 90 - Nafe' reported "that Abdallah Ibn Omar was sweating in the garment at the state of ritual impurity, then prayed while putting it on". 
(121) 91 - Nafe' reported 'That the female slaves of Abdallah Ibn Omar, him washed her feet and gave her the mat while they were menstruating. Malek was asked at about the man who is polygamous and who has female slaves, can he have carnal relations with his wives before making a lotion? He replied, "There is no harm that the man has carnal intercourse with two of his slaves, and that before making a lotion, As for his free women, he is repugnant that man has carnal intercourse with one of his wives the same night who was consecrated for another. But that he has carnal relations with a of his slaves then with another, while being in a state of impurity ritual, there is nothing wrong with that". Malek was also asked about a man, who in state of impurity, plunges inadvertently, its finger in the water which is intended for her lotion, to know her temperature? He replied, "If his finger has not been stricken with a whatever, I do not find in that, what will defile the water”. Chapter XXIII "Tayamoum" powder lustration 
(122) 92 - Aicha, the mother of believers related the story which follows: "we went out in one of the expeditions with the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah). Arrived at “All-Bayada” or “Zatel-Jaich”, I lost my necklace. The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) as well as his companions began to look for him, and it is that they were in a place where there was no water, and they had no water. Men came to find and say to Abou Bakr: “did you not see, what Aisha did? She obliged the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) and the men to halt in a place where there is no water, and even they had no water”. Aisha continued "Abu Bakr came to me, while the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) slept, putting his head on my thigh”. He said to me, "You have restrained the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) in a place where there is no water and people have no water". Aisha continued her story: "Abu Bakr reproached me and said what Allah willed and he began to hit me on the side, so much that nothing stopped me from moving that the head of the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) placed on my thigh. The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) slept until morning, and waking up, he found no water. Allah Blessed and Most High, then did the revelation of the verse relating to pulverized lustration, and the men did it. Oussaid Ibn Houdair then said: "It's not the first divine grace you receive, O family of Abu Bakr”. Aisha added: “By raising the camel I was riding we found the collar under this animal. Malek was asked at subject of a man who made a powder lustration for a prayer present, then for the next prayer; its pulverized lustration already done, will it be enough? Or should he do another? He replied, "He must do the pulveral lustration for every prayer, because he must seek water (for his ablutions) and pray. Now, he who does not find water, will be able in many case do the powder gloss". We also asked Malek about a man who did a powder lustration; be able to preside over the prayer when his companions had already do their ablutions? He answered: "it is better that another presides over it .but if he presides over it himself, there is nothing wrong with that». We asked to Malek about a man who did powder lustration because of water shortage, he got up, did the takbir and start the prayer. But suddenly a man came along bringing the water? He replied, "He should not interrupt the prayer, but rather can continue it, he can use this water (and perform his ablutions for the prayers which will follow". Malek said, "He who gets up to pray, and finds no water, and does what Allah ordered him to do pulverized lustration, he will have obeyed Allah. To know that he who has found the water is not purer than him, nor even his prayer is no longer complete, for each of them had obeyed the orders of Allah and acted according to his orders. The one who find the water, do their ablutions, and whoever does not find it, do the pulveral lustration and that before starting the pray". Malek also told the subject of the man who is ritually impure: "he does the lustration pulveral, recites a "hizb" of the Koran and makes other supererogatory prayers, if he does not find water, being still in the place where he is permitted to pray. Chapter XXIV How to do the "Tayamoum" powder lustration 
(123) 93 - Nafe' reported that on returning from “Al-Jourof”, Abdallah Ibn Omar and him, arrived at “Al-Mirbad”, Abdallah alighted from his mount, and made a powder lustration with good sand, he passed his hands (after having knocked on the ground) on his face, and hands up to his elbows, then he prayed”. 
(124) 94 - Nafe' reported that Abdallah Ibn Omar rubbed his hands up to the elbows, doing the pulveral lustration. Malek was asked about of powder lustration and how to do it, he replied: "we hit the floor once with the hands passed over the face, and twice passing them over the arms up to the elbows”. Chapter XXV The pulveral lustration of man ritually impure; 
(125) 95 - We asked Sa'id Ibn Al-Musaiab, about the man, who impure ritually, made a powder lustration, then he could find water, what should he do? He answered: “If he finds water, he must make a lotion for the prayers that follow”. about a man, who, traveling, had an erotic dream, and possessing only a quantity of water enough for his ablutions, and which can endure his thirst until he finds water, Malek said, "He washes the rod, and the soiled part, then he makes a lustration pulverize with pure sand as Allah has commanded". Malek was also asked about a ritually impure man, who wants to do pulverized lustration, but finds only the sand of a swamp, will he be able to use it? On the other hand, can he pray in this place”? He replied, "There is no harm in doing prayer in such a place, and the powder lustration, for Allah the Blessed and the Most High has said (meaning): "resort to good sand" and all that is good sand, one can use it for pulveral lustration, and to make the prayer, is it a question of a swamp or other". Chapter XXI What a man can dispose of his wife, who is menstruating 
(126) 96 - Zaid Ibn Aslam reported that a man asked the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace): "From what part, may I dispose of my wife's body when she has her period"? He him replied: "let her surround her waist with an izar, then you can arrange of the upper part of his body. 
(127) 97 - Rabi'a Ibn Abi Abdel-Rahman reported that Aisha the wife of the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) was lying with the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) wearing one garment, and suddenly she leaps up”. He said to her, “What is the matter with you? do you have your period”? She replied, “Yes”. He replied: “put an izar around your waist, and go back to bed”. 
(128) 98 - Oubaidallah Ibn Abdallah Ibn Omar sent someone to ask Aicha: “Can a man have touching with his wife who is at his menses"? She replied, "Let her surround her lower part with an izar, and that he disposes of the upper part (of his body)". 
(129) 99 - Salem Ibn Abdallah and Soulaiman Ibn Yassar were asked if the man can have carnal intercourse with his wife whose menstruation stopped before she made a lotion”? They replied, "No, not before she makes a lotion". Chapter XXVII The purity of the woman who has her period 
(130) 100 - The mother of Alqama, the freedwoman of Aisha, the mother of the believers reported: “the women asked Aisha, about the prayer when one of them finds a yellow stain on the cotton cloth sign of the cessation of menses”? She answered them: "don't be in a hurry, wait until you see the stain white", wanting understand by that, the purity of menses. 
(131) 101 - The daughter of Zaid Ibn Thabet was told that the women were doing bring lamps at night to ensure cessation of menses. She reproached them for this gesture and said: "At the time, the women didn't do that. 
(132) 102 - Malek was asked about the woman who, after having her menses, wanting to purify herself, could she do a pulveral lustration, if she finds no water? He replied, "His situation is like that of a person who is ritually impure, if he does not can't find water. Chapter XXVIII The case of the woman who has her period. 
(133) 103 - About the pregnant woman who finds bloodstains, Aisha said, "She must not pray." 
(134) 104 - Malek asked Ibd Chehab about the woman pregnant woman who sees bloodstains, he answered her: “she stops praying”. Malek said, "this is what is followed, too, with us (in Medina)". 
(135) 105 - Ourwa reported that Aisha, the wife of the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) said: "I was painting the head of the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) while I was on my period”. 
(136) 106 - Asma, the daughter of Abu Bakr-Siddiq reported that a woman asked the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah): "When one of us finds that her garment is spotted with menstrual blood, what should she make"? He replied, "When one of you has her garment stained by the blood of the menses, that she scrapes the stains, sprinkles her garment with water and then that she makes the prayer in wearing it". Chapter XXIX Of the woman with a bleeding vein. 
(137) 107 - Aisha, the wife of the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) reported that Fatima bint Abi Houbaich asked the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah): “O Messenger of Allah (I see always blood and) I never feel pure; should I stop praying? He replied, "This is only a bleeding vein and no longer menstruation; when you have your period, stop praying in their normal duration, after that clean yourself with water and pray”. 
(138) 108 - Oum Salama a reported that a woman suffered a discharge of blood in the time of the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him be grace and peace of Allah). Oum Salama by consulting the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) about this, he answered him: “let her count the number of nights and days in the normal time of her menses before she experiences such a discharge that she stops prayer during this time of the month. After that let her make a lotion, then she puts a cloth on her genitals, and then let her say the prayer”. 
(139) 109 - Zainab Bint Abi Salama reported that she saw Zainab Bint Jahch the wife of Abdel-Rahman Ibn Awf, who suffered a blood flow, make a lotion and pray”. 
(140) 110 - Soumai, the slave of Abu Bakr Ibn Abdel-Rahman reported that Al-Ka'Ka'Ibn Hakim and Zaid Ibn Aslam sent him to Sa'id Ibn Al-Musaiab to ask him about the lotion of the woman who has a discharge of blood? Sa'id replied: “she has to make a lotion after the normal cessation of her menses, and perform ablution to pray. In case the discharge becomes so heavy, let her put a rag over his sexual organ. 
(141) 111 - Ourwa said: “the woman who suffers a discharge of blood, makes a single lotion, then performs ablution for each prayer”. Malek said, "what is followed in Medina is that the woman who has a discharge, when she can pray, her husband has the right to have carnal intercourse with her, so it is the case of the woman who has given birth when the blood stops flowing after the maximum period following childbirth. But if this one will see the blood, her husband will have the right to coitus with her, because she will be considered as a woman who suffers a flow of blood”. Commenting on the words of Hisham Ibn Ourwa (No. 108) Malek said: These are the best words I have heard on this subject”. Chapter XXX An infant's urine 
(142) 112 - Aisha, the wife of the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) reported that by bringing a young child to the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him be grace and peace of Allah), he urinated on his garment. The Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him grace and peace of Allah) had water brought and washed the soiled part. 
(143) 113 - Oum Qais Bint Mihsen brought her child, who ate only milk, to the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah). Placing it in her lap, the child urinated. The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) had water brought and sprinkled the soiled part without washing his garment. Chapter XXXI Urinating standing up 
(144) 114 - Yahia Ibn Sa'id reported that a Bedouin entered the mosque, and wanting to urinate, people cried aloud (to prevent it). The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said to them: “Let him (finish)”. The Bedouin urinated, and the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) had a bucket of water brought and poured it on the defiled place. 
(145) 115 - Abdallah Ibn Dinar a reported that he saw Abdallah Ibn Omar, urinating standing up. Malek was asked at subject of washing the sexual parts after satisfying a need natural, is there any information about that”? He replied, "We let me know that those before us were content to do their ablutions, as for me, I like to wash my penis after urinating. Chapter XXXII On the use of the "siwak" (toothbrush) 
(146) 116 - Ibn As-Sabbag reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said in a day of Friday: “O Muslim people! Allah has made this day for you as a feast day, make a lotion there. It won't hurt if either of you perfume himself if he finds any and for that, make use of siwak”. 
(147) 117 - Abu Huraira reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "If it were not too impose excessive on my community, I would have ordered to make use of the miswak”. 
(148) 118 - Abu Huraira said: "If (the Messenger of Allah (sallallahou alayhi wa salam)) did not want to impose something excessive on his community, he would have ordered to use the siwak with each ablution” MOUATTA // Author: Brian Gosselin at scriptasylum.com var isMinNS4 = (navigator.appName.indexOf("Netscape")>=0 && parseFloat(navigator.appVersion) >= 4 && parseFloat(navigator.appVersion) < 5)? true : false; var isMinIE4 = (document.all)? true : false; var isMinNS6 = (parseFloat(navigator.appVersion) >= 5 && navigator.appName.indexOf("Netscape")>=0 )? true: false; var w_x, w_y, item, okscroll=false, godown, scrollamount=6; function init(){ if(isMinNS4)item=document.item; if(isMinNS6)item=document.getElementById('item'); if(isMinIE4)item=document.all.item; moveitem(); (isMinNS4)? item.visibility="show": item.style.visibility="visible"; setInterval('scrollpage()', 50); } function setscroll(ismore){ scrollamount= (ismore)? (149) 1 - Yahia Ibn Sa'id reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) wanted to use two planks of wood (like a rattle), which, beating them, called the faithful to common prayer. Abdallah Ibn was shown in a dream Zaid Al-Ansari and another from Bani Al-Hareth Ibn Al-Khazraj two planks of wood similar to those that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) wanted to use it, and they were said, "Why don't you call for prayer"? Once awake, Abdallah came to the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) and told him his dream. The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) immediately gave the order to call for prayer. 
(150) 2 - Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "when you hear the call to prayer, repeat what the muezzin says”. 
(151) 3 - Abu Hurairah reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) said: "If people knew the merit there is in making the call to prayer, and to be in the front row (praying together) and that they do not find other means to arrive there that the drawing of lots, they would have drawn lots. If they knew what is like merit by arriving early to pray in the mosque, they would have rush to get there. And if they knew what there is as merit in doing the evening prayer and that of the dawn in common, they would have returned, even dragging on all fours". 
(152) 4 - Abu Hurairah narrated that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) said: "when you hear the second call to prayer, do not hurry there, rather come in peace. What you will be able to do common, do it, and fill in what you missed. Each of is granted to you as being in prayer as long as he seeks to accomplish it”. 
(153) 5 - Al-Mazini a reported from his father that Abu Sa'id Al Khoudri said to him: "I see that you love sheep and the desert. When you are with your sheep, or in the desert, and whom you will call to prayer, raise your voice because no genie, human being, nor anything inanimate will hear the range of the voice of the muezzin, without him testifying, in his favor, the day of resurrection”. Abu Sa'id added: "That's what I heard from the mouth of the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah). 
(154) 6 - Abu Hurairah reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) said: "when you call prayer, Satan goes away, and farts so as not to hear this call. After the first call is over, it comes back and stays until the time of the second call. When the second call was made, Satan goes away again and then comes back to place himself between the man and his heart, suggesting to him and saying: “Remember such a thing, remember such a thing, that this man never thought of, that in the end, he no longer remembers the number of raka'ts he already has carried out". 155) 7 - Sahl Ibn Sa'd As-Sa'idi said: “there are two times (lit. two hours) when the Gates heavens open and few people invoke Allah and let their prayers are answered: when we call to prayer and when we put ourselves in rank to fight in the way of Allah". Malek was asked at about the timing of the call to prayer, will Friday be before its appointed time. He answered: “no, its moment will be when the sun has left the meridian”. Malek was asked at about the two calls to prayer and when should people get up to pray? He answered: "I don't know about them other than what I saw the men do: on the second call we don't pick up not for twice the same words (what we do for the first) and this is what well-informed people constantly do in Medina. As to when people have to get up to pray after the second call, I do not find in this a definite time, but I see that we must take into consideration the capacity of the men, for among them there will be both the strong and the weak, and they cannot all be alike”. Malek was asked at about people all present to make the prescribed prayer, in common; so they wanted to make the second call without the first? He replied: "That is enough because the first appeal was imposed only in the mosques frequented by a multitude of people where we pray in common”. We asked again Malek on the muezzin's greeting to the imam and his invitation to preside over the prayer and of the first person to be greeted? He replied, "I was not informed that this bow was practiced at there first period”. Malek was asked at subject of a man who calls for prayer but no one is present to do it with him; then he makes the second call, and prays alone, after which people come to pray, will he have to redo prayer with them? He replied, "No, he won't have to do it again, and whoever comes after the prayer has ended, he may accomplish it alone”. Malek was asked at about a man who calls for prayer and then says a prayer supererogatory. People arriving at the mosque, wanted another make the second call can be made by another person". Malek has says, "We keep making the first call to the dawn prayer before the dawn appears. As for the other prayers, we do not make the first call only after their scheduled hours. 
(156) 8 - We told Malek that the muezzin came to find Omar Ibn Al-Khattab to warn him that it is time for the dawn prayer. finding it asleep, he said to her: “prayer is better than sleep. Omar subsequently ordered this to be pronounced in the first appeal to the dawn prayer. 
(157) 9 Souhail Ibn Malek reported from his father that he said, "What I saw the men (it is understood: the companions of the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Be upon him grace and peace of Allah)) do (without changing it) this is the first call to prayer". 
(157) 9 Souhail Ibn Malek reported from his father that he said, "What I saw the men (it is understood: the companions of the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him grace and peace of Allah)) do (without changing it) this is the first call to prayer". 
(158) 10 - Nafe' reported that Abdallah Ibn Omar, being in "Al-Baqi'", heard the call to prayer, so he hurried on to go to the mosque". Chapter II From the call to prayer while traveling before performing ablutions 
(159) 11 - Nafe' reported: "on a very cold night when the wind was blowing loudly, Abdallah Ibn Omar called for prayer and at the end he said: "do prayer at home”. (Questioning him) he replied: "During a cold and rainy night, the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) ordered the muezzin to say at the end of the call: “say the prayer at home”. 
(160) 12 - Nafe' reported that Abdallah Ibn Omar, being on a trip, he was not than the second call to prayer except for that of the dawn, where it did the first. He said: "the first call to prayer was not imposed only to invite people to gather around the imam (to make common prayer). 
(161) 13 - Hicham Ibn Urwa reported that his father said to him: “When you are traveling, you can make the first and second calls to prayer, and you can settle for the second without the first". Malek said: "There's nothing wrong with a man doing the first call to prayer as he straddles his mount". 
(162) 14 - Sa'id Ibn Al-Mussaiab said: “He who prays (alone) in a deserted place, an angel on his right and another on his left are praying with him. When he makes the first and the second call to prayer or the second, alone, a crowd of angels like the mountains pray behind him". Chapter III The time devoted to suhur expires with the first call to prayer 
(163) 15 - Abdallah Ibn Omar reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “Bilal appeals to the prayer while it is still dark, eat and drink until Ibn Maktoun make this call”. 
(164) 16 - Salem Ibn Abdallah reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam)r (On him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “Or Bilal calls when it was still dark, eat and drink until for Ibn Maktoum to make this call". He added: “Ibn Maktoum was a blind man, and he only called for prayer when he was said: "you are in the morning, you are in the morning". Chapter IV How to pray 
(165) 17 - Abdullah Ibn Umar reported: “When the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) began the prayer, he raised his hands at the level of his shoulders, the same when he raised his head of the inclination, and said: "Allah listens to those who praise Him, our Praise be to you, but he didn't do that when he bowed down. (l66) 18 - Ali Ibn Hussain Ibn Ali Ibn Abi Taleb reported: "The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) pronounced the takbir (saying: Allah is great) when he stooped down (to bow or prostrate) and raised your head from prostration. He acted thus, until he has met Allah”. 
(167) 19 - Soulaiman Ibn Yassar reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him be grace and peace of Allah) raised his hands (at the beginning of the pray)". 
(168) 20 - Abu Salama Ibn Abdel-Rahman Ibn Awf, reported that Abu Houraira presiding over the prayer to them, pronounced the takbir each time he stooped (to bow and to prostrate) and then he raised his head (from prostration). His prayer finished, he said, “By Allah! This prayer is like the one said the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam)". 
(169) 21 - Salem Ibn Abdallah a reported that Abdallah Ibn Omar uttered the takbir whenever he bowed and prostrated”. (...) 22 - Nafe' a reported that at the beginning of the prayer, Abdallah Ibn Omar raised his hands at the level of his shoulders, and so when he lifted his head from inclination". 
(170) 23 - Wahb Ibn Kaisan a reported that Jaber Ibn Abdallah taught takbir to the faithful, in the prayer saying: "we were ordered to pronounce the takbir each time we lowered ourselves1 and we got up 2. (1) To bow and to prostrate. (2) Rise from prostration. 
(171) 24 - Malek reported that Ibn Chehab said: "when the man manages to make a single raka't (in common) and pronounces the takbir once, this was enough". Malek, commenting on this, said: "When a man wants by this takbir to begin his pray". We asked to Malek, about a man who comes to pray in common behind the imam, forgetting to do the takbir at the beginning of the prayer, and at the bow, until he has performed a raka't, then remembering this, he pronounces the takbir during the second raka't”? He replied: "it is for me to preference that he do the takbir at the beginning of the prayer even if he forgets to do so following the imam and he does it during the first bow, because it is enough if he considers it as the takbir of the beginning”. About the one who prays alone, forgetting to pronounce the takbir at the beginning, Malek said, “he can continue his prayer”. And regarding, the imam who forgets the takbir from the beginning of the prayer, until he accomplishes it, Malek said: "I think he must resume prayer, as well as for those who prayed with him, even if the latter pronounced the takbir, they must remake". Chapter V From Quran recitation to sunset and evening prayers 
(172) 25 - Mouhammad Ibn Joubair Ibn Moutém reported from his father that he heard the Apostle of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) recite to the sunset prayer the sura: “By the Mount” (Koran L II). 
(173) 26 - Abdallah Ibn Abbas a reported that Umm Al-Fadl bint Al-Hareth, having heard him recite the sura "The sent” (Koran L XXVII), said to him: “O my son! your recitation reminded me that of the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) for this Surah was what I recently heard him recite, at the sunset prayer». 
(174) 27 - Abu Abdullah Al-Sounabihi reported: "I arrived in Medina at the time when Abu Bakr was the caliph, and I said the sunset prayer with him. He recited in the first two raka'ts the Fatiha and two short Surahs of "Al-Mufassal". At the third raka't, he got up, and I approached him so much that my clothes touched his; I heard him recite the Fatiha (the mother of the book) then the verse following: “Our lord! do not divert our hearts after having directed, grant us mercy from you. You are the supreme Donor" (Koran III, 8). 
(175) 28 - Nafe'a reported, that Abdallah Ibn Omar doing the prayer alone, recited to each raka't, "the mother of the book - the Fatiha", and another surah. Sometimes he recited two or three suras during a raka't, the canonical prayer. He recited the same in the first two raka'ts of the sunset prayer, the mother with the Book and a another surah”. 
(176) 29 - Albara Ibn Azeb, reported: “I made the evening prayer with the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) where he recited the sura: "By the fig tree and the olive tree" (Koran XCV). Chapter VI How to do the recitation 
(177) 30 - Ali Ibn Abi Taleb reported that “The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam)r (Be upon him be grace and peace of Allah) has forbidden to put on clothes made of “qassi” (kind of clothes silk), gold rings, and reciting the Koran during inclinations”. 
(178) 31 - Al-Baiadi a reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) came to cross the people then they prayed, while raising their voices, reciting the Koran, they says: "Anyone who prays is face to face with his Lord, thinking about how to converse with him, and that one of you does not raise your voice while reciting, so as not to disturb the others". 
(179) 32 - Anas- Ibn Malek reported: “I prayed behind Abu Bakr, Omar and Osman, and each of them did not recite "In the name of Allah the Merciful the Most Merciful” at the beginning of the prayer. 
(180) 33 - Souhail Ibn Malek, reported' from his father that he said: "being at “Al-Balate”, at Abi Jahm, we heard the recitation of Omar Ibn Al-Khattab (when he was praying)”. 
(181) 34 - Nafe' reported that "when Abdallah Ibn Omar missed a raka't at the during a common prayer where the imam had to recite the Koran aloud voice, after the imam makes his final greeting, Abdullah alone completed the missing prayer of the prayer, reciting to aloud". 
(182) 35 - Malek said: “Yazid Ibn Rouman related to me: “when I was praying next to Nafe' Ibn Joubair Ibn Mout'em, he made me a sign to remind him of the verses of the Koran (in case he forgot them)”. Chapter VII From the recitation of the Quran to the dawn prayer 
(183) 36 - Hisham Ibn Urwa reported from his father that he said: "Abu Bakr Al-Siddiq performing the dawn prayer, reciting the surah "The Cow”, in the two raka'ts”. 
(184) 37 - Abdullah Ibn Amer Ibn Rabia said: "I made the dawn prayer behind Omar Ibn Al-Khattab, during which he slowly recited the two suras “Youssouf and “The Pilgrimage”. The reporter was asked: “By Allah! He was then to begin the prayer as soon as the appearance of dawn”? He replied, “Yes”. 
(185) 38 - Al-Fourafissa Ibn Omaïr Al-Hanafi said: "I only retained sura "Youssouf", by the recitation of Osman Ibn Affan, often made at the prayer of dawn". 
(186) 39 - Nafe' reported that "Abdallah Ibn Omar recited, while being in journey, and that at the dawn prayer, the first two suras of "Al Moufassal", so that in each raka't he recited the fatiha and one of these suras” Chapter VIII About “The Mother of the Quran” 
(187) 40 Abu Sa'id, the slave of Amer Ibn Kuraiz reported: “The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) called Ubai Ibn Ka'b so that he was praying. Finishing his prayer, he joined the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) who put his hand on his, when he wanted to leave the mosque, saying to him: "I hope, before you leave the mosque, let you know a surah that Allah has not revealed the like in the Torah, nor in the Gospel, nor in the Quran”. And Oubai added: "I slowed down, waiting for what he was going to tell me, then I said to him: “O Messenger of Allah What is this sura that you promised to teach me?
