(367) 40 - It was reported to Malek, that Abdallah Ibn Omar was reluctant to pass in front of women who pray. 
(368) 41 - Nafé reported that Abdallah hated the passage in front of someone who prays and he did not let anyone pass in front of him while praying”. Chapter XI Of the authorization to pass in front of a man who prays. 
(369) 42 - Abdallah Ibn Abbas a told: "I arrived at Mina, riding a donkey, when I was close to puberty, and I found the Apostle of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) praying with people. I passed in front of a row, I went down and let the donkey go to graze. As I lined up with the men, no one reproached me for anything”. 
(370) 43 - It was reported to Malek, that Sa'd Ibn Abi Waqas was passing in front of the rows of men who were praying. Malek said, “After the second call to prayer, and that the imam has started the prayer, it is tolerated for a man to go beyond the rows if he cannot find another way out to enter the mosque”. 
(371) 44 - It was reported to Malek that Ali Ibn Abi Taleb said: "when a man prays, nothing can interrupt his prayer, passing in front of him". (....) 45 - Salem Ibn Abdallah reported that Abdallah Ibn Omar said: "nothing causes a man's prayer to be interrupted by passing in front of him". Chapter XII "The Sutra" in front of a man who prays while traveling. 
(372) 46 - It was reported to Malek that Abdallah Ibn Omar placed his mon ture in front of him when he prayed. (....) 47 - Hisham Ibn Ourwa, said that his father was praying in a desert environment, without there being any sutra”. Chapter XIII The spacing of the pebbles when we pray. 
(373) 48 - Abu Ja'far Al Qari said: "I saw Abdallah Ibn Omar, remove the stones from the place where he rested his forehead, while prostrating himself, and that without exaggerating too much”. 
(374) 49 - Yahia Ibn Sa'id reported that Abou Zarr said: "It is tolerated to wipe the place where one prostrates oneself for once and to leave it as it is, better than the red camels". Chapter XIV Equalization of ranks. 
(375) 50 - Nafé reported that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab ordered to equalize the ranks. Once informed that the ranks are equalized, he made the takbir (sign of the beginning of the prayer). 
(376) 51 - Abu Souhail Ibn Malek reported that his father said: “The second call to prayer was made when I was with Osman Ibn Affan, asking him for financial help. I kept talking to him, as for him, he was wiping the sand from his shoes, when the men came, whom he had charged with equalizing the ranks, informing him that they already are; Osman tells me: “Get in line, then he made the takbir”. Chapter XV The act of placing one hand on the other during prayer. 
(377) 52 - Abdel Karim Ibn Abi Al-Mukhareq said: "What we have learned from the prophetic words: "if you are not ashamed, do what you want", such as: laying your hand on the other during prayer, (the right on the left), to hasten to break the fast; and to delay taking "the souhour". 
(378) 53 - Abu Hazem Ibn Dinar reported that Sahl Ibn Sa'd said: “People were ordered to place the right hand on the left arm during prayer. Abu Hazem added: “I don't know if these were the words of the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace). Chapter XVI The Quunout at the dawn prayer. 
(379) 54 - Nafé reported that Abdallah Ibn Omar did not perform the Quunout at the dawn prayer”. Chapter XVII The prohibition to pray when one is in a hurry to satisfy a natural need. 
(380) 55 - Ourwa reported from his father that Abdallah Ibn Al-Arqam presided over the prayer he made with the men; one day, and at the time of prayer, he went to satisfy a natural need then came back and said to the people, "I heard the Apostle of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) say: "If any of you need to satisfy a natural need, let him do it before praying". 
(381) 56 - Zaid Ibn Aslam reported that Omar Ibn Al Khattab said: “Let no one pray, by squeezing his legs”, (ie feeling that he must satisfy a natural need). Chapter XVIII Waiting for prayer and going to the mosque to do it. 
(382) 57 Abu Huraira reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "The angels keep on pray for one of you as long as he stays where he prayed unless he unloads anything. They say, “Great Allah! Forgive him, Great Allah! Have mercy on him”. Malek said, "I don't consider these words" to be does not discharge anything" means something other than a discharge which cancels ablution" 
(383) 58 - Abu Hurairah reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “One of you does not cease to be in prayer as long as prayer retains him, and that nothing but it prevents him from returning home". 
(384) 59 Soumai, Abu's servant Bakr reported that Abu Bakr Ibn Abdel-Rahman said: "He who morning and evening goes to the mosque, and has no other place, to learn good or to teach it to others, then returns to he is comparable to one who fights in the way of Allah, returning with what he has acquired as spoils”. 
(385) 60 - Nou'aim Ibn Abdallah Al-Mujmer a reported that he heard Abu Huraira say, "When one of you performs his prayer and keeps his place, where he made his prayer, the angels do not stop praying for him saying: “Great Allah! Forgive him! Great Allah! Have mercy on him”. He who leaves his oratory and goes to sit in the mosque to wait for the next prayer, does not cease to be considered as being in prayer, until he accomplishes it”. 
(386) 61 - Abu Huraira reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) said: "Shall I tell you by what Allah erases faults and raises degrees? It is to perform ablutions in difficult circumstances, to go often to the mosque, and to wait for successive prayers. This is firmness (of faith)! This is firmness (of faith) This is firmness (of faith). 
(387) 62 - It was reported to Malek that Sa'id Ibn Al Moussaib said: "After the first call to prayer, only a hypocrite comes out of the mosque and then he will come back". 
(388) 63 - Abu Katada Al-Ansari reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “When one of you enters the mosque, let him do two raka'ts before sitting down". 
(389) 64 - Abu Al-Nadar, the slave of Omar Ibn Oubaidallah reported that Abu Salama Ibn Abdel-Rahman said to him: "I did not see your companion make two rak'ats while entering the mosque before sitting down”? Abu Al-Nadar added: "He meant Omar Ibn Oubaidallah, and he reproached him for entering the mosque without making two raka'ts before sitting down." Malek said: “It is good tradition but it is not an obligation”. Chapter XIX Putting your hands on which you put your forehead while prostrating yourself. 
(390) 65 - Nafé reported that Abdallah Ibn Omar, prostrating himself, put his hands where he rested his forehead”. Nafé added: “On a very cold day, I saw him take his hands out from under his "bournos" to put them on a ground covered with pebbles". 
(391) 66 - Nafé reported that Abdallah said: “Whoever places his forehead on the ground, let him put his hands where he places his forehead. When he raises his head, (from prostration) let him lift up his hands also because the hands prostrate like the face”. Chapter XX the turning and clapping hands when necessary during prayer. 
(392) 67 - Sahl Ibn Al Sa'idi reported the following story: "The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) went to Bani Amr Ibn Awf to reconcile them. When the time for the prayer came, the muezzin came to find Abu Bakr and said to him: “Will you make the people say the prayer so that I can make the second call”? ' He replied: "Certainly yes." Abu Bakr started the prayer, and the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) returned while the people were praying. He made his way among the men to line up, who on seeing him began to clap their hands, Abu Bakr, when praying, never turned in his prayer, but like people continued to clap their hands, he turned and saw the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) who beckoned him to keep his square. Abu Bakr, then raised his hands, praising Allah for the order that had just been given to him by the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) then he fell back to line up; the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) came forward and continued the prayer. The prayer completed, the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said to Abu Bakr: "What is prevented you from staying in your place after I ordered you”? Abu Bakr replied: "It is not appropriate for Ibn Abi Kuhafa to pray before the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah). The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) then addressed the faithful in saying, “Why did I see you clap your hands so long? When something happens to one of you during the prayer, let him say: "Glory be to Allah", because by doing this glorification, attention will be paid to him. Hand clapping is only suitable for women. 
(393) 68 - Nafé reported that Ibn Omar never turned when he prayed”. 
(394) 69 - Abu Ja'far Al-Qari a reported: “I was praying without noticing that Abdallah Ibn Omar was behind me. As I turned to his side he pinched me. Chapter XXI What should a man do who comes to pray in common while the imam has bowed. 
(395) 70 - Abu Oumama Ibn Sahl Ibn Hounaif a reported: “Zaid Ibn Thabet entered the mosque and the people were in a state of bowing, he bowed in turn, then he slipped to stand line up”. 
(396) 71 - It was reported to Malek, that Abdallah Ibn Mass'oud slipped (to line up) while being tilted”. Chapter XXII The prayer for the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah). 
(397) 72 - Amr Ibn Sulaim Al Zuraqi a reported that Abu Humaid As Sa'id told him that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) was asked r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace): "O Messenger of Allah! How do we pray for you? He answered: "Say, 'Great Allah! Pray for Muhammad as well as for his wives and descendants, as you prayed for Ibrahim's family. Bless Muhammad, his wives and his descendants, as you blessed Ibrahim's family. You are worthy of praise and glory”. Allahumma salli ala Muhammad wa azwajihi wa alihi kama sallaita ala ali Ibrahim, wa barakaala Muhammad wa azwajihi wa alihi kama baraktaalaali Ibrahim, innaka Hamidu'm - Majid. 
(398) 73 - Abu Mass'oud Al-Ansari reported: "being in an assembly at Sa'd Ibn Oubada, the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) came to us. Bashir Ibn Sa'd said to him: “Allah has commanded us to pray for you, O Messenger of Allah. How should we do it”? He was so quiet that we didn't want to ask him that question again, and then he replied, "Say, 'Great Allah! Pray for Muhammad and for Muhammad's family, as You prayed for Ibrahim. Bless Muhammad and the family of Muhammad as You blessed the family of Ibrahim. You are worthy of praise and glory”. As for salvation, it is as you know”. Allahumma salli ala Muhammad wa ali Muhammad kama sallaita Ibrahim, wa baraka ala Muhammad wa ali Muhammad kama baraktaala ali Ibrahim. Fi'l alamin, innaka Hamidu'm - Majid. 
(399) 74 - Abdallah Ibn Dinar a reported: "I saw Abdallah Ibn Omar, standing near the tomb of the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) pray for him as well as for Abu Bakr and Omar”. Chapter XXIII How is prayer done? 
(400) 75 - Ibn Umar reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) made two raka'ts (supererogatory) before the canonical midday prayer, two others after and two raka'ts after that of the sunset at home, as well as two others after that of the evening. On Friday, he prayed two raka's at home after the Friday prayer was completed”. 
(401) 76 - Abu Huraira reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) said: “Do you see my qibla, of this side? By Allah, nothing will be hidden from me, neither of your contemplation nor of your inclinations, because I see you even from behind my back”. 
(402) 77 - Abdallah Ibn Umar reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) came (to the mosque) of "Qouba" on foot, or mounted". (403) 78- Al-Nu'man Ibn Mourra reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said to the faithful: "that do you think of the drinker of wine, the thief and the fornicator? This was said before Allah made a revelation about them. We him replied: "Allah and His Messenger are much more knowledgeable". He replied, “Their deeds are abominable sins and they are punished. And the worst theft committed is that of a man who prays. He was asked, "How can one steal from his prayer, O Messenger of Allah." He resumed: “He does not do his bows or prostrations to perfection. 
(404) 79 - Urwa reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) said: "Practice a part of your prayers in your homes. (These are supererogatory). 
(405) 80 - Nafé reported that Abdallah Ibn Omar said: "the patient, who prays, without being able to prostrate himself, let him nod his head, without raising anything to his forehead". 
(406) 81 - Rabi'a Ibn Abi Abdel-Rahman, reported: "When Abdallah Ibn Omar came to the mosque and people had already finished the prayer, he began to make the canonical prayer without doing any other with it". 
(407) 82 - Nafé reported that Abdallah Ibn Omar passing near a man who was praying, saluted him, as for the man, he replied verbally. Abdallah Ibn Omar returned to the man and said to him: "When one of you is greeted while he is praying, he does not should not answer, but just a wave of the hand". 
(408) 83 - Nafé reported that Abdallah Ibn Omar said: "When one of you remembers a (omitted) prayer being behind the imam, once the latter gives the final salutation, performs the prayer that he forgot and then let him do the next". 
(409) 84 - Wassé Ibn Habban reported: “I was doing a prayer at the moment when Abdallah Ibn Omar leaned his back against the wall of the Ka'ba. on the right side"? I answered him: "as I saw you (from this side) I directed at you”. Abdallah replied, “You did well, because they said that you should always turn to the right side. When you finish the prayer turn to the side which is good for you either on the right side or on the left side”. 
(410) 85 - Ourwa reported that a man from Muhajirines, who was not bad, asked Abdallah Ibn Amr Ibn Al'-As: "Can I pray in camel parks"? He replied: “No, rather pray in those of the sheep”. 
(411) 86 - Ibn Chehab reported that Sa'id Ibn Al Musaiab said: “What will be the prayer during which, one must sit down after each raka't'? Then Sa'id resumed: "She is the one of sunset, when one of the raka'ts is missed, so are the supererogatory raka'ts that one makes with each prayer”? Chapter XXIV Prayer.

When he prostrated, he put her on the ground, and when he got up, he carried her”. , 
(413) 88 - Abu Huraira reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) said: "The angels of the night and of the day follow you, and they meet at the time of the prayer of the asr, and that of the dawn. Those who spent the night among you ascend (to heaven); Allah asks them, although He knows better than them: “How did you leave My worshippers? They answer him: “we left them praying and when we went to their house, we found them still praying”. 
(414) 89 - Aisha, the wife of the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “(during his illness) the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "Order Abu Bakr to make the prayer (by presiding over it) with the people". Aisha added: “I replied: “O Messenger of Allah! If Abu Bakr, will take your place, he will not make people hear the recitation, because of his crying, ask rather to Omar”. He replied, "Order Abu Bakr to preside over the prayer with the people." Aisha continued, “I then said to Hafsa, “Say him, that if Abou Bakr will take your place, he will not make people hear the recitation, because of his tears, therefore give the order to Omar, that he do it”. Hafsa, having done as I told him, the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) replied: “You are like the Egyptian ladies of Youssouf! Order Abu Bakr to preside over the men's prayer”. Hafsa then said to Aisha, "I never expected good from you." 
(415) 90 - Oubaidallah Ibn Adi Ibn Al-Khiar narrated: "The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah), being seated among men, a man came to tell him a secret and no one could know what he had told him, until the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the mercy and peace of Allah ) reveals it to us. The man him asked for permission to kill one of the hypocrites. When the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) let us know, he exclaimed: "Does not this hypocrite testify that there is no other divinity than Allah, and that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam)? The man replied, “Certainly, yes, but his testimony is no longer valid”. He replied, “Does he not pray”? Yes, said the man, but his prayer is no longer acceptable”. The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) then exclaimed: "These are those whom Allah has forbidden me" (namely to kill them). 
(416) 91 Ata Ibn Yassar reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) said: “Great Allah! make my grave is not an idol to be worshipped. The anger of Allah is revived against those who have taken the tombs of their Prophets for places of prayer”. 
(417) 92 Mahmoud Ibn Al-Rabi Al-Ansari reported that Itban Ibn Malek, presided over the prayer of his contributors, while he was blind, he said to the Apostle of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah): “It sometimes happens that at night is dark, and the weather is rainy and there is a lot of water outside, and I am blind, go to my house, O Messenger of Allah and pray in a place that I take it as an oratory ". The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) went to Itban and said to him: “Where do you want me to pray”? He showed him a corner of the house, where the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) prayed. 
(418) 93 - Abbad Ibn Tamim reported that his paternal uncle saw the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) stretched out in the mosque, putting one foot on the other”. (419) 95 - Yahia Ibn Sa'id reported that Abdallah Ibn Mass'oud said to a man: “You live in a time when many are the ulemas, few are the reciters (of the Koran); one strictly observes its prescriptions and one loses its variants. Few people ask for alms, and many do. They lengthen the prayer and shorten the sermon. Their (good) works take precedence over their instincts. There will come a time when few will be ulemas, many reciters of the Koran who will retain its variants and neglect its prescriptions. Many people will beg for alms and few will be those who will. They will lengthen the sermon, and shorten the prayer. They will satisfy their instincts at the expense of their works”. 
(420) 96 - Yahia Ibn Sa'id said: "We let me know that prayer will be the first work to be examined (on the day of resurrection) among the works of the servant; if she will be accepted, we will move on to his other works, but if it is not, we will not take into account his other works". 
(421) 97 - Aisha, the wife of the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "The practice (religious) most pleasing in the eyes of the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) was the one that is performed with the most regularity”. 
(422) 98 - Sa'id Ibn Abi Waqas a reported from his father that he related: “There were two brothers, one of whom perished before the other by forty nights. As we came from mention the virtues of the first to the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) he asked: "the other, was he not not Muslim”? He was answered: "Certainly, yes, O Messenger of Allah, and he wasn't bad." The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) replied: “Do you know where his prayers led him? Now prayer is comparable to a river whose water is abundant and pure, which passes in front of the door of one of you where he washes himself five times a day. What do you think after that? Would he be left with the slightest filth? You do not know, therefore, where he arrived thanks to his prayers”. 
(423) 99 - Malek was told that when a man came to sell his goods in the mosque, and passed near Ata Ibn Yassar, he said to him: “what do you have to sell? What do you want?” If the man answered him that he was coming to sell him, he replied: "Go and sell it on the market of this lower world, here, it is the market of the future life". 
(424) 100 - It was reported to Malek, that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab, had established a place on the side of the mosque, called “Al-Boutaiha”. He said, "Whoever wanted to tell trivia or recite poetry, or raise his voice, let him go to this place." Chapter XXV The exhortation to pray. 
(425) 101 - Talha Ibn Oubaid a recounted: “A man, inhabitants of Najd, the hair hirsute, came to the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) and spoke to him in a voice so high that one could not understand anything of what he said; until he was very close to us; it was then that we knew that he was asking her about Islam. The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) answered him: “They are five prayers day and night”. The man replied, “should I do any more”? He replied: “no, unless you make other supererogatory”. Then the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) continued: “And the fast of the month of Ramadhan”. The Man again asked, "Should I fast in other months?" No, unless you do voluntary fasting.” As the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) mentioned the Zakat to him, the man replied: "Should I pay anything else"? No, said the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) unless you give alms”. The Man went away saying, “By Allah! I wouldn't do anything more, nothing less." The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) then said: "He will succeed, if he is sincere". 
(426) 102 - Abu Hurairah narrated that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) said: "When one of you falls asleep, the devil comes to tie three knots, on the back of his neck, hitting each knot, and saying: "Sleep, a whole long night". If man wakes up and mentions Allah, one knot comes loose, when he performs ablution, the second is untied, and finally when he prays, the third is no longer tied. In the morning he will be energetic, calm soul; otherwise, he will be, in the morning, indolent and in a bad mood”. MOUATTAA In the name of Allah the Merciful the Merciful Book 10 The two parties First chapter The lotion on the feast day, the two calls to prayer on those two days. 
(427) 1 - Malek reported that he heard more than one ulema say: "In the time of the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) until today, neither at the feast of "Al-fitr" (the breaking of the fast), nor at that of “Al-adha” (the day of the sacrifice), the first and the second call to prayer”. Malek said, "Such is the tradition followed unquestionably." 
(428) 2 - Nafé reported that Abdallah Ibn Omar made a lotion on the day of "Al-fitr" before going to the mosque, to make the prayer". Chapter 11 Of the order to say the prayer before the sermon, on the day of the two feasts. 
(429) 3 - Ibn Chehab reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) was praying of the two festivals, “Al-fitr” and “Al-adha”, before the sermon” . 
(430) 4 - It was reported to Malek that Abu Bakr and Omar were doing the same”. 
(431) 5 - Abou Oubaid, the slave of Ibn Azhar said: “I attended the feast, with Omar Ibn Al-Khattab, who made the prayer, then the completed prayer made the sermon saying: "The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) forbade fasting these two days: the day of the end of the fast (of Ramadan) and the other the day when you eat the flesh of your animal victims”. Abou Oubaid added: “Then I attended the day of the feast with Osman, who came to the mosque, to pray, then, finishing the prayer, he made the sermon and said: “today, two feasts took place. gathered for you (it was a Friday). One who lives in "Al-Alia" (the towns surrounding Medina) and wants to wait for Friday prayers. Let him wait, and whoever wishes to return home, I authorize him to do so». Continuing, Abou Oubaid said: "I also attended the feast with Ali Ibn Abi Taleb (at the time when Osman was besieged), Ali came to the mosque, said the prayer and then preached it”. Chapter III Of the order to take the small lunch before going to the mosque (at the feast of fitr). 
(432) 6 - Hisham Ibn Ourwa reported that his father ate in the morning, on the feast day, before going to the mosque". (....) 7 • Ibn Chehab reported that Sa'id Ibn Al-Musaiab said to him: “People were ordered to eat the morning, the day of the feast of fitr before going to the mosque”. Malek said, "I can't find inconvenience, so that people, act similarly on the day of the festival of adha”. Chapter IV From doing takbir and reciting the Quran on the days of both festivals. 
(433) 8 - Oubaidallah Ibn Abdallah Ibn Utba Ibn Mass'oud reported that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab asked Abu Waqed Al-Laithi about the recitation made by the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) on the days of the two feasts, of Al-fitr, and Al-adha”? He replied, “He was reciting the two suras: “Qaf, by the glorious Quran” (Koran L) and “The hour is approaching and the moon is splitting” (Koran LIV)”. 
(434) 9 "Nafé the slave of Abdallah Ibn Omar reported: “I attended the festivals of Al-fitr and Al-adha, with Abu Houraira; while praying, he made seven takbirs at the beginning of the first raka't before the recitation, and five takbirs before the recitation in the second raka't”. Malek said, "That is what we practice in Medina." Malek was asked about a man who, in the time of the Eid prayer arrives at the mosque, when people have finished the prayer”? He replied, "He may not pray or the mosque, nor at his home. But I don't find any inconvenience if he done in the mosque or at home, and in this case, he will do seven takbirs before reciting in the first raka't and five in the second”. Chapter V From the fact of suspending the prayer before and after those of the two feasts.

(438) 13 Hisham Ibn Ourwa reported that his father, on the day of the feast of fitr, said a prayer at home before performing that of the feast in the mosque”. Chapter VII The arrival of the imam (at the mosque) and waiting for the sermon. 
(439) 14 - Malek said: "the tradition indisputable, which we apply, has already passed; it consists of the imam, on the day of the feast of fitr or that of the adha, leaving his home to arrive just at the mosque, at the time of prayer”. Malek was asked about a man who feast prayer with the imam; will he be able to leave the mosque before listening to the sermon? He replied, “he must not come out until the imam does) MOUATTAA In the name of Allah the Merciful the Merciful Book 11 The Prayer of Fear First chapter Prayer in times of danger. 
(440) 1 - We Saleh Ibn Khawatt asked about those who made the prayer of fear in the company of the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah), during the expedition of “Zait-Al-Riqa”. He replied, “One group lined up behind him, and another stayed right in front of the enemy. He made the first raka't of prayer with the first group and remained standing, leaving the men of this group to finish their prayers alone, to go on raise the guard. Came the second group, who got behind him, and gave them the second raka't; the imam remained seated, as for the men, they completed their prayer alone, and at the end, he finished the prayer by making the final salutation with them”?. 
(441) 2 - Sahl Ibn Abi Hathama said that the prayer of fear (in case of danger), consists in the imam standing with a group of men, as for the other, he must face the enemy. The imam makes a bow with them then a prostration and he gets up and remains standing until the men complete their prayer, alone, and make the final salutation, after which they leave the place of the prayer to face the enemy. Then came the other group, to stand behind the imam who is still standing; the men do the takbir, repeating it after the imam who prays with them, making a bow and a prostration. Then the imam makes the final salutation when the men complete the prayer alone by making the second raka't then the final salutation”. 
(442) 3 - Nafe a reported: “When one asked Abdallah Ibn Omar, about the prayer of danger, he replied: “The imam presides over the prayer with a certain number of men, completing a raka't, while the others who do not have not prayed yet, will face the enemy. Those who have already done a raka't with the imam, step back to give way to those who have not yet made it, without however making the final salutation. Thus, the latter go ahead to make a raka't with the imam, who, having already completed the two raka'ts, leaves the place of prayer; at this time, the men in each of the two categories do the other raka't alone, and anyone can complete their prayer by doing two raka'ts. If there is an imminent danger, the men pray while standing, or even mounted without their direction being the qibla. if he had not heard it from the mouth of the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah). 
(443) 3 - Sa'id Ibn Al-Mussaiab, reported: "on the day of the battle of "Ditch" (Al-Khandaq), the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) did not make the prayer noon and that of the asr, only after sunset. Malek said: "The Hadith concerning the prayer in case of danger that Saleh Ibn Khawatt reported, was the best I've heard". MOUATTAA In the name of Allah the Merciful the Merciful Book 12 The Eclipse Prayer First chapter What should be done in the eclipse prayer. 
(444) 1 - Aisha, the wife of the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) reported: "There was an eclipse of the sun in the time of the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah). He made a prayer with the men where he stood and remained for a long time, then he bowed for a long time to get up again and remained standing however less than the first time. Then he bowed for less time than the first bow, then raised his head and bowed. During the second raka't. it acts like the first; the prayer finished, the sun emerged, then the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) turned to men, praised Allah and exalted him, then he made this sermon: "The sun and the moon are two signs from among the signs of Allah, who does not eclipse either at the birth or at the death of anyone. So if you witness this phenomenon, invoke Allah, proclaim His Greatness and give alms”. Then he added: “O community of Muhammad! By Allah! No one is more jealous than Allah. When his servant or servant commits adultery. O community of Muhammad! By Allah! If you knew what I know. You would have laughed a little but cried a lot”. 
(445) 2 - Abdallah Ibn Abbas reported: "There was an eclipse. While the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam)r (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) was with the men. He rose to pray with them, and remained standing long enough to recite about the sura "The Cow", then he made a long bow, and then raised his head to remain standing for a shorter period of time than the first time; he then bowed for a time less than that of the first inclination then he prostrated himself. After that he got up and stood for a shorter time than the first time, then bowed for a shorter time than that of the first inclination, raised his head and thus remained upright for a less time than the first time, then he bowed again for a shorter time than the previous time, then it prostema. The prayer finished, the sun emerged, he said: "the sun and the moon are two signs from among those of Allah, which do not suffer an eclipse because either of someone's death or of his birth. However, if you witness this phenomenon, call on Allah”? We him asked, "O Messenger of Allah, we have seen you take something from your up, then you backed off”? He replied, "I have just seen Heaven and I wanted to pick a bunch of his grapes. Now, if I had taken it, you would have eaten it as long as the world exists. I also saw Hell, and I have never seen such a horrible sight as I saw today. I saw that the women were of majority in Hell". He was asked, “Why is that, O Messenger of Allah”? He answered: "because of their infidelity". They replied: “Are they disloyal to Allah”? He retorted, "They are unfaithful to their husbands and they are ungrateful. If you do good to one of them all your life, and she then sees something from you that displeases her, she will exclaim: "I I never received the slightest thing from you”. 
(446) 3 - Aisha, the wife of the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "A Jewess came to him asking for alms saying: "May Allah preserve you from the punishment from the grave”. Aisha then asked the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) if men, are punished in their graves”? He answered him by taking refuge with Allah from the torment of the grave”. Then one morning, the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) mounted his mount and there had an eclipse of the sun. He returned at the time of “Al-douha” and passed between the apartments (of his wives); then he got up to say a prayer and the people behind him. He remained standing for a long time, then a long bow, then raised his head and remained standing for a shorter time than that of the first time, then he bowed again and made a shorter bow than the first, then raised his head and then he prostrated himself. He got up again, stood for a shorter time than the first time, made a shorter bow than the first time, then he raised his head and stood for a shorter time than the first time, then he bowed to a time shorter than his first inclination, then he raised his head and prostrated himself. The prayer finished, he said what Allah willed he said, and then ordered the people to take refuge with Allah from the punishment of the grave". Chapter II The Eclipse Prayer 
(447) 4 - Asma the daughter of Abu Bakr AlSiddiq reported: "I came to find Aisha the wife of the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) and there was an eclipse of the sun, and I found the people, as well as Aisha, praying». I say to myself: “What are these people doing”? Aisha waved her hand to the sky saying: “Glory be to Allah”. I him I asked, "Is this a sign"? She affirmed it with her head. Asma added: “When I got up to pray, I almost lost knowledge, and I poured water on my head”. The Prayer finished, the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) praised Allah and exalted him then he said: “There are things that I had never seen, and that I have just seen from my seat here, even Heaven and Hell. I was inspired that you are going to undergo a temptation in your tombs similar to that of the Antichrist or almost - there is a doubt of the rapporteur - (the two angels will come) ask one of you: "What do you know of this man"? The believer or the man sure of his faith (I do not know exactly which of these two words mentioned Asma) will answer: "He is Muhammad, the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and the peace of Allah) who brought us certain proofs and the right way. We answered his call, we believed, and we followed (his teachings). As for the hypocrite or the one who doubts his faith (I don't know which of these two words Asma said, he will answer: "I do not know. I heard people say things about him and I repeated their words”. MOUATTAA In the name of Allah the Merciful the Merciful Book 13 Prayer for the Rainfall First chapter Praying to Allah for the fall of rain. 
(448) 1 - Abbad Ibn Tamim reported that he heard Abdallah Ibn Zaid Al-Mazini say: "the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) went to the "moussalla" (place of prayer) to make the prayer devoted to obtaining rain, changing the disposition of his clothing, and pointing towards 'qibla'. Malek was asked the number of raka'ts to be done in the prayer for obtaining the rain"? He replied, “They are two raka'ts but the imam has to do them before the sermon. He makes two raka'ts, then the sermon while standing and invokes Allah while moving towards the qibla, while changing the arrangement of his garment. During the two raka'ts, he does the recitation aloud, and when he changes the arrangement of his garment, he puts his right ends on the left, and the left ends on the right; and men do the same by moving towards the qibla while seated”. Chapter II What we owe say when we say this prayer. 
(449) 2 - Amr Ibn Chou'aib reported: "When the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) invoked Allah to obtain rain, he would say, “Great Allah! Water your worshipers and your beasts, show your mercy and restore life to your dead country”. 
(450) 3 - Anas Ibn Malek reported that a man came to find the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa hello) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) and he said to him: “O Messenger of Allah! the herds have perished, the roads are deserted, invoke Allah!” The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) invoked Allah, and we had rain for a whole week from Friday to Friday. More later, a man came to the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) and said to him: “O Messenger of Allah the dwellings are destroyed, the roads are flooded and the herds have perished”! The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) invoked Allah, with these words: “Great Allah! May the rain fall on the mountains and the hills, in the valleys and the forests”. Anas added: “Immediately the rain stopped falling on Medina and the Sky of that city was uncovered and became like the neckline of a shirt”. Malek was asked at about a man who missed the prayer for rain but he attends the sermon, then he wants to do it in the mosque or at his house when he returns? He answered: “he will have ample choice, he can do it or abstain”. Chapter III Of the request for rain thanks to the stars. 
(451) 4 - Zaid Ibn Khaled Al-Jouhani reported: "The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) gave us the dawn prayer at "Al-Houdaibia" after it rained all night. When the prayer was over, he turned to the people and said to them, “Do you know what your Lord has said”? He was told, "Allah and His Messenger know better than we". He continued: “This morning one of My servants became a believer and another stopped believing in Me. He who said: "We had rain thanks to Allah and His mercy", it is the believer who does not don't believe in stars; and he who said: “We had rain thanks to such and such a star”, does not believe in Me but believes in the stars”. 
(452) 5 - It was reported to Malek that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r On him be grace and | peace of Allah said, "If a cloud is found above the sea then it advances towards the east (litt on the side of Syria), there will be abundant rain”. \ (....) 6 - It was reported to Malek that Abu Houraira said: “if it is morning, and the rain fell at night: “we had rain thanks to the | victory that Allah has granted us”, then he recited: "No one withholds what Allah grants to men of mercy, and no one after him can give what He withholds" (Koran XXXV, 2). MOUATTAA In the name of Allah the Merciful the Merciful Book 14 The Quibla. Chapter One Prohibition to turn towards the qibla when one has to satisfy a natural need. 
(453) 1 - Abu Ayoub Al-Ansari, the companion of the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) being in Egypt, he said: "By Allah! I don't know what to do with these toilets, although the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "When one of you satisfies a natural need, let his face not be directed towards the quibla and he does not turn his back towards it" . 
(454) 2 - A man from the Ansar said that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) forbade to face to the qibla when one satisfies a natural need”. Chapter II Permission to turn towards the qibla when satisfying a natural need 
(455) 3 - Wasse Ibn Habban reported that Abdallah Ibn Omar said: "People say: "When you satisfy a natural need, let your face be turned neither to the qibla nor to the Holy House in Jerusalem. Abdallah added: "one day, I climbed on the roof of one of our residences, and I saw the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (On him the grace and the peace of Allah) sitting on two bricks, satisfying a natural need, while facing the Holy House in Jerusalem”. Wasse said to me: “You, you are perhaps one of those who say their prayers, leaning on your hips”? I replied, “By Allah! I don't know what you mean”. Malek said, "It's about of the man who prays prostrating himself without being lifted from the ground, and bows down while remaining as if nailed to the ground". Chapter III From the ban on spitting. 
(456) 4 - Abdallah Ibn Umar reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) saw a spit on the wall of the Ka'ba, he rubbed it, then addressed the men saying: "when one of you prays, let him not spit on the side of the qibla (lit: in front of him) for Allah the Blessed and the Most High is before him when he prays. 
(457) 5 - Aisha, the wife of the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said, "That at the sight of a spit, or secretion, or snot, on the wall of the Ka'ba, the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah), rubbed them». Chapter IV From the qibla. 
(458) 6 - Abdullah Ibn Omar reported: "As people were doing the dawn prayers at “Qouba”, someone came and said to them: “This night, the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) received a revelation; he was commanded to go towards the qibla (by praying), therefore go towards it”. The men turned towards Syria, and then they oriented towards the qibla”. 
(459) 7 - Sa'id Ibn Al Moussaiab reported: "Since his arrival in Medina, the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) made the prayer for sixteen months by directing his face towards Jerusalem then two months before the day of "Badr", the qibla was oriented towards (the Ka'ba)". 
(460) 8 - Nafe a reported that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab said: "There is a qibla, between the east and the west, when one goes towards the Ka'ba". Chapter V The Mosque of the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah). 
(461) 9 - Abu Huraira reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be the mercy and peace of Allah) said: "a prayer made in my mosque is worth (or is better valued than) a thousand prayers made in other mosques except the Sacred House”. 
(462) 10 - Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) said: "The space between my dwelling and my pulpit, is a garden of Paradise, and my pulpit found on my pelvis". 
(463) 11 - Abdallah Ibn Zaid Al-Mazini reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “Between my abode and my pulpit there is a parterre of the gardens of Paradise". Chapter VI From the exit of women to mosques. 
(464) 12 - Abdallah Ibn Umar reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “Do not forbid the servants of Allah (women) to go to the mosques”. 
(465) 13 - Busr Ibn Sa'id reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) said: "When one of you wants to pray the evening prayer in common (in the mosque), that she does not wear perfume". 
(466) 14 - Atiqa Bint Zaid Ibn Amr Ibn Noufail, the wife of Omar Ibn Al-Khattab reported that she asked permission from Omar Ibn Al-Khattab so that she could go to the mosque saying to him: "By Allah, I will go out unless that you do not prevent me", but Omar did not forbid him". 
(467) 15 - Aisha, the wife of the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “If the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) had known, what the women were doing in the mosque, he would have forbidden it to them as the Israelites had been forbidden (to go to the Synagogues). Yahia Ibn Sa'id a reported: "I asked Amra: 'Were the Israelites forbidden to go to the hours of prayer'? She replied: “Yes”. MOUATTAA In the name of Allah the Merciful the Merciful Book 15 The Koran First chapter Of the obligation to perform ablutions before touching the Koran. 
(468) 1 - Abdallah Ibn Abi Bakr Ibn Hazm reported that in the letter sent by the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) to Amr Ibn Hazm, he said to him: “Forbidden to touch the Koran, if one is not in a state of ritual purity”. Malek said: “a man who is not in a state of ritual purity should not carry the Koran by the knot, nor lay it on a cushion, and if that were permitted, it would have been carried in a bag. It was not banned for the fact that a man can have in his hand something that defiles the Koran, but because of its ritual impurity, out of respect for the Koran and for its veneration”. Malek also said, "This verse: 'Only those who are pure can touch it' (Qur'an LVI, 79) is the best I have heard about it, and is the same value as the verses found in Surah "Abassa" when Allah the Blessed and the Most High says: "No no! truly this is a Reminder * Anyone who will will remember it * It is contained in revered leaves * high and purified * in the hands of the scribes * noble and pure” (Koran LXXX, 11-16). Chapter II Permission to recite the Quran without ablution. 
(469) 2 - Muhammad Ibn Sirin reported that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab was among men who recited the Quran. As he left to satisfy a natural need, he returned still reciting the Koran. A man him remarked and said, “O prince of believers! Do you recite the Koran before you have performed your ablutions? He replied, “Who taught you that? Moussailima (the impostor)”? Chapter III From the subdivision of the Quran into (hizbs). 
(470) 3 Abdel Rahman Ibn Abdel-Kari reported that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab, said: "Whoever, for whatever reason, cannot recite 'his hizb', at night, and who will recite it before the sun leaves the meridian, until 'at the time of the midday prayer, it is as if he has not missed this recitation or according to a variant: as if he has caught up with it'. 
(471) 4 - Yahia Ibn Sa'id reported: "We were Muhammad Ibn Yahia Ibn Habban and I, sitting when Muhammad called a man and said, 'Tell me, what you heard your father say.' The man said, "My father told me, that he went to see Zaid Ibn Thabet and he said to him: "What do you think of reciting the Quran in seven days"? Zaid replied, "That's good, but I prefer that this recitation be done during fortnight (half a month) or in ten days. Ask me why? When asked, he replied, "So that I meditate on his senses and may understand him." Chapter IV Quran recitation. 
(472) 5 - Omar Ibn Al-Khattab reported: "I heard Hisham Ibn Hakim Ibn Hizam reciting Sura 'Discernment' (Al-Fourkan) in a way quite different from mine, and of which the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) had taught it to me. I was about to get angry with him, but I let him finish, then by his clothing, I held him and brought him to the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) saying to him: "O Messenger of Allah I heard that one, recite sura "Al-Fourkan" from a way different from the one you taught me". The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said to me: “let go of him”, then he said to him: “O Hisham, recite”. Hicham recited the same sura that I had heard before, then the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam)r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) replied: "That's how she was revealed to me”. Then he said to me, “Recite it”. After my recitation he said to me: "this is how it was revealed to me, this Koran was revealed on seven variants (of reading); take, therefore, the one that you seems the easiest (simple)”. 
(473) 6 Abdallah Ibn Umar reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “He who holds back the Koran is like a man who has camels tied. If he keeps them like that, he can keep them, but if he lets them go, they run away”. 
(474) 7 - Aisha, the wife of the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) reported that Al-Hareth Ibn Hisham asked the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah): "How do you receive the revelation"?. He replied: “Sometimes I receive it like the ringing of a bell, which is very painful to me, once it stops, I grasp what has been revealed to me; other times, the angel comes to me in a human form, who speaks to me, and I remember everything he said to me”. Aicha added, “I have seen receiving the revelation in very cold weather, and once it ceased sweat began to trickle down his brow. (475) 8- Ourwa reported: Surah Abassa LXXX) was revealed about by Abdallah Ibn Oum Maktoum. He came to find the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) saying to him: “O Muhammad! make me sit next to you", while the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) one of the notables of the polytheists". The Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) turned away from him welcoming the other with kindness and he said to him: “O, the father of so and so! Do you find any harm in what I have just told you? finds no harm in it”. At that moment, he received this revelation: “he frowned and turned away * because the blind man came to him” (Koran LXXX, 1,2). 
(476) 9 - Zaid Ibn Aslam reported that his father related the following story: “In one of his expeditions, the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) walked and Umar Ibn Al-Khattab kept him company. It happened that Omar asked a question to the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) but without receiving an answer, then he asked him the question for the second time without him however having an answer; and it was the same for the third time. So, Omar said to himself: "for three times, you took up the same question from the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) without you having answer". And Omar added: “I then pushed my camel and arrived at the head of the men, fearing that a revelation from the Koran would be made about me, I was such, until I heard that I was called. I always feared this revelation about me, and came very close to the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) I greeted him, and he said to me: “that night, I was made to reveal a surah which was more pleasing to me than anything else on which the sun rises”. Then he recited: "Yes, we have granted you a resounding victory" (Koran XLVIII, 1). 
(477) 10 - Abu Sa'id reported that he heard the Apostle of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) say: “Among you will come people, whose prayer with theirs, fasting and their religious practices will make you think little of your prayer your fasting and your religious practices. They will recite the Koran, without their recitation exceeds their throat. They will come out of religion like an arrow piercing game so that looking at its point, it has nothing; you look at the shaft, it has nothing, and you look at the beard, it has nothing; you will doubt then that this arrow had been shot”. (....) 11 - We reported to Malek, that Abdallah Ibn Omar took eight years to learn the surah: "The Cow". Chapter V Prostration when reciting the Quran. 
(478) 12 Abu Salama Ibn Abdel Rahman reported that Abu Huraira, while praying, recited Surah "al-Inshiqaq" (Qur'an LXXXIV,) and prostrated himself. The prayer finished, he told them that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) while reciting it, made a prostration”. 
(479) 13 - Nafe, Ibn Omar's slave reported that a man from the inhabitants of Egypt informed him that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab, while reciting surah "al-Hajj (XXII)."" made two prostrations, and said: “this surah was preferred to the others by two prostrations”. 
(480) 14 - Abdullah Ibn Dinar reported that he saw Abdallah Ibn Omar, making two prostrations while reciting surah “al-Hajj (XXII)”. 
(481) 15 - Al-A'raj reported that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab recited the sura: “an-Najm” (Quran LIII,) and made a prostration, then raising his head, he recited another sura”. 
(482) 16 - Ourwa reported that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab, being in the pulpit, he recited a surah where there was a prostration, in a day of Friday, then descended, made a prostration and the men did the same. Umar recited the same surah on another Friday, and as the men were about to prostrate themselves, he said to them, "Easy, Allah has not prescribed this prostration for us unless we want to do it." He did not prostrate himself and he prevented the men from doing it”. Malek says: “The imam does not have to leave his pulpit to make a prostration when he recites a verse that requires it”. Malek said: “we consider that there are eleven prostrations in the Qur'an, none of which are found in the suras of the "Mufassal". And Malek said, "He doesn't befits no one to recite, after the dawn prayers, and the asr, of the Koran containing a prostration because the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him be grace and peace of Allah) has forbidden any prayer made after that of the dawn until sunrise and after that of the asr until its sunset. And since prostration is part of prayer, it is inappropriate to reciting from the Koran, where there is a prostration in these two moments”. Malek was asked at subject of the one who recites from the Koran where there is a prostration while his wife has her menses: should she prostrate”? He answered: “neither the man nor the woman will have to prostrate themselves, except when they are in a state of purity”. Malek was asked, , at the subject of a woman reciting from the Koran, where there is prostration, while her husband is listening; should he prostrate himself with her He answered: “He will not have to prostrate himself, because to tell the truth; prostration is only required when the man is with others presiding over the prayer, then he recites the verse where there is a prostration, he prostrates himself and men do it with him. But in case a man hears such a verse recited by another who is not his Imam, he should not do the prostration. Chapter VI The two suras “al-Ikhlas and al-Mulk 
(483) 17 - Abu Sa'id Al Khoudri heard a man, still praying, recite Surah "al-Ikhlas" (Koran CXII). As he found that this sura is not so sufficient, he went in the morning to the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) to tell him about it. The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) answered him: "By him, who holds my soul in His hand, this sura is valued at one third of the Koran”. 
(484) 18 - Abu Huraira narrated: "Coming with the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) He heard a man reciting surah "al-Ikhlas", he said : "it is assured to him". I asked him: “what is assured to him, O Messenger of Allah”? He answered: “Paradise”. And Abu Huraira added: “I wanted to go and tell the good news to this man, but I was afraid to miss lunch with the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah); so I decided to have, first, lunch with the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam), then to go to the man, but he had already left". 
(485) 19 - Ibn Chehab reported that Humaid Ibn Abdel-Rahman Ibn Awf told him the sura: "al-Ikhlas" is equivalent to the third of the Quran and sura "al-Mulk" will intercede for whoever recited it. Chapter VII Remembrance of Allah the Blessed and the Most High. 
(486) 20 - Abu Hurairah reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "He who says a hundred times a day:" There is no other deity but Allah, the Unique, He has no partner, to Him the Kingship and the Praise, He is powerful over all thing”, these words will be equivalent to him the emancipation of ten slaves, one hundred good deeds will be counted to him, and another hundred bad erased. They will keep him from the devil all day long until it is evening. No one will have acquired better than him than another who will have repeated these words more than him”. 
(487) 21 - Abu Huraira narrated that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) said: "Whoever says a hundred times per day: "Glory and Praise be to Allah, his faults will be erased from him even if they were quantitatively like the foam of the sea". (488) 22" Abu Houraira said: “Whoever after each prayer glorifies Allah (subahnallah) thirty three times, proclaims his greatness (Allahu Akbar) thirty three times. Praise him (Allamdoulillah) thirty three times and end these words with: “There is no partner, to Him the kingship and the praise. II is powerful over all things”, that one will have all his sins erased, even if they were as numerous as the foam of the sea”. 
(489) 23 - Umara Ibn Sayyad reported that he heard Sa'id Abdallah Ibn AI-Mussaiab say about “imperishable good deeds” (Koran XVIII, 46) what are these words that the servant utters: "God is great. Glory be to Allah. Praise be to Allah. There is no god but Allah. There is neither power nor strength except in Allah”. 
(490) 24 - Ziad Ibn Abi Ziad reported that Abu Dardaa said: "Shall I tell you what are your best works, the highest of your degrees, the purest with your Sovereign, which will be of much more value to you what you are given in gold and silver, to meet your enemy and kill him or that he will kill you”? He was answered: “Certainly, yes”. He replied, "It is the mention (zhikr) of Allah." Ziad Ibn Ziad added: "Abu Abdel Rahman Mu'az Ibn Jabal said: "Among all the works of the son of Adam, only the work, of the mention of Allah, can save him from the punishment of Allah”. 
(491) 25 - Rifa'a Ibn Rafé reported: “one day, while making the prayer behind the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah), he said raising his head from the inclination: "Allah listens to those who praise” (Sami Allahu liman hamidah). A man behind him cried, "Our Lord, to You praise, many blessed praises and good”. (Rabbana wa laka'l hamd kathiran tayiban mubarakan fihi). The prayer completed, the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's favor and peace) (asked: "Who therefore uttered those words I just heard”? The man replied: “It is I, O Messenger of Allah”! The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) replied: "I have seen more than thirty angels who were hastening and each one wanted to be the first to write these words”. Chapter VIII From the invocation of Allah. (492) 26- Abu Huraira reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) said: “Every Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) had an invocation that Allah grants; as for mine, I wish to keep it until the day of the resurrection so that it may be an intercession for my community». 
(493) 27 - Yahia Ibn Sa'id was told that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) invoked Allah with these words: “Great Lord, it is You who open the dawn. You who assign the night to rest, who make the sun and the moon a measure of time! discharge me of my debt, enrich me with poverty, and make me enjoy my hearing, my sight, and my strength in Your path”. (Allahumma faliqa'l isbah, wa ja ila'l-layli sakana, wa'sh-shamsi wa'l-qamari housbana. iqdi anniy addayna, wa'ghnaniy mina'l faqr. Na'mti aniy bi samiy wa basariy, wa qouwwatiy fi sabilik) 
(494) 28 - Abu Huraira narrated that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "when one of you invoke Allah, let him not say: “Great Allah! Forgive me, if you want; Have mercy on me, if you want! Rather, he asserts in his motion. No one obliges Allah not to grant”. 
(495) 29 - Abu Huraira reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) said: "Each of you will be granted, unless he hastens and says to himself: "I invoked, but I was not granted". (496) 30- Abu Hurairah reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) said: "Allah, the Blessed and the Most High, come down every night in the sky below, when the first third of the night has passed and say: "Who calls on Me, so that I hear it? Who asks Me in order to give to him? Who implores My forgiveness so that I may grant it to him”?. 
(497) 31 - Aisha, the mother of believers reported: "I lay down near the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah), I awoke and found him not; I waved my hand, and she touched his feet as he prostrated, invoking Allah with these words: "I seek refuge in Your satisfaction from Your wrath, in Your forgiveness from Your punishment, in You from You. I cannot count Your praises, You are like You praised Yourself”.( Aoudhou bi ridaka min sakhatika, wa bi mouafatika min ouqoubatika wa bika minka, la ouhsiy thana'an alayka, anta kama athnayta ala nafsika. 
(498) 32 - Talha Ibn Oubaidallah Ibn Kariz reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) said: "The most meritorious is that made on the day of "Arafa". And the best words that I have uttered as well as all the Prophets who have preceded me, are the following: "There is no god but Allah, the Unique, he has no partner ”.( (La ilaha illa'llah, wahdahu la sharika lah.)" 
(499) 33 - Abdallah Ibn Abbas reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) taught the faithful this invocation, as if he were teaching them the surah of the Koran: “Great Allah! I take refuge with You from the punishment of Gehenna; I take refuge with You from the torment of the grave; I take refuge with You from the temptation of the antichrist; and I seek refuge with You from the trials of life and death”.( Allahumma inniy audhu bika min adhabi jahannama, wa audhu bika min adhabi'l-qabri, wa audhu bika min fitnati'l-mahya wa mamati. 
(500) 34 - Abdallah Ibn Abbas reported: "When the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) woke up, to pray, at the middle of the night, he invoked Allah with these words: “Great Allah! To You the praise. You are the light of the heavens and the earth, and what is between them. You are the truth, your words are the truth, your promise is the truth. Your meeting is a Truth. Heaven is a Truth, Hell is a Truth, the Supreme Hour is a Truth. Great Allah! I give myself entirely to You, I believe in You, I entrust myself to You, I come back to You. It's thanks to You that I plead (the truth) and it's You that I take the judgment. Forgive me what I have anticipated and what I will delay, what I do in secret and what I do in public. You are my Allah, there is no other Allah but You”. (Allahoumma laka'l-hamdu anta nouru's-samawati wa'l-ardi, wa laka'l-hamdu anta qayamou's-Samawati wa'l-ardi, wa laka'l-hamdou anta rabbou's-Samawati wa'l-ardi,wamanfihina.Anta'l-haqqou,waqaouwlouka'lhaqqu, wa wadouka'l-haqqou, wa liqa'ouka haqqoun, wa jannatou haqqoun, wa naoru haqqoun, wa sactou haqqoun. Allahoumma laka aslamtou, wa bikaamantou, waalayka tawakaltou, wa ilayka anabtou, wa bika khasamtou, wa ilayka hakamtou, fa'ghfirliy ma qadamtou wa akhartou wa asrartou, wa alantou. Anta ilahiy, la ilaha illa ant. ) 
(501) 35 - Abdullah Ibn Abdullah Ibn Jaber Ibn Atik reported: “Abdallah Ibn Omar came find us with some of Bani Mu'awia in one of the Ansar villages, and he said to us: "Do you know, in which place of your mosque, the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (On him the grace and peace of Allah) did he make the prayer”? I replied, "Yes," and pointed to a certain side. Then he asked: "Do you know the three invocations he made"? I tell him: “Yes”. He finally asked me: "Tell them to me, then." I replied: "He invoked Allah, not to give victory to an enemy if he does not have one of their own (one of the Muslims), not to destroy them by scarcity, and Allah has granted them. He finally invoked Allah not to kill each other, but Allah refused him. Abdullah replied: "you have said the truth". Ibn Omar added: “the killing will not cease, until the day of resurrection”. 
(502) 36 - Malek reported that Zaid Ibn Aslam said, "every supplication a man formulates will have one of three results: it will be granted, or spared (until the day of resurrection) or it will be an atonement for his sins." Chapter IX The way to invoke. 
(503) 37 - Abdullah Ibn Dinar reported 'Abdallah Ibn Umar saw me invoking Allah by raising two fingers (one from each hand), he forbade me to do this'. 
(504) 38 - Yahia Ibn Sa'id reported that Sa'id Ibn Al-Musaiab said: “Man will be lifted up (from degrees in Paradise) thanks to the invocations of his children after his death". Saying this, he raised his hands to heaven. 
(505) 39 - Hisham Ibn Ourwa reported that his father said, "This verse was only revealed about invocations: "When you pray: do not raise the voice, do not pray in a low voice, seek an intermediate mode” (Koran XVII, 110). Malek was asked at subject of a written invocation that is made during the canonical prayer? He replied, "There is nothing wrong with that." 
(506) 40 - It was reported to Malek that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) was calling upon Allah and saying: “Great Allah! I ask you (to help me) to do good works, to leave what is blameworthy, to be compassionate for the poor. Yes You want to inflict a temptation on people, collect my soul without being tested”. (Allahoumma inniy asa'louka fala'l-khayrati, wa tarqa'l-mounqarati, wa houbba'l-masakin, wa idha aradta fi'n-nasi fitnatan fa'qbithni ilayka ghayra maftoun.) 
(507) 41 • It was reported to Malek that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) said: "Anyone who invites a straight path, will have a reward equivalent to that of those who will follow it without that of those who have followed it being diminished. Any man who invites aberration, will bear a burden equal to the burdens of those who followed him, without however the burdens of those who followed him are lessened". 
(508) 42 On reported to Malek that Abdallah Ibn Umar said, “Great Allah! Make me a leader of those who represent Your fear”. (Allahumma jalniy min a'imati'l-mutaqin.) 
(509) 43 It was reported to Malek, that Abu Al-Darda woke up in the middle of the night and said: “the eyes have fallen asleep, the stars have disappeared and You are the Living One, the Eternal Allah”!. Chapter X The prohibition to make a prayer after that of the dawn and after that of the asr. 
(510) 44 - Abdallah Ibn Al-Sounabihi reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "When the sun rises, the horn of the devil accompanies him; thus, when it rises in the horizon, this horn will disappear; when he is in the middle of the sky, the horn will accompany the sun; and once this has left the meridian, it will separate from him. When the sun is at its lie down, the horn again will accompany him; and once the sun went to bed, she will leave him". The Apostle of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) forbade prayer at such times. 
(511) 45 - Urwa reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “When the round solar begins to appear, delay the prayer until it fully appears; and when the sundial is at its disappearance, delay the prayer until its complete disappearance”. 
(512) 46 - Al'-Ala Ibn Abdel Rahman reported: “Having entered Anas Ibn Malek's house one afternoon, we saw him praying the asr. The prayer finished, we made the observation to him of having hastened the prayer or even, it is he who mentioned it, then he said: "I heard the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him be grace and peace of Allah) say: "This is the prayer of the hypocrites" (using this expression for three times); it is that one of you sat down waiting for the sun to turn yellow, and to enter two horns of the devil or on a horn of the devil then he gets up to make a prayer of four raka'ts, in haste without thinking much of Allah". 
(513) 47 - Abdallah Ibn Umar reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r Upon him the grace and peace of Allah said: "Let one of you, do not not try to pray either at sunrise or at sunset. 
(514) 48 - Abu Huraira narrated that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) forbade making a prayer after that of the asr until sunset, and after that of dawn before sunrise”. 
(516) 50 -Al-Saeb Ibn Yazid reported that he saw Omar Ibn Al-Khattab hitting Al-Mounkader while he was praying after the asr'. MOUATTAA In the name of Allah the Merciful the Merciful Book 16 Funerals Chapter One The Lotion of the Dead. (517 1 Ja'far Ibn Muhammad reported from his father that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) was washed, while he wore only one tunic". 
(518) 2 Umm Atia Al-Ansaria reported: “When the daughter of the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) died, he came to us and said, "Wash it three times, or five times, or even more, if you find the necessity, with water and lotus, and add at the end camphor or a little camphor. And when you finish, let me know”; once, the washing finished, we preceded him, he entered and gave us his izar saying, “wrap her with that izar”. 
(519) 3 - Abdallah Ibn Abi Bakr reported that Asma Bint Oumaiss washed her husband, Abu Bakr Al-Siddiq when he died, then she went out and told the Muhajirins who were there: "As I am fasting, and it is very cold, should I make a lotion”? They answered him: “no”. 
(520) 4 - Malek a reported that he heard people versed in religion say, "If a woman dies and there are no women to wash her, nor a person with whom her marriage is illicit (lit.= zou mahram ), nor her husband, the pulveral lustration is applied to her by rubbing her face and hands with pure sand”. Malek added: “It is, what is also to follow, in case a man dies, and there are only women with him; they will give him a powdery lustration”. Malek also said, "He there does not exist, among us, a prescription to follow for the washing of the dead, but we wash and purify it”. Chapter II Of the burial of the dead. 
(521) 5 - Aicha, the wife of the Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) reported: “When the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) died, he was buried in three white garments “souhoulia”, where there was neither shirt nor turban”. 
(522) 6 - Yahia Ibn Sa'id reported: "I was informed that Abu Bakr, during his sickness, asked Aisha: “In how many clothes, the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) was buried”? She replied, “In three white 'souhoulia' garments. Abu Bakr then said, "Take this garment (a garment which he wore, and which was spotted with ocher and saffron), wash it, then bury me in it with two other garments". Aisha asked: "what does this mean"? Abu Bakr replied: "The living have much more right to wear new clothing than the dead, because this clothing (worn and which will serve as a shroud) will be intended for the sanity". 
(523) 7 Abdullah Amr Ibn Al'-As said, “The dead must be buried first with a shirt, an izar and then a third garment. But, in case there is only one garment, it is sufficient for burial”. Chapter III The march in front of the funeral procession. 
(524) 8 - Ibn Chehab reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace), Abu Bakr, and Umar walked in front of the funeral procession and the caliphs did the same as well as Abdallah Ibn Omar”. 
(525) 9 - Rabi'a Ibn Abdallah Ibn Al-Hadir reported that he saw Omar Ibn Al-Khattab walking in front of Zainab bint Jahch's funeral procession. 
(526) 10 - Hicham Ibn Ourwa said: “I never saw my father walking except in front of the funeral procession” Then he added: “He then came to “Al-Baqi” and the men passed in front of him. 
(527) 11 - Ibn Chehab said: "it is to follow an erroneous sunnah, to walk behind a funeral procession". Chapter IV Of the prohibition to follow the funeral procession, of a fire. 
(528) 12 - Hisham Ibn Ourwa, reported that Asma the daughter of Abu Bakr said to her relatives: "when I die, incense my clothes then embalm my corpse, but without spreading the balm on my shroud, and do not make me not follow fire. ] 
(529) 13 - Abu Sa'id Al-Makbouri reported that Abu Huraira forbade his funeral procession to be followed by a fire. Yahia said, "I heard Malek loath this." Chapter V The takbirs on the dead. 
(530) 14 - Abu Hurairah reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) when announcing the death of "An-Najachi", to the people, on the very day of his death, went to the place of prayer with them, lined them up and then he made (the funeral prayer) of four takbirs”. 
(531) 15 - Abou Oumama Ibn Sahl Ibn Hunaif reported: "We told of Mesquina's illness, to the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) who used to render visit the poor and inquire about them. He said to them, "Let me know, when Mesquina dies." As people wanted to bury Mesquina, at night, they were reluctant to wake up the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the mercy and peace of Allah). In the morning, once it's been informed of the death of Mesquina, he said to them: “Did I not order you to inform me of his death”? He was told: “O Messenger of Allah, we were loath to wake you up and bring you out at night”. The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) then went out to the cemetery, put the men in rows in front of the tomb, and made a prayer of four takbirs". 
(532) 16 - Malek asked Ibn Chehab about the man who manages to make a part of takbirs on the dead in common while missing the other part”. He replied, "He will only do the takbirs he missed." Chapter VI What to say about death. 
(533) 17 - Abu Sa'id Al-Makbouri asked Abu Houraira: “How do you perform the funeral prayer”? He replied, “I will tell you. I am from the when carrying the stretcher; if it is deposited, I make the takbirs by praising Allah and praying on his Prophet (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah). Then I invoke Allah with these words: “Great Allah! (this dead man) is Your servant, the son of Your servant, and of Your handmaiden. He testified that there is no other Allah than You, and that Muhammad is Your servant and Your Messenger. Although you know this better than anyone: Great Allah! if he was a good man, do increase his good, and if he was a sinner, forgive him his misdeeds. Great Allah! Deprive us not of the reward (of this funeral prayer) on him, and test us not of any temptation after him”.( Allahumma inna huwa abduka wa'bnu abdika wa'bnu amatika. Kana yash-hadu an la ilaha illa ant wa anna Muhammadan abduka wa rasooluka, wa anta alamu bihi. Allahumma in kana muhsinan zid fi ihsanihi, wa in kana musiyan fa tajawaz an sayatihi. Allahumma la tahrimna ajrahu wa lataftina badahu.)
