It was the arrival of Abdul Rahman Ibn Awf, who was absent to satisfy a natural need, and saying: “I have some knowledge about it, because I heard the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) say: “If you hear that the plague has attacked a country, do not go there any more. And if it is done that the plague attacks a country where you are, do not leave this country in order to flee the disease”. Umar thus praised Allah and returned home. 
(1656) 23 - Sa'd Ibn Abi Waqas reported from his father that he heard someone ask Osama Ibn Zaid: “What did you hear the Apostle of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be the grace and peace of Allah) say about the plague"? Osama replied: "The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "The plague is a punishment whom Allah had sent to Bani Israel, or to those who preceded you; so when you are aware of the attack of this disease in a country, do not enter it; and if the disease attacks the country where you are, do not leave this country, in order to flee this disease”. 
(1657) 24 - Abdallah Ibn Amer reported that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab leaving for Châm (Syria) and arriving in Sargh, he was told that the plague is in this country. Abdul Rahman Ibn Awf reported to him that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “Once you learn that the plague is there in a country, do not enter it again. And if this disease attacks the country where you are, do not leave the country, in order to flee it”. 
(1658) 25 - Salem Ibn Abdallah said that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab had returned from Sargh, according to the statements of Abdul Rahman Ibn Awf”. 
(1659) 26 - It was reported to Malek that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab said: "a house in Roukba (place located between Mecca and Iraq) is better preferred to me than ten others in Shâm". - Malek explaining this hadith, says: “Omar heard say the long life of the inhabitants of this locality (Roukba), and the seriousness of this disease in Châm. MOUATTAA In the name of Allah the Merciful the Merciful Book 46 The Book of Destiny First chapter: The ban on challenging predestination 
(1660) 1 - Abu Hurairah narrated that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) said: "Adam and Moses debated, during which Adam advanced to Moses an argument thus seeking to convince him. Moses said to Adam: "Did you Adam seduce men and make them leave Paradise"? And Adam responds: “Is it you Moses, to whom Allah has given knowledge of all things, and has even distinguished you from all others by His Message”? "Yes-answered Moses"; And Adam to resume: "Are you blaming me for a matter that was predestined to me, even before I was created"?. 
(1661) 2 - Muslem Ibn Yassar Al-Jouhani reported that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab was asked about the explanation of the following verse; “When your Lord took offspring from the loins of the sons of Adam, he made them testify against themselves: “Am I not your Lord”? They said, “Yes, we bear witness to it”! And this so that you did not say on the day of resurrection (meaning): “….We were caught off guard….” (Koran, VII,172). Umar replied, “I heard people, asking the Apostle of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) about the same verse, where he answered them: “Allah Blessed and Most High, created Adam, then II Y caressed his back with His right hand thus extracting an offspring. Then He said: "I created these for Paradise and they perform the deeds of the elect of Paradise. Then There stroked Adam's back, extracting another offspring, then said, "I created these for Hell, and they shall perform the deeds of the damned." A man said, “O Messenger of Allah what is this to do”? The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) replied: “When Allah Y create a man for Paradise, There cause him to do the works of the elect, until he dies doing a work of those done by the elect; so therefore, he will be in Paradise. And when II Y creates a man for Hell, he will cause him to do the works of the damned until he dies and performs one of these works, and so will be in Hell”. 
(1662) 3 - It was reported to Malek that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "I have left you two topics; if you follow them, you will never be lost: The Book of Allah, and the Sunnah of His Prophet. 
(1663) 4 - Taous Al-Yamani said: “I lived in a time when I was contemporary to companions of the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) who said: "Everything is subject to predestination". - Taous to continue: “I heard Abdallah Ibn Omar say that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "Everything is subject to predestination, even inactivity and energy, or energy and inactivity". 
(1664) 5 - Amr Ibn Dinar reported: “I heard Abdallah Ibn Al Zoubair say during his oath: “Allah Y is he who guides and leads astray”. 
(1665) 6 - Abu Souhail Ibn Malek said: "I I was walking with Omar Ibn Abdul Aziz when he said to me, “What are you saying about the Qadarias. I answered him: “I understand that you encourage them to repent; so, either they repent or they are fought with the sword”. Omar resumed: "Such is also my opinion." - And Malek said: “I agree with Omar”. Chapter II About the "Qadarias".(1) (1) It is a group of people who push back the predestination, believing that every deed done by every servant of Allah, depends on his own will independent of that of Allah 
(1666) 7 - Abu Hurairah narrated that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) said: "Let the woman not ask not to his sister to be divorced so that she has her meal (namely so that she occupies her place), and that she gets married. Because, she will only have what Allah has predestined for her”. 
(1667) 8 - Muhammad Ibn Ka'b Al-Qurazi reported, that Mu'awia Ibn Abi Sufian, being on the mimbar (the pulpit), said: "Men! No one can prevent what Allah grants, and no one gives what that Allah prevents; neither wealth nor rank is beneficial because it is Allah who bestows it. Whomever Allah wills for good, There instructed in religion”. Then Mu'awia continued and said: "I heard the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) say these words, with his own mouth, being on this same pulpit”. 
(1668) 9 - It was reported to Malek that it was said: “Praise be to Allah, Who perfectly created everything; nothing will happen except according to what He predestines (i.e. neither before nor after the time-predestined). Allah is enough for me; Allah hears whoever calls on Him, Allah is our only destiny”. 
(1669) 10 - It was reported to Malek that it was said: “No one will die until he has had all the goods, which are predestined for him by Allah. So, be moderate in asking for your goods from Allah”. MOUATTAA In the name of Allah the Merciful the Merciful Book 47 The Book of Good Characters First chapter: Of what are good characters 
(1670) 1 - Mu'az Ibn Jabal said: "What the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam)r (Upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) recommended to me last place, just when I had my foot in the stirrup is: “O Mu'az Ibn Jabal! Be of good character with people”. 
(1671) 2 - Aicha, the wife of the Prophet (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “When he had to choose between two subjects. The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) chose only the simplest, unless it resulted in sin. evil deed he was furthest from it. And the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) never sought revenge against an injury that concerned him, unless it was from the Majesty of Allah, who was touched; then he took revenge in the name of Allah”. 
(1672) 3 - Ali Ibn Hussein Ibn Ali Ibn Abi Taleb a reported that the Messenger of Allah (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) says: "it is beautiful Islam, that a man should not meddle in what does not concern him". 
(1673) 4 - Aisha, the wife of the Prophet (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) reported: "A man asked the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) to allow him to enter him, while I was there with him. The Messenger of Allah (upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) said, "What an abominable son of the tribe!" allows him. Aisha continued: “Soon after, I soon heard the laughter of the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah). Once the man came out, I said, “O Messenger of Allah you said a lot of things about this man, then I heard you laughing with him”. He replied: “the worst of people is the one whose wickedness is feared”. 
(1674) 5 - Abu Souhail Ibn Malek reported from his father that Ka'b Al-Ahbar said: "if you want to know, what Allah has predestined for his servant, listen to the praises given to him after his death". 
(1675) 6 - It was reported to Yahia Ibn Sa'id that said: "Man, thanks to his good character, can be taken in the same title that one who spends the night in. praying, and of the fasting person on hot days". 
(1676) 7 - Yahia Ibn Sa'id reported that he has heard Sa'id Ibn Al Moussaiab say: "Shall I tell you, what is better than prayer and almsgiving"? "Certainly yes," they replied. He went on: "Reconcile people with each other, beware of animosity, because it uproots everything". 
(1677) 8 - It was reported to Malek that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r Upon him the grace and peace of Allah said: "I have been sent to complete the correct characters. Chapter II About modesty 
(1678) 9 - Zaid Ibn Talha Ibn Roukana reported a hadith which he attributes to the Prophet, where he said: “All religion has a character; and that of Islam is modesty”. 
(1679) 10 - Abdallah Ibn Umar reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam), r (Be upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) passed through a man, who advised his co-religionist brother about modesty. The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) said to him, "Leave him alone, for modesty is faith." Chapter III about anger 
(1680) 11 - Houmaid Ibn Abdul Rahman Ibn Awf reported that a man went to the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) said to him: "O Messenger of Allah, teach me words that will be useful to me in my life, without there being too many of them, because I am afraid of forgetting them”. He replied, "Don't get angry." 
(1681) 12 - Abu Hurairah narrated that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) said: "Man does not keep his power of his strength: ^ but in fact he holds it if he manages to dominate himself at the moment of his anger». Chapter IV About dislike 
(1682) 13 - Abu Ayoub al-Ansari reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) said: "It is not tolerated to a Muslim to have aversion towards his co-religionist brother for more than three nights, and when they meet each turns away from the other. The best of them is the one who takes the initiative to greet. 
(1683) 14 - Anas Ibn Malek reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) said: “Do not take dislike one another, do not envy one another, do not shun one another, and be servants of Allah, brotherly. And it is not tolerated that a Muslim runs away from his brother for more than three nights”. - Malek said: “I only conceive flight in the sense that a man turns away from another”. 
(1684) 15 - Abu Huraira reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) said: "Beware of doubt, for doubt is lying. Do not spy, do not be indiscreet; do not compete with each other, do not envy each other, do not lower each other, do not run away from each other, and be servants of Allah, brotherly”. 
(1685) 16 - Ata Ibn Abi Muslim al-Khourassani reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "Shake hands with each other, all hostility will dissipate, and exchange gifts, all dislike will disappear". 
(1686) 17 - Abu Huraira reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the Grace and Peace of Allah) said: “The gates of Paradise open every Monday and Thursday. And we forgive any Muslim servant who does not associate anything with Allah, except for two men whose hostility separates them, and we will say: wait until these two men are reconciled, wait until these two men are reconciled, wait May these two men be reconciled. 
(1687) 18 - Abu Houraira said: "the doings of men are exposed twice a week: Monday and Thursday; and every believing servant be forgiven, except he that beareth enmity for his brother, and it shall be said, "Leave these two men until they come to themselves” or: “Give these two men time to come to themselves”. MOUATTAA In the name of Allah the Merciful the Merciful Book 48 The book of clothes Chapter I About putting on clothes to beautify yourself 
(1688) 1 - Jaber Ibn Abdallah Al-Ansari reported: “We left with the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) for the expedition of 'Bani Anmar”. I was in the shade of a tree, and seeing the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah), I said to him: “O Messenger of Allah come put yourself in the shade of this tree". The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) descended, and I got up to look in a large bag, something to eat; finding some cucumbers, I cut one and gave it to the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) who asked me: "Where did you brought that”? Jaber to say, “We brought him with us, coming out of Medina,” and Jaber to continue, “We had a man, to whom we gave what was needed, and who leads our flock to pasture. So I gave this man, said Jaber, what he needed, then he left in the heat wave, having put on two clothes grated. “The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r looked at him and said, "Hasn't he got anything other than these two clothes"? “Certainly, yes,” I replied, “there are two others in the cloakroom, which I had given him". The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) said: "Call him, and order him to put them on." I called the man to put on both clothes, then he left. So the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “What is the matter with this man; than Allah strikes his neck; Aren't these two garments better than the others"? The man hearing the words of the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace), said, "O Messenger of Allah let me die in the way of Allah." The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) replied: "Let it be in the way of Allah". The man later was killed in the way of Allah”. 
(1689) 2 - It was reported to Malek that Umar Ibn Al-Khattab said, "I like those who recite the Quran to be seen dressed all in white." 
(1690) 3 - Ibn Sirin reported that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab said: “If Allah grants you wealth, then live easily. Let a man be wrapped in all his garments”. Chapter II Wearing clothes dyed and embroidered in gold 
(1691) 4 - Nafe' reported that Abdallah Ibn Omar put on clothes dyed with Saffron and red earth”. - Yahia reported that he heard Malek say, "I hates the fact that the boys put on clothes embroidered with gold, because I have been told that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) forbade putting on rings Golden. Thus, I refuse it to men, big or small, however small they may be”. - Yahia reported that he heard Malek say to About safflower-dyed draped garments in the house and in the courtyards of dwellings: “I do not believe this is forbidden; but other clothes are more preferred to me”. Chapter III The fact of wearing silk clothes (called Khazz) (l) 
(1692) 5 - Hisham Ibn Ourwa reported from his father that Aisha, the wife of the Prophet (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) had given Abdallah Ibn Al-Zoubair, a garment in Khazz, to wear, which Aisha had already put on”. (1) type of fabric whose warp is in silk and the weft in wool. Chapter IV What we dislike as clothes for women 
(1693) 6 - Alqama Ibn Abi Alqama reported from his mother that Hafsa, Bint Abdul Rahman went to Aisha, the wife of the Prophet r (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace), and Hafsa was covered with a very thin veil. Aicha cut this veil, and covered Hafsa with another thicker one”. 
(1694) 7 - Abu Saleh reported that Abu Huraira says: “There are women clothed (in finery) and naked, disobedient and seductive, who will not enter Paradise, nor even smell its odor, although its odor is spread over a distance of five hundred years of travel” . 
(1695) 8 - Ibn Chehab narrated that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) got up at night, looked at the sky and said, “How many treasures are opened this night (meaning of mercy and benefits)? What troubles are sent? How many women are clothed (in the world here below), and naked (in the world beyond) on the day of resurrection. Awaken those who dwell the mansions”. Chapter V The fact of dragging the habit out of vanity 
(1696) 9 - Abdallah Ibn Umar reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Be upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) said: “Whoever, out of vanity, drags his robe, Allah does not pay attention to him, on the day of resurrection. 
(1697) 10 - Abu Huraira reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) said: “Allah Y, Blessed and Most High will not, on the day of resurrection, pay attention to him who, with vanity, drags his habit. 
(1698) 11 - Abdallah Ibn Umar reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “On the day of resurrection, Allah Y , has no interest in anyone who ostentatiously drags his habit. 
(1699) 12 - Al'Ala Ibn Abdul Rahman reported according to his father, that he asked Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri about the izar? He replied, “I can teach you. I heard the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) say: “The believer's izar should not go beyond the mid-leg. So, there's nothing wrong with it being over the heels; but if the izar goes lower than the heels, this will go to Hell, and lower still, will go to Hell. Allah Y , the day of the resurrection, will not look, the one who vainly drags his habit”. Chapter VI About the woman who drags her clothes 
(1700) 13 - Safia Bint Abi Oubaid reported that Umm Salama, the wife of the Prophet (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace), referring to the izar, asked the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah): “What do you say about the dress of the woman"? He replied, “She can lengthen it a span (heels). Thus, Oum Salama said, “Therefore, his heel will be bare” He replied: "Let her therefore lengthen it by a cubit, at most." Chapter VII The act of putting on 1701) 14 - Abu Hurairah reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r Upon him the grace and peace of Allah said: "Let no one walk having a shoe on one of his feet, while the other is bare; whether he puts on his two feet or takes his shoes off”. 1702) 15 - Abu Hurairah reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r Upon him the grace and peace of Allah said: "If any of you will to put on, that it begins with the right foot; however, if he wants to take his shoes off, let him start with the left foot. Thus, let the right foot be the first to put on, and the last to take off”. 
(1703) 16 - Abu Suhail Ibn Malek reported according to his father that Ka'b al-Ahbar saw a man taking off his shoes; he said to her, “Why are you taking off your shoes? Perhaps you acted in accordance with this verse (meaning): “Take off your sandals: you are in the holy valley of Tuwa” (Koran XX, 12). Then Ka'b, continued, and asked the man, "Do you know what the sandals of Moses were made of?" - Malek to say: "I don't know what the answer was of man”. And Ka'b continues: “They were made of the skin of a dead donkey”. Chapter VIII About the clothes to wear 
(1704) 17 - Abu Hurairah said: "The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) forbade the wearing of two kinds of clothes, and the fact of making two sales, namely "la moulamassa" and "la mounabaza" See: sales chapter - 31 -; and also that a man wraps himself in only one garment, revealing a bare part of his body, or even that a man covers himself with a garment, falling on a single part of his body. 
(1705) 18 - Abdallah Ibn Omar reported that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab, at the sight of a tunic called "siarà"^, which was sold to the door of the mosque, said to the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah): "O Messenger of Allah, if you buy yourself this tunic, so that you put it on Friday, in order to receive the deputies who will come to your house”! The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r On him the grace and peace of Allah replied: "He who puts on such a tunic, will have no hope in the life of the hereafter". Then having received some of these tunics, the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) gave one to Omar Ibn Al-Khattab who exclaimed: “O Messenger of Allah do you give me one to put on, after telling me such about the tunic of “Outared”? The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) to answer: "I do not give it to you so that you put it on". So Omar, gave the tunic to one of his polytheist colleagues in Mecca. (2) «siarà»Tunic made of silk threads. 
(1706) 19 - Anas Ibn Malek said: “I saw Omar Ibn Al-Khattab, while on that day; he was governor in Medina, putting on a coat which he had patched in three places, so that the patches were next to each other”. MOUATTAA In the name of Allah the Merciful the Merciful Book 49 The Book of the Qualities of the Prophet (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) and other subjects First chapter About the quality of the Prophet r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) 
(1707) 1 - Anas Ibn Malek, making the portrait of the Prophet r (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "He was of a size average; of a complexion neither white nor brown, with neither curly nor straight hair. Allah Y charged him with the Message when he was in his forties; thus he remained for ten years in Mecca, and for ten others in Medina, died at the age of sixty, without having either in his head or in his beard twenty white hairs. Chapter II About the quality of Jesus Christ son of Mary (Peace be upon him) and dajjal (the Antichrist) 
(1708) 2 - Abdallah Ibn Umar reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “I saw myself one night in the Ka'ba, where I saw a dark-haired man, the handsomest of all you have seen. He had the finest hair (falling to his shoulders) of any you have seen, well combed from which the water dripped. He sat leaning on two men or even on the shoulders of two men, making the rounds around the Ka'ba. So I asked: "Who is it"? They answered me: "He is the messiah, the son of Mary". Then I saw another curly-haired, one-eyed man popping out of his orbit as if it were a grape; so I asked: “Who is it”?, and I was answered: “It is the Antichrist”. Chapter III The sunna concerning the fitra. (1) (1) The fitra had traditions to follow, known by all the Prophets, and which were in conformity with religious principles. 
(1709) 3 - Sa'id Ibn Abi Sa'id Al-Maqbouri a reported from his father that Abu Houraira said, "Five facts are of fitra: trimming the nails, trimming the mustaches, depilating the armpits, shaving the pubis, and circumcision." 
(1710) 4 - Sa'id Ibn Al Moussaiab said: "Ibrahim (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) was the first (among the Prophets) who took the initiative in the hospitality of the hosts, the first who circumcised himself, the first still who carved out his whiskers, and finally the first who was stricken with canities. He said, “Lord! What is that"? And Allah Y Blessed and Most High answered him: “It is a sign of dignity, O Ibrahim”. Ibrahim says: "Lord! Increase my dignity”. - Malek said, "From trimming their mustaches to what the end of the upper lip appears, and which is moreover the outline; however never to cut them in a ridiculous way”. Chapter IV On the prohibition of eating with the left hand 
(1711) 5 - Jaber Ibn Abdallah Ai-Salami reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) has forbidden the eating of left hand, or to walk with one foot on, or to caulk of a garment called Al-Samma(2), or finally to cover oneself with a garment revealing a shameful part of one's body”. (2) Clothing covering the hands, so that they are not free. 
(1712) 6 - Abdallah Ibn Omar reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “When one of you eats, let him do so with his right hand, and likewise when he drinks; for the devil eats and drinks with his left hand”. Chapter V About the poor 
(1713) 7 - Abu Huraira reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "The poor is not the one who goes begging, being satisfied with a mouthful or two". So he was asked: "Who is the poor, O Messenger of Allah"? He answered: "He is the one who cannot be satisfied with what he has, of whom people do not remember him to give alms, and finally he who does not go out to beg". 
(1714) 8 - Al-Harithi reported from his grandmother, that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "Give to the poor, even a foot (of mutton) cooked". Chapter VI About the gut of the unbeliever 
(1715) 9 - Abu Hurairah reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "The Muslim eats from one intestine, while the unbeliever eats from seven". 
(1716) 10 - Abu Hurairah narrated the following: "The Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) hospitably received an unbelieving man. He commanded milk from one sheep to be brought to him, and given to him to drink, then commanded him a second time, and then again until the unbeliever had drunk the milk of seven sheep, that at the end, in the morning, he converted to Islam. So, the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Be upon him and the peace of Allah) ordered to bring him a sheep, which is milked, and whose milk the man drank; then he ordered him another, but the man could not drink the sheep's milk. Thus, the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) says: "The believer drinks from one intestine, but the unbeliever from seven". Chapter VII The ban on drinking from silver vases and breathing in vases 
(1717) 11 - Um Salama, the wife of the Prophet (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) reported that the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "He who drinks from vessels made of silver, only swallows the fire of Hell in his belly". 
(1718) 12 - Abu Mouthanna Al-Jouhani reported: “I was at Marwan Ibn Al-Hakam, when Abu Sa'id al-Khudri entered his house; Marwan Ibn Al-Hakam, said to him: "Have you heard the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) say, that it is forbidden to breathe in the vase”? "Yes," replied Abu Sa'id. A man addressing the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said to him: “O Messenger of Allah! I don't quench my thirst in one gulp”! The Messenger of Allah (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) answered him: “Remove the vase from your mouth and breathe”. And the man continues, “I may see dirt (implying in the vase)” “So pour the water (from the vase), he replied”. Chapter VIII About man drinking while standing 
(1719) 13 - It was reported to Malek that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab, Ali Ibn Abi Taleb and Osman Ibn Affan, were drinking while standing up”. 
(1720) 14 • Ibn Chehab reported that Aisha, the mother believers and Sa'd Ibn Abi Waqas did not find it wrong for the man to drink while standing up". 
(1721) 15 - Abu Ja'far Al-Qari said: "I saw Abdallah Ibn Umar drinking while standing up". 
(1722) 16 • Amer Ibn Abdallah Ibn Al-Zoubair reported that his father drank while standing. Chapter IX Sunna followed when drinking and giving drink to the one on the right 
(1723) 17 Anas Ibn Malek reported, that was brought to the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) milkshake with water from a well, while on his right was a Bedouin, and on his left Abu Bakr Al-Siddiq. He drank then gave the Bedouin a drink, saying: “To the right! To the right". 
(1724) 18 Sahl Ibn Sa'd Al-Ansari reported the following: "Bringing drink to the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah), he drank, while he had on his right a young man, and on his left some old men. So he says after drinking, to the young man: "would you allow me to give them a drink before you"? And the young man replied: “No, by Allah! O Messenger of Allah, I do not give my turn to anyone other than you. So the envoy of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) immediately gave him something to drink". Chapter X About eating and drinking 
(1725) 19 - Anas Ibn Malek reported the following: “Abou Talha said to Umm Soulaim: “I heard the voice of the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) so weak in speaking, and I recognized there that he was hungry; do you have something to eat? She replied: "yes", by bringing out of her house, barley cakes which she covered with her veil, then placed it under my arm, and sent me to the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah)”: Anas continued and said: taking it to the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah), I saw him sitting, surrounded by his companions in the mosque. I was heading towards him, the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said to me: "Was it Abu Talha who sent you"? - "Yes, answered Anas”; And the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) to resume: “For a meal that he has prepared for us”? Yes, I answered”. The Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said to those who kept him company: "Let's go" He left with his companions, and I with them until I went ahead of them to Abu Talha, telling him what took place. Then Abu Talha exclaimed: "O Oum Soulaim, the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) has just arrived with a whole world, and we have no food to feed them". She replied: "Allah and His Messenger know better than us”. Abou Talha went out to meet the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Be upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) and his companions, so that to invite them in. The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said to Oum Soulaim: “go, Oum Soulaim, bring us what you have for food”. She brought him the cakes that the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) ordered them to be smashed to pieces, whereupon Umm Soulaim poured fat from a waterskin. Then, the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) pronouncing the blessing that was inspired in him by Allah Y , said to Abu Talha: “Bring in ten of them”; Abou Talha let them in, they ate until they were full and then left; The Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) addressing Abu Talha, said to him again: "Bring in ten others"; they too entered ate just like the first then went out; then the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) gave the order that ten others be brought in, who in turn entered, ate, then left, then ten more last, until all the men have eaten well, while being satisfied; and they numbered seventy or even eighty men”. 
(1726) 20 - Abu Huraira reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) said: “The eating of two is enough for three, and the eating of three is enough for four”. 
(1727) 21 - Jaber Ibn Abdallah reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "Close the doors, plug the openings of the skins, overturn the vases, or cover them, and finally put out the lamps because the devil does not open a door, nor uncork a skinskin, nor uncover a vase; however a mouse can set fire to a house”. 
(1728) 22 - Abu Shuraih Al-Ka'bi reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) said: "Whoever believes in Allah, and on the day of resurrection, let him speak well or be silent. One who believes in Allah and the last day let him be welcoming to his neighbor. Whoever believes in Allah and the day of resurrection, let him be hospitable to his guest, and hospitality is three days of which “the jaiza” is one day and one night; as to what is beyond this duration, it will be a charity. The guest is not permitted to stay more than three days, thereby embarrassing the host”. 
(1729) 23 - Abu Huraira reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) said: "While a man was walking, he felt excessive thirst; finding a well, he descended into it, drank, and came out. Suddenly he passed a dog panting with thirst so that it chewed the wet sand. Then the man said: "It seems that this dog is stricken with a thirst like the one whose I was affected; the man went back down into the well, filled his hoof which he brought up to the dog's muzzle so that he could drink. Allah Y rewarded him by forgiving him his faults. He was told: “O Messenger of Allah! Are we rewarded if we are pitiful towards animals? He answered them, "Surely, having treated every living soul well." 
(1730) 24 - Jaber Ibn Abdallah narrated the following: “The Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) had sent a troop to the coast, consisting of three hundred men, of which I was a member; as to to the leader of the troop it was Abou Oubaida Ibn Al-Jarrah. We went out, and at a certain place our provisions were finished. So Abou Oubaida ordered to assemble what was left of the provisions, and in my bag there were only dates of which Abou Oubaida gave us a small quantified day after day, so that everyone had a share, one date per day, until the quantity was exhausted. One of those who were listening to the hadith, asked Jaber: “What was a single date enough for”? And Jaber to answer: "We said one was better than having nothing". Then Jaber continued and said, “Finally, when we got to the shore, we saw a whale like a mound. The army ate it for eighteen nights, after which Abou Oubaida ordered two of his ribs to be fixed in the form of an arc, and made a mount pass under them, without it touching them”. 
(1731) 25 - Amr Ibn Sa'd Ibn Mu'az reported from his grandmother that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “Believing women, let none of you deign to present to your neighbor even the foot of a roast sheep”. 
(1732) 26 - Abdallah Ibn Abi Bakr reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) said: “May Allah curse the Jews; they were forbidden to eat the fat and yet they sold it and enjoyed the price”. 
(1733) 27 - It was reported to Malek that Jesus son of Mary said: “O children of Israel! Take clean water, vegetables and barley bread; but do not eat wheaten bread, for if you do, Allah will not be grateful to you”. 
(1734) 28 - It was reported to Malek that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) entering the mosque, and finding Abu Bakr Al-Siddiq and Omar Ibn Al-Khattab, he asked them why are they in this place? They answered him: “because of hunger”. The Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said to them: "And I too suffering from hunger", then they went to Abu Al-Haitham Ibn Al-Tihane Al-Ansari who ordered them some barley bread that was being prepared, then agreed to slaughter a sheep for them when the Envoy of 'Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said to him: “Let her not be a dairy sheep”; so he slaughtered a sheep for them, then brought cold water which was in a waterskin hung on a palm tree and presented them to them. So they ate and drank, and the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said to them: "you will be asked about the euphoria of this day". 
(1735) 29 - Yahia Ibn Sa'id reported that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab, ate bread with butter; then he called a Bedouin to eat with him; but the latter was going to eat in such a way as to leave no trace of butter in the dish. Omar tells him, "You eat as if you hadn't tasted anything a long time ago"; the Bedouin replied, “By Allah! I have never eaten butter or mixed it with other dishes since such and such a day”. Omar then exclaimed: "And I, I I will not eat butter again until all the people have had enough to live on". 
(1736) 30 - Anas Ibn Malek reported: “I saw Ibn Al Khattab, during the period when he was prince of the believers, discard the sa' of dates and eat those which were dry”. (...) 31 - Abdallah Ibn Omar reported that Umar Ibn Al-Khattab asked about grasshoppers, where he replied: "I would have liked to have had a basket of grasshoppers to eat." 
(1737) 32 - Houmaid Ibn Malek Ibn Khoutaim a reported the following: “I was sitting with Abu Hurairah at Al-Aqiq, in his estate, when some Medinans came while riding horses, and came down to his house. Houmaid continuing said: “Abou Houraira asked me: "Go to my mother's house and tell her that your son greets you and asks you to give us something to eat". She put in a dish, three pieces of bread with a little oil and salt, then placed it on my head, after which I was going to hand the dish to Abu Huraira who, glorifying Allah, said: "Praise be to Allah who has filled you with bread after having eaten only the two black ones in namely water and dates". The Medinans did not even touch the food; so, once they left, Abu Houraira said to me: “My brother's son! Treat your herd well, even wipe the noses of the sheep and clean their enclosures, finally pray in one of its corners, because these animals are those of Paradise. By him who holds my soul in His hand, there will be a day when men will be so that the sheep are preferable to their owners than the abode of Marwan (Ibn Al-Hakam, being governor in Medina). 
(1738) 33 - Nu'aim Ibn Kaissan reported that food was brought to the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah), while he was with his adopted son Omar Ibn Salama. The Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said to him: “Pronounce the name of Allah and eat what is in front of you”. 
(1739) 34 - Yahia Ibn Sa'id narrated that he heard Al-Kassem Ibn Mouhammad say: “a man had come to Abdallah Ibn Abbas, saying to him: “I have an orphan with camels; am I allowed to drink their milk? Ibn Abbas, he replied, "If you show yourself able to seek out the one who strays from among them, to tar them, to smear their basin with mud, to make them drink when they are thirsty, so you can drink their milk, hands also leaving to the camels, and without you milking them until the last drop». 
(1740) 35 - Hisham Ibn Ourwa reported the following: “My father was never brought either to eat or to drink, not even the remedy that he had not tasted or drunk without having said: “Praise be to Allah who guided us, gave us food and drink, who even granted us his blessings. God is great! You have filled us with Your blessings without us showing ourselves grateful to You, and we enjoy morning and evening all Your blessings. We ask You for their completeness and for us to be grateful for them (hearing with regard to the benefits). There is no other good but Yours, no other divinity than You, Lord of good servants, and Lord of the worlds. Praise be to Allah, there is no god but You, such is the will of Allah; there is no strength except in Allah. Great Allah Bless the goods You give us, and save us from the punishment of Hell. 
(1741) 36 - Malek was asked: "the woman will she be able to eat with someone other than Zou-mahram (that is, the one she cannot marry), or even with her servant? He replied, “There is no harm in that, if the man she will eat with is as pointed out. And Malek continues: "the woman can thus eat with her husband or with the one who eats with him, or even with his brother, but it is repugnant that a woman is alone with the man whose relationship with him is illicit. Chapter XI About the meat eaten 
(1742) 37 - Yahia Ibn Sa'id reported that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab said, "Beware of excessive meat, as it can be harmful just like wine." (...) 38 - Yahia Ibn Sa'id reported that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab crossed Jaber Ibn Abdallah having a large amount of meat; so he said to him, "Why this amount" and Jaber from answer: "Oh prince of believers, we wanted to eat meat, so I bought some for a dirham". Omar resumed: "Wouldn't one of you be able to tame his belly instead of his neighbor or his cousin"? Are you not aware of this verse: "You have dissipated the excellent things that you possessed during your life on earth and you have enjoyed them momentarily" (Koran XL VI, 20). Chapter XII From wearing a ring. 
(1743) 39 - Abdallah Ibn Dinar reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) put a gold ring on his finger, after which he took it off, saying, "I will never put it on." Thereby, the men in turn refused to put it on. 
(1744) 40 - Sadaqa Ibn Yassar reported that he asked Sa'id Ibn Al Moussaiab about wearing the ring; he replied, "Put it on, and tell people that I have authorized you to put it on." Chapter XIII About what we put around the neck of animals 
(1745) 41 - Abu Bashir Al-Ansari reported that during an expedition he was with the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) who sent a delegate to the men to tell them that Abdallah Ibn Abi Bakr - being one of the reporters of this hadith - underlines: "I believe that he said: "Once that people go home, tell them not to keep a collar of rope or any other material attached to a camel's neck without unfastening it". - Yahia reported that he heard Malek say, "I believe it was done to ward off the evil eye. MOUATTAA In the name of Allah the Merciful the Merciful Book 50 The Book of the Evil Eye First chapter: The ablution to do after being hit by an evil eye. 
(1746) 1 - Muhammad Ibn Abi Umama Ibn Sahl Ibn Hunaif reported that he heard his father say, "My father Sahl Ibn Hunaif made a lotion at 'Al-Kharrar' (place near Jouhfa) by removing a 'joubba' which he put on while Amer Ibn Abi Rabi' was looking at him. Sahl was a man of white complexion and had beautiful skin. Amer Ibn Abi Rabi'a said to him, "I have never seen such skin, not even that of a virgin." Sahl fell ill on the spot, and his illness would get worse and worse. We came to report to the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) that Sahl was sick and that he could no longer accompany the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah). So, the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) came to visit Sahl who told him of the fact of Amer. The Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) then said to Amer: “Why is one of you killing his brother? Why didn't you bless his skin; the evil eye is an effective fact; do your ablutions? Amer performed his ablutions, and Sahl then accompanied the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) without suffering any harm. (The water from the ablution done by Amer had been withheld, and it was poured over Sahl). 
(1747) 2 - Abu Oumama Ibn Sahl Ibn Hounaif a reported that seeing Amer Ibn Rabi'a making a lotion, he said to him: "I have never seen until now a beautiful hidden skin"; Sahl immediately fell ill. Coming to learn from the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) what happened, he was told: “O Messenger of Allah!, come and see Sahl Ibn Hunaif; by Allah, he cannot even raise your head. He asked, “Are you accusing anyone about him”? He was answered: "We accuse Amer Ibn Rabi'a". Thus, the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) summoned Amer and scolded him saying, “Why is one of you trying to kill his brother? Why, you didn't bless his skin? Go make a lotion”. So Amer washed his face, hands, elbows, knees, extremities of his feet, hips, pouring the water of the lotion into a vase for him, then pouring it on Sahl, after which, the latter left with people, without having any harm". Chapter II Evil eye exorcism. 
(1748) 3 - Houmaid Ibn Qais Al-Makki reported: “They brought in the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) the two sons of Ja'far Ibn Abi Taleb”; so he said to their nurse, "Why do they look so thin to me?" She replied "O Messenger of Allah they are so quickly reached by the evil eye; and we did not prevent ourselves from exorcising them except what you accept as formulas”. So, the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) Upon him the grace and peace of Allah says, "Let them be exorcised, for if anything could precede fate, it could only be the evil eye." 
(1749) 4 - Urwa Ibn Al-Zoubair reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) Upon him the grace and peace of Allah entered the house of Oum Salamah, the wife of the Prophet (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah), there he found a crying child, who he was told was hit by a bad eye. Ourwa continuing: “Thus the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "Why do you not seek to exorcise him from the evil eye"?. , Chapter III The sick man's reward 
(1750) 5 - 'Ata Ibn Yassar reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “Once a man falls ill. Allah Y sends him two angels, saying to them, “Go see, what My servant says to those who visit him; thus, if in receiving them, he praises Allah and the Exalted, the two angels report his sayings to Allah Y , to Him the power and the glory, although he is the most knowledgeable. And Allah will say: “My Servant, if I kill him, let me bring him into Paradise; and if I heal him, may I change his flesh and blood into other better ones; and that I erase his bad deeds». 
(1751) 6 - Urwa Ibn Al-Zubair reported that he heard Aisha, the wife of the Prophet r (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace), say: "The Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "Every believer experiencing any illness whatsoever, even the sting of a thorn, will be a punishment for him, or even erase his sins”. 
(1752) 7 - Abu Huraira reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) said: "Whoever Allah wills good for, He causes him to suffer any affliction." 
(1753) 8 - Yahia Ibn Sa'id reported that a man, at the time of the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) was stricken with death. Another man said: “Happiness be granted to him, he died without suffering from any disease”. The Messenger of Allah (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) then said: “Woe to you! How can you know, that if Allah, had caused him to experience an illness, that he had thereby erased all his bad deeds from him. Chapter IV Of refuge and exorcism during an illness. 
(1754) 9 - Nafe' Ibn Joubair reported that Osman Ibn Al-'As went to the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) and said to him: "I feel a pain that makes me feel death." The Messenger of Allah (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) answered him: "Pass your hand there where you feel the pain, seven times, and say: "I ask for the power of Allah, and his power against my pain" "ahou dhou bi ezzati 'llahi wa koudratihi min char ajidou". Osman added, “By saying that. Allah has taken my pain away from me, and being such I never cease to advise my family to do the same”. 
(1755) 10 - Aisha reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah), if he experienced any harm any, he recited on himself the two talismanic suras and blew. But when his illness worsened, I recited the two suras on him, then I passed my right hand over his body, hoping to have the grace of Allah”. 
(1756) 11 - Amra Bint Abdul Rahman reported that Abou Bakr Al Sid-diq had entered Aisha's house and found her complaining; a Jewess was exorcising her, Abu Bakr said to her: “exorcise her according to the Book of Allah”. Chapter V Of the treatment of the patient 
(1757) 12 - Zaid Ibn Aslam reported that a man in the time of the Messenger of Allah (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) suffered from a wound where the blood has been congested. So the man called two men from the Ammar tribe to treat him. Both looking at him, they claimed that the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) had said to them: "Which of you is the most competent in medicine"? Then they answered him: “O Messenger of Allah, is medicine good for it”? Zaid claimed that the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said to them: "Whoever who descended from it the disease, descended the remedies”. 
(1758) 13 - It was reported to Yahia Ibn Sa'id that Sa'id Ibn Zourara, had done, in the time of the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) cauterizations because of angina in the chest, so he died”. 
(1759) 14 - Nafe' reported that Abdallah Ibn Omar was cauterized because of facial paralysis, and exorcised because of a scorpion sting”. Chapter VI Cooling the fever with water 
(1760) 15 - Fatima Bint Al-Mounzer reported that every time that As-ma Bint Abi Bakr received it from a woman suffering from a fever to invoke Allah for her, she poured it into the neckline of his shirt, water and said: "The Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) ordered us to cool the fever with water”. 
(1761) 16 - Hisham Ibn Ourwa reported from his father that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "The fever is an outpouring of Hellfire; cool it with water”. (...) 17 - Ibn Umar reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) Upon him the Grace and Peace of Allah said, “Fever is a gushing out of the fire of Hell; extinguish it with water”. Chapter VII Visiting the sick and ornithomancy 
(1762) 18 - Jaber Ibn Abdallah reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "If a man visits a sick person, it is as if he plunges into mercy, so that, if he sits at home, this mercy will fit into his for interior, or even of what is of the same”. 
(1763) 19 - Ibn Atia reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "No contagion, neither "hama"1 nor “Safar”2. It is not tolerated that a sick man interferes with a healthy man, as for the latter he can be there where he wants»3. We asked the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) "Why is that?" He replied, "For it is evil." (1) Hama: bird which according to the pre-Islamic mythology, demands revenge for the murdered victim. The hama was likened to the owl, said to be a “bird of bad omen”. (2) Safar at the time In pre-Islamic times, the moifr-de Safar was considered to be a sacred month instead of the muharram. (3) According to another version, it was said that whoever has sick camels should not make them drink in the same place as healthy camels; as for the latter, they could be brought anywhere”. MOUATTAA In the name of Allah the Merciful the Merciful Book 51 The book of hair First chapter: Sunna followed for hair. 
(1764) 1 - Abdallah Ibn Omar reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) ordered that we shave the mustaches, and let the beard grow”. 
(1765) 2 - Houmaid Ibn Abdul Rahman Ibn Awf a reported that he heard Mouawia Ibn Abi Soufian, the year of his pilgrimage, say, while being on the pulpit and taking a lock of hair from the hand of a guard: “O Médinois! Where are your Ulemas? I heard the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) forbid such a thing, and say: "Besides, the Bani Yisrael were defeated the very day their wives used false hair". 
(1766) 3 - Ziad Ibn Sa'ad reported that he heard Ibn Chehab say: "The Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) had let his hair float, which Allah willed, then after he separated them with a parting”. 
(1767) 4 - Nafe' reported that Abdallah Ibn Omar repelled castration and said: "She is the cause of the increase creatures”.???????????????????????????????????????????????? ??????? 
(1768) 5 - It was reported to Safwan Ibn Sulaim that the Prophet r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "He who takes care of an orphan who is one of his relatives or another, me, will be at Paradise like these two fingers, if he fears Allah”. “Saying this, he showed the middle and index fingers of his hand”. Chapter II Hair recovery 
(1769) 6 - Yahia Ibn Sa'id reported that Abu Katada Al-Ansari said to the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah): “I have long hair, should I comb it”? The Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) Upon him the grace and peace of Allah answered him, "Yes, and clean it." Thus, Abu Katada covered her, twice a day, with ointment, so much so that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said to him: "To clean it". 
(1770) 7 - Ata Ibn Yassar reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah), was in the mosque, a man entered it, with a disheveled head and beard. The Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah), beckoned him to come out of his hand, meaning by that, that he has to recover the hair of his head and his beard; the man responding to this call, return to it combed and The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said to him: "Isn't it better for any of you to to go to the mosque, with his hair combed, instead of having it disheveled as if he were a Satan”. Chapter III hair dye 
(1771) 8 - Abu Salama Ibn Abdul-Rahman reported that Abdul-Rahman Ibn Al-Aswad Ibn Abd Yaghout had a white head and beard, and frequented people, he arrived at their home one day, having dyed his head and beard red”. It's better, he is told. He replied, "My mother (meaning the mother of believers) Aicha, the wife of the Prophet, yesterday sent me his slave Noukhaua, swearing to dye them for me, and informing me that Abu Bakr Al-Siddiq dyed his hair". - Malek said, about dyeing hair in black: "I have not heard of this, which is certain, as for other colours, they are preferred to me". Continuing, he said: "And neglecting the tincture is, Allah willing, tolerated, therefore it cannot embarrass people." - Interpreting this hadith, Malek said: “The Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) did not dye his hair, because if he had done it, Aicha would have sent to tell this to Abdul Rahman Ibn Al-Aswad”. Chapter IV Of the refuge which is of obligation. 
(1772) 9 - Yahia Ibn Sa'id said: "I was told that Khaled Ibn Al-Wahd said to the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Be upon him be grace and peace of 'Allah): "I have nightmares while sleeping"; the Messenger of Allah (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) answered him: "Say: "May I be protected by the perfect words of Allah against His wrath, His punishment, the worst of His servants, the seductions of demons and their presence". "Audhou bi kalimati' llahi't-tammati min ghadabihi wa iqabihi wa sharri ibadihi wa min hamazati' sh-shayatin wa an yahdurun." 
(1773) 10 - Yahia Ibn Sa'id reported: "The Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (On him the grace and peace of Allah) while traveling at night saw an "ifrit" of the geniuses, who pursued him with a burning torch in his hand. Whenever the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) turned away, he saw him. So Gabriel said to him, "Shall I not teach you words to say which, a once you say them, his torch will be extinguished and the ifrit will succumb to it". The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) replied: "Certainly yes". Gabriel replied, saying, "That I be protected by the noble Face of Allah, and by His perfect words that neither pious nor perverse can neglect, against what comes from heaven as punishment and from the worst that rises there, against even the worst that falls on earth and the other who goes out there, against the temptations of night and day, against what happens night and day, except if it is good that happens, O Merciful". "Audhu bi wajhi'llahi' l-karim wa bi kalimati'llahi't-tammati. Allati the yujawazou hounna barra wa the fajir, min sharri ma yanzil min as-sama, wa sharri ma yarujou fiha, wa sham ma dhara' fi'l-ard, wa sharri ma yakhruju minha, wa min fitani'l-layli wa'n-nahar, wa min tawariqi'l-layli wa'n-nahar illa tariqan yatruq bikhayr ya Rahman!" 
(1774) 11 - Abu Huraira reported that a man from the Aslam tribe said: "I couldn't sleep last night". The Messenger of Allah (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) asked: "for what reason"? And the man to answer: "A scorpion stung me"; then the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said to him: "If you had said, when you were in the evening: "May I be protected by the perfect words of Allah against all evil that he has created", this injection would not have caused you harm." "Ahoudhou bi kalimati'llahi't-tammati min sharri ma khalaq." 
(1775) 12 - Al-Ka'Ka' Ibn Hakim reported that Ka'b Al-Ahbar said: "Apart from a few words that I constantly uttered, the Jews should have taken me for an ass". Asking him, “what are they,” he replied, “may I be protected from the face of Allah, the Munificent than none other than Him is more munificent; from even the perfect words of Allah from which neither pious nor perverse can do without by the most beautiful names of Allah of which I have known among others and those which I do not know, against the evil of what he has created". "Audhu bi wajhi'llahi l-adheem aladhee laysa shay'un adham minh, wa bi kalimati'llahi't-tammati, alatee la yujawizu hunna barra wa la fajir, wa bi asma'illahi'l-husna kulliha ma alamtu minha wa ma lam alam, min sharri ma khalaqa wa bara'a wa dhara 'at." Chapter V About those who love each other in Allah. 
(1776) 13 - Abu Huraira reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “Allah, Blessed and Most High, will say on the day of resurrection: “Where are those who love each other in My Majesty? Today I will wrap them in My shadow, the day when there will be no other shadow than Mine”. 
(1777) 14 - Abu Huraira reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “Seven who will be protected by the shadow of Allah Y , the day when there will be no other shadow than His, namely: a fair imam; a young man who grew up worshiping Allah; a man whose heart is in love with mosques, who, leaving, he returns to them; two men who loved each other in Allah Y , uniting in His favour, and separating from it; a man who keeps mentioning Allah in His loneliness, having his eyes in tears; a man whose beautiful and rich woman attracts him, and that he says: “I fear Allah”; and finally a man who gave alms in secret so that his left hand did not know what his right hand had spent”. 
(1778) 15 - Abu Huraira reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "If the Good Allah loves a servant, He will say to Gabriel: "I love such, so love him", and Gabriel will love him by calling those who are in heaven, saying to them, "Allah loves such and such, therefore love him"; then those who are in heaven will love him, and they will impose their affection on him on earth. On the other hand, if the Good Allah hates a servant, Malek said, "I don't believe he would have said anything else about hate." 
(1779) 16 - Abu Idriss Al Khawlani said: “In entering the mosque in Damascus, I saw a man with a radiant face, the men surrounded him, in such a way that when they began to discuss a affair, they were going to refer to him and to take into account his words, I asked: "who is he"? - "Mu'az Ibn Jabal, I was told" As soon as it was the next day, I went to the mosque so early and found him ahead of me, praying. I waited for him to finish his prayer then I came in front of him, greeted him and said to him: "By Allah, I love you in Allah”. - “In Allah, he answered me”, “In Allah, I answered him”. Having taken up this for three times, he drew me by my garment and said to me: “Have such good news; I heard the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) say: “Allah Blessed and Most High said: “My affection is a duty towards those who love themselves in Me, reunite in Me, visit one another in Me, and who sacrifice themselves in Me”. 
(1780) 17 - It was reported to Malek that Abdallah Ibn Abbas said: "Moderation, patience and good appearance are one of them. twenty-fifth of the prophecy”. MOUATTAA In the name of Allah the Merciful the Merciful Book 52 The Book of Vision. First chapter: The subject of the vision (in the dream). 
(1781) 1 - Anas Ibn Malek reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) said, "The truthful vision of a righteous man is, one forty-sixth of the prophecy." (...) 2 - Abu Houraira reported from the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) On him the grace and peace of Allah the same hadith”. 
(1782) 3 - Abu Hurairah reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) ending the dawn prayer, asked the faithful: "Did one of you have a vision last night"; and continuing, he said, "In my succession, there would be only the pious vision forming part of the prophecy." 
(1783) 4 - Ata Ibn Yassar reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (On him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “there would be following me, only “the mubachirates (1)”, being part of the prophecy”. Asking him, what are the mubachirates, he replied, "the pious visions, whether experienced by a virtuous man, or even be they of issue to him, and which are one forty-sixth of prophecy." (1) These are those that foresee, or who anticipate the good news: Let us emphasize that this term is of Arabic origin. He will not, Allah willing, be affected by any evil”. 
(1784) 5 - Abu Katada Ibn Ribi'i reported that he heard the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) say: “The pious vision comes from Allah, and the bad dream from the devil. So if any of you has dreamed of what is unpleasant to him, let him breathe, when awake, for three times on the left side, and that he asks to be protected by Allah, against the worst of this dream; moreover - Abou Salama said: "I was doing dreams that were heavier to me than a mountain; but after hearing this hadith, I was no longer interested in such dreams”. 
(1785) 6 - Hisham Ibn Ourwa reported that his father, explaining the following verse: } ِ ظ يم َ ف ْ و ُز ال َع ُ ه َ و ال َ ذ ل َ ك ّ ِ ه َ م ات َ ك ل ِ د يل ل َ و ف ِ ي اآخ َ ر ِة اَ ت ْب َ ح ياة الد ْ ن يَ ا ْش َ ر ى ف ِ ي ال ُ م ال ُب { لَ ُ ه “They will receive the good news in this life and in the other” (Koran sura X, verse 64), said: “such is the pious vision, made by a virtuous man, wherever it is dreamed upon him”. Chapter II About the dice game. 
(1786) 7 - Abu Musa Al-Ach'ari reported that the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "Whoever plays dice is disobedient to respect to Allah Y and his Envoy r ". (...) 8 - The mother of 'Alqama said, that Aisha, the wife of the Prophet r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) was taught that people, living in her home, were playing dice. She sends them to say: "If you do not get rid of this, I will make you leave my home", disavowing this kind of game". 
(1787) 9 - Nafe' reported that Abdallah Ibn Omar, whenever he saw someone from his family playing dice, he would hit him and break the dice. - Yahia reported that he heard Malek say: “No Good in the Dice Game”; and he repelled him. I still have it heard, that he hated the game of chess, and any other game that is only futility, and recited the following verse: } ْص َ ر ُ ف ون َ ف أ َ ن َ ى ُت ّ ق إ ِ ا الضا ُ ل َد ال َح ُ ق َ ف َ م ا ذا بَ ْع ُ م ال َح َ ر ب ُ ك ّ ُ ه ُ ك ُ م { َ ف َ ذ ل “What is there besides truth but error”? (Quran sura X, verse 32). MOUATTAA In the name of Allah the Merciful the Merciful Book 53 The Book of Salvation First chapter: How to act when greeting 
(1788) 1 - Zaid Ibn Aslâm reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “He who is on his mount salutes the pedestrian; and if a man from a group salutes, that is enough”. 
(1789) 2 - Muhammad ibn Amr Ibn Ata narrated: "I was sitting with Abdallah Ibn Abbas, a man from Yemen came in and said: “Allah's peace, be upon you, too, though His Mercy and His Blessings,” then he added a few more words. Ibn Abbas, who by that time had become blind, asked, “Who is this? » - "It's the man from Yemen who makes you frequently visited”, and it is described to him”. So Ibn Abbas said, “Salvation ends in blessings (namely, in the term blessings). Malek was asked, "Can you greet a woman?" "As for the old woman, I do not loath it: but for a young one, I am against it," he replied. Chapter II Salvation made for a Jew and for a Christian. 
(1790) 3 - Abdallah Ibn Umar reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "When one of the Jews greets you, he says : «may the Sa'm(1) be upon you»; answer him: "and on you". (1) This term is taken in sense of death; in pronouncing "the word salam", the "l" is elided, by the Jew, meaning the opposite of the word "salam". - Yahia reported that Malek was asked about of him who greets a Jew or a Christian, if it is harmful to him”? - “No, answered Malek”. Chapter III Salvation in general. 
(1791) 4 - Abu Waqed Al-Laithi reported: "While the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) was sitting in the mosque in the company of the faithful, three men entered, two of whom approached the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah), as for the third, he left. Thus, arriving close to the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah), one of the two, having found a vacant place near him in the circle, sat down, as for the other, he took a place behind them, and the third left. (his hadith), The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) ending and said: "You is what I tell you about these three men? The first took refuge with Allah and Allah assured him; the second was ashamed to approach Allah and Allah treated him the same; as for the third, he turned away from Allah, and Allah turned away from him”. 
(1792) 5 - Anas Ibn Malek reported that he heard Omar Ibn Al-Khattab receiving a greeting from a man and Umar returning to him, asking him, “How are you doing”? And the man to answer him: “I praise Allah for you”; then Omar said to him: "That is exactly what I wanted you to make me hear". 
(1793) 6 - Al-Tufail Ibn Abi Ka'b reported that he went to see Abdallah Ibn Omar, and accompanied him to the market. Al-Toufail continued and immediately said,; that we arrived at the market, Abdallah Ibn Omar did not pass by a seller of junk, or a seller of bric a brac, or a poor person, or anyone without having greeted them. One day, I was going to see Abdallah Ibn Omar, and he asked me to follow him to Marlet; so I said to him: "So what will you do at the market, and yet you do not sell anything, neither ask the prices of the goods, nor bargain, nor do you stop there"? "Let's sit here, and tell him we're going there, simply for salvation, namely to greet those we meet". 
(1794) 7 - Yahia Ibn Sa'id reported that a man Abdallah Ibn Umar had greeted him saying: “Peace be upon you, as well as the mercy of Allah and His blessings, and also those of those who come and go (meaning by this the angels). Abdallah Ibn Omar answered him: “And on you, a thousand others like that”; but it seems that such a way of greeting was repugnant”. 
(1795) 8 - Malek was told that if one enters in an uninhabited house, one will say: “Peace be upon us and upon the righteous servants of Allah”. (As-salamu alayna wa ala ibadillahi's-saliheen). MOUATTAA In the name of Allah the Merciful the Merciful Book 54 The Book of permission to enter other people's homes, sneezing, figurines, statues and others. First chapter: On permission to enter. 
(1796) 1 - Ata Ibn Yassar reported that a man asked the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah): "Do I need my mother's permission to enter her home"? - "yes, he replied". “But I live with her in the same house,” the man continued. The Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) insisted: "Ask his permission", and the man repeated: "I am his servant"; the Messenger of Allah (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) replied: “Ask his permission; do you want to see her naked? “No,” replied the man; and the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) to resume: “So then, ask his permission”. 
(1797) 2 - Abu Musa Al-Ach'ari reported that the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “One must ask permission to enter for three times; so if you get it, you will enter, otherwise you will retrace your steps”. 
(1798) 3 - Rabi'a Ibn Abdul-Rahman reported according to certain scholars that Abu Moussa Al-Ach'ari had just requested permission to enter from Omar Ibn Al-Khattab, he did so for three times; so Umar Ibn Al-Khattab sent for him, asking him: "Why didn't you come in"? Then Abu Musa answered him: "I heard the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) say: "Permission to enter must be requested three times; if we get it, we enter, otherwise we go back”. Umar then said to him, “Who knows about this? If you don't introduce me to someone witness to what you have just said; I will talk to you about such and such a matter”. Then Abou Moussa left and went to the mosque where an assembly called "the Assembly of the Ansars" was held. He said to them: “I have just informed Omar Ibn Al-Khattab, that I heard the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) say: “One must ask permission to enter someone's house for three times (at the most), if one obtains it, one will enter; otherwise we will not enter”; and, Abu Musa continued, and said to them, “So he asked me to bring him a witness proving that he had heard this hadith, otherwise he will cause me such and such a matter. So if any of you have heard this hadith, please accompany me”. Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri was then told, "Go with him", and Abu Sa'id was the youngest among them; then he got up and accompanied Abou Moussa; then on arriving at Omar's, he agreed with Abou Moussa's statements. Omar Ibn Al-Khattab said to Abu Musa: "I did not accuse you (of a lie), however I feared that men would learn badly from the sayings of the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah). Chapter II The sneeze on the occasion of which one must say: "may Allah have mercy on you" 
(1799) 4 - Abdallah Ibn Abi Bakr reported from his father that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) said, "If anyone sneezes and praises Allah", one replies, "May Allah have mercy on you", repeating this for three times; but on the fourth, to tell him: “You have a cold”! And Abdallah Ibn Abi Bakr emphasizes: “I don't know if he said after the third or fourth time”. 
(1800) 5 - Nafe' reported that if Abdallah Ibn Umar sneezed and were told: "May Allah have mercy on you", he would reply: "May Allah have mercy on us all, and may He there forgive us" . Chapter III About figurines and statues 
(1801) 6 - Rafe' Ibn Ishac the freedman of Al-Chifà a recounted: "We visited, Abdallah Ibn Abi Talha and I Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri, during his illness, Abu Sa'id said to us: "The Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) taught us that angels do not enter a house where there are figurines or statues”. The rapporteur suspected the case (namely figurines or statues). 
(1802) 7 - Oubaidallah Ibn Abdallah Ibn Utba Ibn Mass'oud reported that while visiting Abu Talha Al-Ansari during his illness, he found Sahl Ibn Hunaif at his home there. Abou Talha asking a man to draw a tapestry below him, Sahl Ibn Hunaif said to him: "Why are you removing it"? He replied, “Because she has drawings; or the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) has forbidden it, as you know. Sahl replied, “But the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) did he not specify: "Unless it's a design on a piece of clothing”? Abou Talha, then, said: “Certainly yes! but in this way I shall be more at peace. 
(1803) 8 - Aisha, the wife of the Prophet r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) reported, that she bought herself a cushion, containing figures. When the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) saw the cushion, he began to door, and did not enter. Aisha continued and said, “I sensed that he was displeased,” and I said to him, “O Messenger of Allah, I return to Allah, and to His Messenger; what mistake did I make? The Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) replied: "Why this cushion"? She said, "I bought it for you to sit on and lean on." The Messenger of Allah (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) replied: “Those who make these figures will be punished on the day of resurrection and they will be told: "revive what you have created"; then he added: "The house where the figures are, the angels do not enter there". Chapter IV About the use of "dab"(1) (1) A kind of lizard 
(1804) 9 - Soulaiman Ibn Yassar reported that the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) went with Abdallah Ibn Abbas and Khaled Ibn al Walid, to Maymouna Bint Al-Hareth, he found dabs with their eggs. He asked him, “Who brought them to you”? She replied: "It was my sister Houzaila Bint Al-Hareth who gave them to me. offered”. So the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said to Abdallah Ibn Al-Abbas and Khaled Ibn Al-Walid: “Eat”, and they answered him: “And you. Messenger of Allah, do you not eat it? He answered them: "No, for the angels of Allah there often come to me". Then Maymouna asked him: “Do you drink milk from us, O Messenger of Allah”? “Yes,” he replied. He drank then he asked him: “Who brought it to you”? She answered: “It was my sister Houzaila who gave it to me”. So the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said to him: “Do you remember the slave of whom you told me about his freedom; give it to your sister, thereby maintaining your close ties with her; it will be better for you”. 
(1805) 10 - Khaled Ibn Al-Walid, Ibn Al-Mughira reported that he entered with the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) in the house of Maymouna, the wife of the Prophet (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) where a dab blush was brought. The Messenger of Allah (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) touching him with his hand; the women who were at Maymouna's house exclaimed "say to the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be grace and peace of Allah) what he will eat of it". He was told: “It is a dab, O Messenger of Allah”.
