So he spread his hand, I asked him: "Is it forbidden, O Messenger of Allah"? “No, he said, but this animal does not live in the land of my people, I feel the disgust of eating it”. Khaled added, “So I pulled him; I ate it, and the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) watched me eat". 
(1806) 11 - Abdallah Ibn Umar reported that a man called the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's favor and peace) and said to him: "O Messenger of Allah, what do you say about the dab”? He replied, "I do not eat of his flesh and do not forbid it." Chapter V About dogs. 
(1807) 12 - Al Saib Ibn Yazid reported that he has heard Soufian Ibn Abi Zouhair, who moreover was a man of the Azdé-Chénoua tribe, and who was also one of the companions of the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah), talking with people, at the door of the mosque, saying to them: “I heard the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) say: "Whoever raises a dog which is not useful to him either for guarding or for planting, will have minus his work, each day, one qirat (reward)”. He was asked, "Have you heard the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) say this in person”? He replied, “Yes; I swear it by the Lord of this mosque”. 
(1808) 13 - Abdallah Ibn Umar reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "Whoever raises a dog, which is not useful either for hunting or for guarding the herd, will cause two qirats (of reward) for his good works". 
(1809) 14 - Abdallah Ibn Umar reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) ordered to kill the dogs”. Chapter VI About the sheep. 
(1810) 15 - Abu Huraira reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "The height of disbelief is towards the east, where there is pride and presumption among those who own horses and camels, distinguished by their harsh voices and who live in hairy tents, and tranquility is among the owners of sheep. 
(1811) 16 - Abu Sa'id Al Khudri reported that the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "Soon, good fortune of a Muslim, will be the possession of a flock of sheep which he will lead to graze on the summits of the mountains and in places watered by the rain, thus safeguarding by his flight, his religion, troubles (which will break out)”. 
(1812) 17 - Ibn Omar reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) said: “It is forbidden for each of you to milk another's sheep without his permission. Would any of you like us to break into your house, break into your cupboard, and steal your food? So then, it is the case with the sheep that pile up in their udders the food of their owner. So it is not lawful for either of you to milk another's sheep without his permission. 1 
(1813) 18 - It was reported to Malek, that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "There is not a prophet who has not herded sheep to pasture". He was asked: “And you too, O Messenger of Allah”! he answered: “And me too”. Chapter VII About a mouse falling in fat and starting to eat before praying 
(1814) 19 - Nafe' reported that he happened that Ibn Omar was presented with his dinner at his house, and that he had listened to the recitation of the imam making the prayer. So Ibn Omar did not leave his meal before he was satisfied with it”. 
(1815) 20 - Maymouna, the wife of the Prophet (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) reported, that the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah), when asked about a mouse that had fallen into the fat, he replied: "Remove it, then throw the amount of fat, all around the place where it was fallen". Chapter VIII Of the bad luck we have to fear 
(1816) 21 - Sahl Ibn Sa'd Al-Sa'idi reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "If bad luck exists (it will be to be feared) in the horse, the wife, and the house", 
(1817) 22 - Abdallah Ibn Umar reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be the grace and peace of Allah) said: “Bad luck is in a house, or a woman, or a horse. 
(1818) 23 - Yahia Ibn Sa'id reported that a woman came to the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) and said to him: “O Messenger of Allah! We lived in a house, and we were numerous and we had an abundant fortune; soon after the number has diminished, and the fortune is lost”. The Messenger of Allah (upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said, "Leave this house, for it is a bad omen". Chapter IX Names that are repulsive 
(1819) 24 - Yahia Ibn Sa'id reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said to the men: "Who wants to milk this dairy camel"? A man arose, the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) asked him: "What is your name"? "Die (meaning 'bitter'), he replied; 'Sit down,' said the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah). Resuming the same question, another man, named "Harb" (meaning "war"). rose; and the Messenger of Allah (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said to him: "Sit down"; he put for the third time, the question, a man stood up, and answering that his name is "Ya'ich" (meaning "living"), the Apostle of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said to him: “Go and milk the camel”. 
(1820) 25 - Yahia Ibn Sa'id reported that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab asked a man: "what is your name"? - “Jamra” (meaning ember) he replied; - “Who is your father”, added Omar; - “Ibn Chehab” (which means a flame.); “What tribe are you from”? - "From Al-Houraqa" (which means burning.)- "where do you live"? - "A Harrat-el-Nar" (meaning heat from the fire) - "Where is it"? “A Zat-Liza” (meaning burning fire) -. “And Omar to exclaim: “go see your parents, who are burned”. Indeed, his parents were burned, as Omar had predicted. Chapter X Bloodletting and caregiver salary. 
(1821) 26 - Anas Ibn Malek reported that Abu Taiba, had bled the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah), he ordered him to give him the gift of a sa'de dates, as wages, also the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the mercy and peace of Allah) ordered the master (of Abu Taiba who was a slave) to give him back his tribute”. 
(1822) 27 - It was reported to Malek that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "If there is a remedy that can cure a disease, bloodletting can remedy it)". 
(1823) 28 - Ibn Chehab reported that Ibn Muhaissa Al-Ansari who was one of the Haritha tribe, had asked for the permission of the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) so that he could have a salary, with regard to the care of bloodletting; but the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) forbidding him, and Ibn Muhaissa never ceasing to ask him, he said to him: "give this salary to your slave". Chapter XI Regarding the East. 
(1824) 29 - Abdallah Ibn Umar reported: "I saw the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) waving his hand towards the east, and saying: "The; trouble will come from the. The troubles will come from there, from there rise the horns of the devil”. 
(1825) 30 - It was reported to Malek that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab, wanting to leave for Iraq, Ka'b Al-Ahbar said to him: "Do not go there, O prince of believers, for there are nine-tenths of witchcraft, evil geniuses and disease incurable”. Chapter XII Of the Killing of Serpents and What is Said About Them. 
(1826) 31 - Abu Lubaba reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) forbade the killing of snakes living in houses”. 
(1827) 32 - Saiba, a freedwoman of Aisha reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) forbade the killing of snakes living in houses except those with two stripes on their backs, and grass snakes, because they can cause blindness, and abortion of pregnant women. 
(1828) 33 - Abu Saib, the freedman of Hisham Ibn Zouhra reported: “I entered Abu Sa'id Al Khudri's house, and I found him in prayer, I sat down, waiting for him to finish his prayer. I heard a movement under a bed in his house, and it was a snake; I rose to kill him when Abu Sa'id motioned me to sit down. Then ending (his prayer) he showed me with his hand a house and said: “do you see this house”? - "yes, I answered". And he continued: “there was a young man who had just recently married, who had gone out with the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) thus participating in the battle of “Khandak”. While he was present, a young man came and said to him: “O Messenger of Allah allow me to return home, for I am newly married”. The Messenger of Allah (sallallahu alayhi wa salam), granted it to him, he said to him: "Take your weapon with you because I fear that you will meet the Bani Kouraiza". So, on returning home, the young man found his wife standing between two doors; seized with jealousy, he wanted to pierce her with his spear, she said to him: "Don't be in a hurry to kill me; come in and see what is in your house.” On entering, he saw a coiled snake on his bed; he stared at it with the tip of his spear then carried him to the threshold of the door. The snake still moving at the end of the spear, bit the man who fell dead. We did not know which was the first to die, the man or the snake. This was reported to the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) he said: “In Medina there are geniuses who have become Muslims; so if you meet one, give him a delay of three days; once it appears after this time; kill him, for he is only the devil”. Chapter XIII Summons while traveling 
(1829) 34 - It was reported to Malek that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) when he wanted to travel and putting his foot in the stirrup, he said: “In the name of Allah! Great Allah! You are the companion of the journey, and the successor in the family. Great Allah! Reduce the distance for us, and facilitate the journey for us. Great Allah! I take refuge with You from the pain of the journey, and the sadness of the return, and the bad meeting of possessions and family». 
(1830) 35 - Men in whom Malek had trust, told him that Khawla Bint Hakim reported that the Messenger of Allah (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) said, "Whoever, moves from one place to another, let him say: “I ask by the perfect words of Allah, to take refuge from the evil of what he has created. Therefore, he will not be harmed until he leaves this location". Chapter XIV On the fact of traveling alone by the man or by the woman. 
(1831) 36 - Amr Ibn Chou'aib reported from his father, from his grandfather that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “A lone traveler is a devil (1); two travelers are two devils, and the three, a convoy”. (1) Note that we mean by "devil", seized on the one who travels alone, that the latter can be the victim of a distraction, or even suffer from a pain... Thus, it is better that during a journey, that there are many traveling together. 
(1832) 37 - Sa'id Ibn Al Musaiab frequently reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “The devil can attack one or two travellers; but if there are three, he won't be able to do anything”. 
(1833) 38 - Abu Huraira reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "I is not acceptable to a woman who believes in Allah Y and on the day of the resurrection to travel alone for a day (night and day) without her being accompanied by a Zou-Mahram (a man with whom her marriage is illicit). Chapter XV What to do on a trip. 
(1834) 39 - Khaled Ibn Ma'dan reported this hadith, which he attributed to the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) where it says : “Allah Y Blessed and Most High is merciful and loves mercy, and is satisfied with it. He helps the lenient and not the violent. So, when you ride these dumb beasts, leave them in proper circles. But if the earth is barren, flee it by crossing it in an accelerated way, and travel at night, because the earth that one crosses at night seems shorter than when one crosses it by day. Be careful not to camp at night, in a public road because such roads are crossed by animals, and are refuges for snakes”. 
(1835) 40 - Abu Huraira reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “Travel is one of the aspects of torture, where one of you prevents himself from sleeping, eating and drinking. When one of you has finished his business, hurry back to his family”. Chapter XVI The act of treating the slave with leniency. 
(1836) 41 - Abu Huraira reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "One should feed and clothe the slave properly, without entrusting him with work that would be unbearable”. 
(1837) 42 - It was reported to Malek that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab went every Saturday to "Al-Awali" (towns surrounding Medina) - finding there a slave charged with unbearable work, he lightened it for him". 
(1838) 43 - Abu Souhail Ibn Malek reported according to his father that he heard Osman Ibn Affan give a sermon and say: "Do not charge a slave, to earn money, if she does not have a profession, For if you charge her, she will indulge in prostitution. Likewise, do not burden the child with work, because if he is not going to earn it, he will steal. Therefore, do not leave the slave, nor the child, to work, and Allah will shower you with His blessings. And feed them properly. Chapter XVII About the slave and his reward 
(1839) 44 - Abdallah Ibn Omar reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "If the slave gives good advice to his master, and if he sincerely worships Allah, he will have a double reward". 
(1840) 45 - It was reported to Malek that a slave possessed by Abdallah Ibn Omar Ibn Al-Khattab, was seen by Omar Ibn Al-Khattab, behaving and appearing just like a free woman. He went to his daughter Hafsa and said to her, "Why is the slave of your brother behaves and appears as a free woman, hanging out with people”? Omar, therefore, disavowed his way of acting”. MOUATTAA In the name of Allah the Merciful the Merciful Book 55 The Book of Allegiance First chapter: About Allegiance 
(1841) 1 - Abdallah Ibn Umar said: “When we swore allegiance to the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) namely to hear and obey, he said to us: "In the measure of your ability". 
(1842) 2 - Umayma Ibn Rouqaiqa reported: "I went with women to the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam), swearing allegiance to him in accordance with Islam, saying: “O Messenger of Allah!, we swear allegiance to you: not to associate anything with Allah Y , not to steal, not to commit adultery, not to knock out our children, not to show ourselves infamous either with our hands or with our feet, and not to disobey you any longer in what is proper. . The Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) answered them: "As far as you are able". The women then resumed: "Allah and His Messenger are kinder to us than we are to ourselves. So give us your hand, O Messenger of Allah. He answered them, "I not greet women by shaking hands; but what I say to a hundred of them is the same as what I say to one of them, or to one woman”. 
(1843) 3 - Abdallah Ibn Dinar reported that Abdallah Ibn Omar took an oath of allegiance to Abdul Malek Ibn Marwan, in writing, where it says: “In the name of Allah the Merciful, the Most Merciful. Then, peace be upon Abdul Malek, the servant of Allah, and the prince of believers. Praise be to Allah that there is no god but Him. I submit to listening and obeying, in accordance with the Sunnah of Allah Y , and that of His Envoy r ; as much as I can”. MOUATTAA In the name of Allah the Merciful the Merciful Book 56 The Book of Words of Backbiting, and Devotion First chapter: Unpleasant words. 
(1844) 1 - Abdallah Ibn Omar reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) said: "Whoever says to his co-religionist brother: 'O unbeliever!' This will be attributed to one of the two”. 
(1845) 2 - Abu Huraira reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "If you hear a man say: 'The people have perished (saying this in a tone of contempt or ostentation), it is he who is the worst of them”. 
(1846) 3 - Abu Hurairah reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) said: "Let none of you say: 'What a detestable fate!' For Allah is fate. 
(1847) 4 - Yahia Ibn Sa'id reported that Jesus, the son of Mary, having met a pig on the way, he said: "Go ahead in peace". pig", Jesus answered: "I am afraid that my tongue is getting used to the pronunciation of bad words". Chapter II Words to avoid. 
(1848) 5 - Bilal Ibn Al-Hareth Al-Mouzani reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "When a man utters a word pleasing to Allah, without even knowing that this word will be such, Allah, by this fact inscribes his Satisfaction to him until the day when he the And if, on the contrary, he utters a word that is disagreeable to Allah, even though he did not know beforehand that this word will be such, Allah will mark his displeasure with him until he meets Him. . 
(1849) 6 - Abu Huraira said: “it happens that man speaks words to which he has paid no attention, and that these words cause him to be thrown into the fire of Hell; and other times he speaks words, believing that they are of no importance, and that these words will belong to Paradise”. Chapter III Words that are repugnant if the name of Allah is not mentioned. 
(1850) 7 - Abdullah Ibn Omar reported: “Two men had come from the east, and were giving speeches, the men were amazed at their eloquence. So the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "There is eloquence in magic" or according to another version: "There is magic in eloquence" or according to another version: "Sometimes there is magic in eloquence". 
(1851) 8 - It was reported to Malek that Jesus, the son of Mary said: “Sometimes you utter too many words where the name of Allah is not mentioned, so your hearts become hardened. But the hard heart is far from Allah, yet you do not know it. Do not judge the vices of men as if you are lords over them; rather judge your own as servants, for among men are the chastened and the chosen. So be pitiful to towards the punished, and praise Allah for His mercy". 
(1852) 9 - It was reported to Malek that Aisha, the wife of the Prophet r (Upon him be the grace and peace of Allah) was speaking to some of his relatives telling them at nightfall: “Why don't you grant an adjournment to the scribes (meaning by that, to the angels responsible for recording good and bad deeds). Chapter IV Gossip. 
(1853) 10 - Al-Mouttaleb Ibn Abdallah Ibn Hantab Al-Makhzoumi reported that a man asked Allah's Messenger r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) about backbiting. The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (upon him the favor and peace of Allah) replied: "It is the fact of to say, concerning man, what he is reluctant to hear". And the man continues: “And if it is true, what they say: “The Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) replies, “If what you say is not true, it will be a lie”. Chapter V Of what we dread of language 
(1854) 11 - Ata Ibn Yassar reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) said: "Whoever Allah preserves of two evil members, will be in Paradise". A man asked: “O Messenger of Allah, do not speak to us about this any more. The Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) was silent, then repeated the same words. So the man said to him, "Do not tell us about it, O Messenger of Allah." And the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam), again fell silent, and a moment later repeated the same remarks. For the third time the man said, "Do not talk about it, O Messenger of Allah." The Messenger of Allah (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) willing to resume once no more the same remarks, and the man going to act just like the first time, another man being next to him, silenced him. So the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "Whoever Allah preserves from two evil limbs, he will be received in Paradise", it is about what is between the jaws and the two legs", repeating this for three times”. 
(1855) 12 - Zaid Ibn Aslam reported from his father that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab entered the home of Abu Bakr Al Siddiq, and found him sticking out his tongue(1). Umar said to him: "Stop, may Allah forgive you", and Abu Bakr replied: “It is she who pushes me to say what I fear the consequences”. (1) Taken as a metaphor, designating what one says, or speaks, thus, language part of a whole, taken for "mouth". Chapter VI Of the conversation held between two men. 
(1856) 13 - Abdallah Ibn Dinar reported: “Abdallah Ibn Omar and I were near the residence of Khaled Ibn Ouqba, located at the market. A man came, wanting to talk to him, when there was only me with Abdallah Ibn Omar, and the man in question. Then Abdallah Ibn Omar called a man so that there were four of us, then addressing me and the man who had just arrived, he said: "Stand back, because I heard the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) say: "Two among you, do not talk to each other, leaving a third apart”. 
(1857) 14 - Abdallah Ibn Umar reported that he heard the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) say: "If there are three of you, let two of you not talk to each other, leaving the third" aside". Chapter VII About sincerity and lies. 
(1858) 15 - Safwan Ibn Sulaim reported that a man asked the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah): “Can I tell lies to my wife”? The Messenger of Allah (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) replied: "There is no well in the lie”. The man continued: “O Messenger of Allah! It is so that I promise him something, that I lie to him”. So the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said to him: “If this is so, you are not committing a sin”. 
(1859) 16 - It was reported to Malek, that Abdallah Ibn Mass'oud said: "Always be for sincerity because it leads to piety, and piety to Paradise. Beware of lying, for it leads to evil which in turn leads to Hell. Besides, has it not often been said: "He spoke the truth and did good; he lied and he is perverse”. 
(1860) 17 - It was reported to Malek, that Loqman was asked: "How did you acquire all this"? Wanting to hear: wisdom. And Loqman to answer: “Thanks to the sincerity of the word, the return of the deposit and by not getting involved nothing that does not concern me”. 
(1861) 18 - It was reported to Malek that Abdallah Ibn Mass'oud said: “the servant does not stop lying until this point at the bottom of his still white heart, is all black; thus he will be registered among the liars”. 
(1862) 19 - Safwan Ibn Sulaim reported that the Messenger of Allah was asked r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah): "Can the believer be a coward"? - «Yes» he answered; he is still asked: "Can the believer be miserly"? - «yes» he answered. Finally he was asked: "Can the believer be a liar". So there, he answered: “no”. Chapter VII About the waste of money and the one who has a double face. 
(1863) 20 - Abu Hurairah reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “Allah Y is satisfied with you in three actions and rejects you in three others: “The three actions for which II Y is pleased with you are: that you worship Him and associate nothing with Him; that you attach yourself strongly to the pact of Allah; and that you provide good advice to those in power. And the three actions for which II Y rejects you are: gossip, wasting money, and asking too many questions”. 
(1864) 21 - Abu Huraira reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) said: “The worst people are those who show two faces; in some it shows one face and in others it shows another face.” Chapter IX Of the punishment of all because of the sin committed by one part. 
(1865) 22 - It was reported to Malek, that Um Salama, the wife of the Prophet (Upon him be Allah's grace and peace) asked: “O Messenger of Allah! Shall we perish, while there are among us virtuous men? The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) replied: "Yes, if corruption is everywhere". 
(1866) 23 - Ismail Ibn Hakim heard Omar Ibn Abdul-Aziz say: “It was said: Allah Blessed and Most High Y does not torture the majority because of the sins committed by a minority. But if the reprehensible is done in public, all, in this case, will deserve the punishment”. Chapter X devotion 
(1867) 24 - Anas Ibn Malek reported: "I went out with Omar Ibn Al-Khattab, and accompanied him until he had entered a garden where a wall separated us, I heard him say, while he was at the bottom of the garden: “Umar Ibn Al-Khattab, prince of the believers, be valiant! By Allah! You must fear Allah, otherwise He will punish you. 
(1868) 25 - Malek a reported that Al-Kassem Ibn Muhammad said: “I lived in the time when people (the Companions) were not deceived by words. - Malek explaining this said: "He meant that only the works and actions of people were taken into account and not fine words". Chapter XI What to say when listening to the booming thunder. 
(1869) 26 - Malek reported: “When Amer Ibn Abdallah Ibn Al-Zoubair listened to the thunder, he broke off all conversation and said: “Glory be to Allah whose thunder and the angels celebrate His praises with fear”. Then he would say, "Such is a severe warning to the inhabitants of the earth." Chapter XII From the Succession of the Prophet (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) 
(1870) 27 - Aisha, the mother of believers reported, that after the death of the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah), his wives wanted to send Osman Ibn Affan to Abu Bakr Al-Siddiq, asking him for their shares of the estate of the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah). So Aisha answered them: "The Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) did he not say: we do not have to make an inheritance; and what is left will be alms”. 
(1871) 28 - Abu Hurairah reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) said: "My successors will not have no dinars to share. What I leave beyond the maintenance of my wives and my servant, will be an alms”. MOUATTAA In the name of Allah the Merciful the Merciful Book 57 The Book of Gehenna (or Hell) First chapter: Description of Gehenna 
(1872) 1 - Abu Hurairah reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "The fire which the sons of Adam kindle is only one seventieth of the fire of Gehenna". He is told: “O Messenger of Allah! Earthly fire is enough for us”. He answered: "The fire of Gehenna exceeds that of the earth sixty-nine times." 
(1873) 2 - Abu Houraira said (addressing the people): “You think the fire of Gehenna is all red like your fire? It's actually blacker than tar." MOUATTAA In the name of Allah the Merciful the Merciful Book 58 The Book of Alms First chapter: Of the exhortation to give alms. 
(1874) 1 - Abu-Al-Houbab Sa'id Ibn Yassar reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) said: "Whoever gives alms from lawful gain, knowing that Allah only accepts what is lawful - it is as if he placed it in the hand of the Merciful, who will raise it just as one of you raises his camel or his weanling, so that it will be as tall as a mountain”. 
(1875) 2 - Anas Ibn Malek reported: "Abu Talha was one of the Ansars in Medina, the richest in palm groves, preferring of all his possessions that which lay in Bairoha, located just opposite the mosque. The Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) entered it and drank from its water gentle. Anas continuing, said, "And when the following verse was revealed: ) َ ع ل ِ يم ّ َ ه بِ ِ ه َ ف إ َ ن َ ش ْ ي ٍء ِ م ن ُ ت نف ُ ق وا َ و َ م ا ِ ح ب ُ و ن ِ م َ م ا ُ ت ُ ت نف ُ ق وا َح َ ت ى ( ل َ ن ت َ ن الوا الب َ ر (meaning) “You will not attain true godliness until you give in alms what you like" (Koran III, 92), Abu Talha went to the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) and said to him: “O Messenger of Allah! Allah, Blessed and Most High, said: "You will not attain true piety until that you will not give as alms what you love,” and the favorite of my possessions is the palm grove of Bairoha; I give it as alms for the love of Allah Y , hoping that Allah Y accept my act and reserve it for me with Him. So give it to whomever you want, O Messenger of Allah. The Messenger of Allah (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) replied: “How marvelous! Such is fruitful good! Such is fruitful good. I understood what you heard about him, and I prefer that you give to your loved ones. Abu Talha said, "I will, O Messenger of Allah and he shared it among his relatives and his cousins." 
(1876) 3 - Zaid Ibn Aslam reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: "Give alms to anyone who asks for it, even if he is on horse". 
(1877) 4 - Amr Ibn Mu'az Al-Achhali Al-Ansari reported from his grandmother that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Be upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “Believing women! that one of you does not disdain to offer her neighbor anything, even a roasted foot (of mutton). 
(1878) 5 - It was reported to Malek that Aisha, the wife of the Prophet r (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) related that a beggar had asked for alms when she was fasting, without having anything but a cake at home. So she said to her freedwoman: “Give her to him”; and freed her from replying: "You won't have enough to break your fast"? Aicha insisted, said to him: “Give it to him”. Thus done, continued the freedwoman, she said: "When it was evening, a family or a person not in the habit of making us present, gave us a roast mutton and its garnish. So Aicha, the mother of believers called me and said: "Eat this, which is better than your pancake". 
(1879) 6 - It was reported to Malek that a beggar had asked Aicha, the mother of believers, for something to eat, when she had grapes. She says to a person (being near her): “Take a grain and give it to him”. The man began to stare at her, astonished. So Aicha said to him: “Are you surprised? Do you know how many atoms of good are in this grain”? Chapter II Abstinence from asking (alms) 
(1880) 7 - Abu Said Al Khoudri reported that people from the Ansar asked for alms from the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah); he gave it to them; then they asked him, and he gave it to them, until he had nothing left to give; then he said: “what property I possess, I will not deprive you of having; and Allah will make worthy the one who refrains from asking; he who dispenses with it, Allah will enrich him; one who is patient, Allah will make him more patient; besides, no one receives a more abundant and greater gift than patience”. 
(1881) 8 - Abdallah Ibn Omar reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said, while being on the pulpit and alluding to alms and restraining from asking: “the upper hand is better than the lower hand; the upper hand is the giver, and the lower hand asks”. 
(1882) 9 - Ata Ibn yassar reported that the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) Upon him the grace and peace of Allah had sent a sum of money to Omar Ibn Al-Khattab who refused to have it. The Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) asked him, "Why did you refuse it?" Umar replied, “O Messenger of Allah, did you not tell us that it is better for one of us not to take anything from another? The Messenger of Allah (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) continued: “It is about the request; but if this is not the case, it will be a good for you that Allah Y granted you". So Umar said to him, "So, and by Allah Who holds my soul in His hand, I will not ask anything of anyone, and I will not refuse to take what will be given to me”. 
(1883) 10 - Abu Huraira reported that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) said, "By Allah Who holds my soul in His hand, let one of you take his rope and make himself a bundle of wood to carry on his back, it is better for him than to beg from a man to whom Allah Y granted from His goods, and who can either grant or refuse his request”. 
(1884) 11 - Ata Ibn Yassar reported that a man from Bani Assad reported, "We had camped with my family at 'Baqi' El-Gharqad', she said to me, 'Go to the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) and ask him to give us something to eat”, while citing their need. So I went to the Messenger of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) at whose house I found a man who asked him and to whom he said: “I find nothing to give you”; the man thus left him, while being irritated, and saying: "By my life, you give to whomever you want". The Messenger of Allah (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) replied: “Hold on! He gets irritated against me, because I find nothing to give him. One of you who asks, and yet has an ounce of silver or its equivalent, it is as if he asked with importunity”. Al-Assadi said: “A camel for us is worth more than an ounce of silver”. And Malek points out: “The ounce is forty dirhams”. The man from Bani Assad continued and said, "So I came back without asking him anything." Shortly after, it was brought to the Envoy of Allah r (sallallahu alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) of the barley and the raisin that he shared with us, so Allah was enough for us”. 
(1885) 12 - Malek a reported that he heard Al-'Ala Ibn Abdul-Rahman say, “Almsgiving never diminished the capital (of the giver); and Allah Y never gave a servant who forgives others more consideration; no servant has shown himself to be modest unless Allah Y has raised him up”. - And Malek of emphasize: "I don't know, whether this hadith can be attributed to the Prophet Upon him, grace and peace of Allah, or no". Chapter III Almsgiving that is disapproved. 
(1886) 13 - It was reported to Malek that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him be Allah's Grace and Peace) said: "Almsgiving is not allowed to the family of Muhammad, because it is only the defilement of people”. 
(1887) 14 - Abdallah Ibn Abi Bakr, reported from his father that the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) had charged a man from Bani Al-Achhal to take care of alms. The alms received, being camels, he went to ask the Messenger of Allah r (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) to give it to him. And the Messenger of Allah (salallahou alayhi wa salam) (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) became angry and it saw in his face in such a way that his eyes looked all red; so he said, “The man asks me to give it to him, which is not tolerated either for me or for him; but if I prevent it, I will feel repugnance; and if I give to him, I will give to him like this, which is not permitted either for me or for him”. The man replied: “O Messenger of Allah, I will not ask you for any more of these alms”. 
(1888) 15 - Zaid Ibn Aslam reported from his father: “Abdallah Ibn Al-Arqam said to me: "Show me a mount of these camels that I may give it to the prince of the believers to use." - "Yes", I answered, a camel alms. Then Abdallah Ibn Al-Arqam replied: "Do you like a fat and fat man to wash himself on a hot day, after which he will give you the water he used to wash what is under his izar and between her thighs, and make you drink it”? “I irritated him replied: May Allah forgive you; why are you saying such a thing to me? Abdallah Ibn Al-Arqam replied to him: "Almsgiving is only the defilement of people, which people get rid of". MOUATTAA In the name of Allah the Merciful the Merciful Book 59 The book of science First chapter: About the acquisition of science 
(1889) 1 - Malek was told that Loqman al-Hakim advising his son, said to him: “Son! Keep company with scholars, and compete with them; for Allah revives the hearts with the light of wisdom, just as he revives the earth with abundant rain”. MOUATTAA In the name of Allah the Merciful the Merciful Book 60 The Book of Imprecations of the Underdog Chapter One: The invocation of the oppressed. 
(1890) 1 - Zaid Ibn Aslam reported from his father that Omar Ibn Al-Khattab had assigned to his freedman called Hunaii, the charge of guarding the pasture, saying to him: "O Hunaii, be merciful towards people, and fear the curse of the oppressed because she is granted. Bring the small herds of camels and sheep into the pasture, but never allow the herds of Ibn Awf and Ibn Affan to enter it, for if their herds perish, Ibn Awf and Ibn Affan, will have their palm groves and crops to fend for themselves; but the owners of small herds, if their animals perish, they will bring their sons to me and say: “O prince of believers! O prince of believers! (begging me); Can I then ignore them? May your father lose you! Water and fodder are easier for me to find and give than gold and silver. I swear by Allah, they will accuse me of having oppressed them; but such are their territories and their water, where they fought in the time of pre-Islamism, and there embraced Islam. By him who holds my soul in His hand, if I did not have to take care of the goods that should serve me for the fight in the way of Allah, I would not have reserved any of their territory, not even a span”. MOUATTAA In the name of Allah the Merciful the Merciful Book 61 The Book of Various Names Attributed to the Prophet (Upon Him be Allah's Grace and Peace) First chapter: The names of the Prophet r (Upon him the grace and peace of Allah) 
(1891) 1 - Muhammad Ibn Joubair Ibn Mut'em a narrated that the Prophet (upon him the grace and peace of Allah) said: “I have five names (or nicknames): I am Muhammad; I am Ahmad; I am “Al-Mahi” that from which Allah erases the disbelief; I am “Al-Hasher” the one at whose feet people gather; and I am “Al-'Aqeb” (who is the last of the Prophets, who will not be followed by another). And the Mouwattà ended, Thanks to Allah Y The Almighty.
